put players through real life financial challenges as they compete with their
friends and worldwide opponents to be the wealthiest and most
popular player. 
Freedom Quest's Purpose/Mission?
According to Alan Greenspan, the former
Chairman of the Federal Reserve, "the number one problem in today's
generation and economy is the lack of financial literacy". Whether you 
are a fan of Greenspan or not, you cannot deny the veracity of that 
statement. Should you doubt his words, you need not look further than 
our debt load, our pitiful savings, our
love affair with consumerism, and the costly financial mistakes we as a 
society
make over and over again. Despite its importance, the unfortunate truth 
is that
financial literacy is not being taught in homes or in schools. As a 
result,
people go through life clueless and only learn the hard way; from making
 their
own mistakes.... some of them more costly than others...

Our solution is Freedom Quest: players will experience real 
life situations and have to make decisions based on real life
variables. They will then have to live with the consequences of their 
actions and see the full ramifications of unsound decisions. The 
learning is gradual, so there is no need for prior experience/knowledge;
 we will teach players everything they need to know through the game, 
and the difficulty level will increase as they progress.So going
 back to the purpose of Freedom Quest? To provide a safe learning 
environment so that mistakes can be made in the game and not in real 
life! After playing our game, players will be significantly more 
knowledgeable on financial matters, which should translate to better 
financial decisions in the real world.

story:
Tech Armory presents the Gladius

As avid gamers ourselves, all of us at Tech Armory are familiar with the loss of our PCs to burn out issues, caused either by pushing them too hard or the lack of maintenance. We created the Gladius to be a gaming machine that could run any game, at highest settings, without the need to be maintained or fear of over-heating. We achieved this by using high heat conductivity materials in combination with submersion technology, to provide a compounded cooling effect 40 times greater than that of air cooling in PCs. 

We've been hard at work for over 2 years, and with the community's help, we're ready to take the Gladius into full-fledged production. So join us and help us make the eradication of burnout a reality for all gamers. Be the first to own a Gladius today!

And, if you need further discussions on The Gladius, visit The Gladius forum thread at crowdfundingforum.com to ask your questions.

Accomplishments


Ideas Inc. Business Challenge 2011 (Top 3 Winners)


SiTF Awards 2013 (General Applications - Bronze Award)

Featured in: Digital Life Newspaper - Well-Oiled Gaming Machine

The Gladius - A Gaming PC with the Ultimate Solution to Overheating

Have you ever installed the latest game on your PC only for the graphic card to burn out just as you get into the groove? If you experienced this, you’d realize that your current cooling system for your machine isn’t really working and most of the other solutions out there are costly, high maintenance or just can’t fulfill its duties. The team at Tech Armory feels that this is just unacceptable in this day and age. We believe that everyone should be able to enjoy the games they play without any worries or distractions. And that’s when we created, The Gladius.

The Gladius is a Desktop PC with a revolutionary submersion cooling system. It is designed to be the perfect gaming machine, packing enough power to run any game at maximum settings, while providing complete protection against burn out.

Key Features

The Gladius has the following features:

1)  Passive Submersion Cooling

2)  Dual Case Design

3)  Freedom From Maintenance And Degradation

4)  The Cooling Never Stops

5)  No Additional Power For Cooling

6)  Silent Operation

7)  Graphics Card Cooling

8)  Easy Servicing And Upgrading

Passive Submersion Cooling – No Fans, No Leakage

Our passive submersion technology works by submerging PC parts into mineral oil, a non-conductive coolant that dissipates heat. The mineral oil not only provides an excellent medium for heat dissipation but also has an added benefit of preserving the parts submerged inside. Furthermore, zero fans or any active cooling devices are used for cooling.

But, that’s not all.

We solved the leaking problem that comes with submersion cooling.

All past attempts at submersion cooling have failed immensely due to a persistent leakage problem, better known as the Capillary Effect. It occurs when the cables draw up the mineral oil and cause it to travel along them, resulting in the mineral oil leaking out of the other end, for example, your mouse or keyboard.
(For a simple demonstration of this, dip one end of a piece of tissue in water and watch the liquid rise up and spread to the rest of it. SCIENCE FTW!)

Our team has worked very long and hard on this problem and we are happy to announce that we have managed to overcome the Capillary Effect in the Gladius.

Dual Case Design – Featuring The Anima System

The most distinguishing feature of a Tech Armory PC is our dual case design. It is a re-imagining of PC design, built around the idea of having two casings instead of just one. The first case is the Anima system, the red, internal heart of the Gladius, that houses the important heat generating components of the computer such as the CPU, graphics card and mother board. It is air tight, sound proof and filled with mineral oil. The Anima System makes passive submersion cooling possible with the use of high conductivity materials, convection currents and the mineral oil as a medium to cool the components during use.

The exterior case is the sleek, smooth shell that encapsulates the Anima System. It helps to funnel all heat generated away from you through the fins, keeping you cool and focused even in the most intense gaming experience.

It also gives you convenient access to your I/O ports and hard disks with its magnetic snap-ons and removable back panel. 

We plan to offer a variety of snap-on casings to allow users greater customizability in the future.

Freedom From Maintenance And Degradation

All computers require some measure of upkeep to ensure that they continue to operate at peak performance. 

Air Cooled PCs become choked with dust and hairs over time and need to be cleaned once every 3 months (as shown above). Water Cooled PCs have a chance of leakage and the pipes need to be changed every 6 months due to mold or sediments.

We overcame these issues by submerging the PC components in a mineral oil that is slow to degrade, does not evaporate and is completely anaerobic (does not contain Oxygen). This prevents the formation of rust, dust and mold. Furthermore, without any moving parts like pumps or fans, our cooling system cannot fail due to wear and tear.

The Cooling Never Stops

The problem with most cooling solutions out there is the fact that once a computer is shut down, they stop working. However, the heat remains trapped and the resulting buildup can cause damage to your components.

Our Anima system, on the other hand, provides ‘always on’ heat dissipation which passively cools the computer even when the machine has been switched off, giving the protection and cooling that it needs the most.

No Additional Power For Cooling

By using passive cooling in the Gladius, no additional power is required for cooling. This means very significant savings every year on power which is good news for all of us who like to game long hours through the day and night.

Silent Operation

Have you ever been distracted by the loud whirring of your computer fans as they try desperately to cool your PC? With the way we built The Gladius, noise is now a thing of the past. It runs so silently (under 15db) that you can hear a pin drop.

Graphic Card Cooling

Most liquid cooled computers only cover the CPU, ignoring the graphics card. However,the graphics card is usually the part most taxed by heavy gaming use. Our design takes this into account and ensures that the graphics card receives the cooling it needs.

Easy Servicing And Upgrading

With the dual case design, our plans for servicing and upgrading are very simple. Tech Armory will swap damaged/new components with a fresh set on the spot. This avoids situations where users lose their PC for several days while repairs or upgrades are done.

How Well Do We Compare To Other Cooling Methods?

We put the Gladius through exhaustive tests to ensure that it gives maximum cooling performance in any situations. Here is how the Gladius fared compared to other cooling methods:

Heat Dissipation Comparison*

*Readings were taken with ambient temperature of 30⁰C. Due to different PC parts being used, the final product temperature readings will be different than those shown here.

Specification List

We know for sure that parts get outdated quickly in the PC industry so the current specifications are a placeholder for now. We will overhaul the specs before we start shipping to the latest parts at no cost to our backers, so rest assured that you will be getting a beast of a machine.

Where We Are Now And The Next Step

We have

·  Formed a talented team in Singapore

·  Built and tested 4 generations of prototypes

·  Done research and testing on a wide variety of materials

·  Stress tested our prototypes in both length of use and heat tolerance

We have now reached the point where the only step left to get this product out to the masses is the full-scale manufacturing. As we'll need a lot of support to get the job done right, we're turning to the awesome people on Indiegogo to help us get there!

If you decide to pledge, you'll be getting a significant discount and be one of the first to boast about owning such an innovative product. But more importantly, you'll be playing a part in starting a revolution in an area where innovation has seemed to have slowed. You'll also be providing feedback and influencing the expansions we have in store for The Gladius.

About Us

Tech Armory was incorporated in 2011 by a group of gamers who were tired of having their computers burn out after extended gaming sessions. After researching the problem, we found that the burnouts were the result of the cooling systems not being able to cope with the massive heat output generated during gaming.

Using the fish tank PCs as our inspiration, we began to work on our solution. Over the next two years, we continued to refine our product, transforming a novelty project into a technology that is completely our own.

Risk and Challenges

Unforeseen circumstances like delays in the manufacturing and logistical errors may happen during the finalization of the project. But do not worry as we have multiple ready manufacturers in different countries to minimize such risk.

The components will be refreshed before the final assembly to ensure that only the latest computer components are sent to our backers. The current list is just a sample list that we will keep updated to the best of our abilities.

We already have a contract with the manufacturers, so the actual costs will not vary too greatly post funding and the backers should not need to pay additional cost for the Gladius.

Stretch Goals

$100,000 – Thank you everybody!

$200,000 – Unlocks Temperature change stickers for the inner case add-on

$300,000 – Unlocks New Colors (Decided by votes)

$400,000 – Silkscreens will be added for all Gladius

$500,000 – Every Gladius gets Solid State Drive Capacity Upgrade +120GB

$600,000 – Unlocks Faceplate augmentation – Glowing add-ons

$700,000 – Unlocks Additional Hard Drive bays in the Front Panel add-ons

$800,000 – We’ll donate 10 Gladius to charity

$900,000 – We sponsor a local gaming team for a year.

FAQ

Won't submerging components in a liquid damage the PC?
The mineral oil we use is non-conductive so the possibility of an internal short circuit is practically zero.

Is there any chance of the mineral oil leaking out?
Similar cooling technologies on other computer systems have this as a major complaint. Some of the D.I.Y. solutions out there leak all over the table or other surfaces that the computer touches. Our systems are built to be completely air-tight and will not leak at all.

How safe is the coolant?
The coolant we use is non-toxic and is even FDA approved so any accidental ingestion is safe. (It does have a laxative effect though)

What is the idle temperature of your system?
Multiple tests have shown that the temperature of the PC will rise slowly and steadily for about a period of 2 hours before finally hitting a stable temperature of +15°C above ambient temperature.

What if I decide to add on stuff after the campaign is over?
Don’t worry, we’ll be confirming your orders again before we ship and we will allow you to add on funds for your additional stuff.

Won’t the components be outdated by the time you start shipping?
We know for sure that parts get outdated quickly in the PC industry. The current specifications are a placeholder for now. We will overhaul the specs before we start shipping to the latest parts at no cost to our backers, so rest assure that you will be getting a beast of a machine,

What will be the retail price of the Gladius?
The retail price of a Gladius would be about $3488.

Is there a DIY Kit and can I just buy the case?
We do not have a DIY Kit although we realise that there is a demand for it in the PC market. We do not sell just the case because of our experience in testing components from the different brands for submersion.

Unfortunately, as PC Component Manufacturers design their products differently, there is a chance that their methods would react negatively to the liquid. Some brands use a non-standard capacitor on their circuit board that actually starts leaking its electrically conductive contents when exposed to prolonged submersion. This leads to a conductive environment in the oil that will destroy all parts submerged within.

As a result, we only offer parts that have been tested in our system, which will be covered under two years warranty.

Can I change the components in the Anima system on my own?
Tech Armory advises against this as we use specialized techniques and machinery to ensure that the Anima system is watertight. Customers who wish to change their components by themselves do so at their own risk, as we cannot guarantee that you will be able to seal it back properly.

How much is Shipping?
Unfortunately, shipping for the Gladius can be costly for a machine of its size and weight. We will strive to source for a cheaper way of getting them out but for now, please bear with us.

Shipping costs will be confirmed and billed to you when we are ready for shipping and have collected your delivery preference. No need to add shipping fees to your pledge amount. Below are current estimates of shipping costs for various countries (excludes import duties).

In case your country is not listed above, please contact us, so that we can work together to determine the optimal shipping strategy and cost.

being able to cope with the massive heat output generated during gaming.

Using
the fish tank PCs as our inspiration, we began to work on our solution. Over
the next two years, we continued to refine our product, transforming a novelty
project into a technology that is completely our own.
Risk and ChallengesUnforeseen circumstances like delays in the
manufacturing and logistical errors may happen during the finalization of the
project. But do not worry as we have multiple ready manufacturers in different
countries to minimize such risk.

The components will be refreshed before the
final assembly to ensure that only the latest computer components are sent to
our backers. The current list is just a sample list that we will keep updated
to the best of our abilities.
We already have a contract with the
manufacturers, so the actual costs will not vary too greatly post funding and
the backers should not need to pay additional cost for the Gladius.
 Stretch Goals$100,000 – Thank you everybody!$200,000 – Unlocks Temperature change stickers for the inner case add-on$300,000 – Unlocks New Colors (Decided by votes)$400,000 – Silkscreens will be added for all Gladius$500,000 – Every Gladius gets Solid State Drive Capacity Upgrade +120GB$600,000 – Unlocks Faceplate augmentation – Glowing add-ons$700,000 – Unlocks Additional Hard Drive bays in the Front Panel add-ons$800,000 – We’ll donate 10 Gladius to charity$900,000 – We sponsor a local gaming team for a year.
FAQ
Won't
submerging components in a liquid damage the PC?
The mineral oil we use is non-conductive so the possibility of an internal
short circuit is practically zero.
Is
there any chance of the mineral oil leaking out?
Similar cooling technologies on other computer systems have this as a major
complaint. Some of the D.I.Y. solutions out there leak all over the table or
other surfaces that the computer touches. Our systems are built to be
completely air-tight and will not leak at all.
How
safe is the coolant?The coolant we use is
non-toxic and is even FDA approved so any accidental ingestion is safe. (It
does have a laxative effect though)

What
is the idle temperature of your system?
Multiple tests have shown that the temperature of the PC will rise slowly and
steadily for about a period of 2 hours before finally hitting a stable
temperature of +15°C above ambient temperature. 
What if I decide to add on stuff after the campaign is over?Don’t worry, we’ll be confirming your orders again before we ship and we
will allow you to add on funds for your additional stuff.

Won’t the components be outdated by the time you start shipping?We know for sure that parts get outdated quickly in the PC industry. The
current specifications are a placeholder for now. We will overhaul the specs
before we start shipping to the latest parts at no cost to our backers, so rest
assure that you will be getting a beast of a machine,

What will be the retail price of the Gladius?The retail price of a Gladius would be about $3488.

Is there a DIY Kit and can I just buy the case?We do not have a DIY Kit although we realise that there is a demand for it in the PC market.
We do not sell just the case because of our experience in testing components from the different brands for submersion. Unfortunately, as PC Component Manufacturers design their products differently,
there is a chance that their methods would react negatively to the liquid. Some brands use a non-standard capacitor on their circuit board that actually starts leaking its electrically conductive contents when exposed to prolonged submersion. This leads to a conductive environment in the oil that will destroy all parts submerged within.As a result, we only offer parts that have been tested in our system, which will be covered under two years warranty.Can I change the components
in the Anima system on my own?Tech Armory advises against this as we use specialized techniques and
machinery to ensure that the Anima system is watertight. Customers who wish to
change their components by themselves do so at their own risk, as we cannot
guarantee that you will be able to seal it back properly. 

How much is Shipping?Unfortunately, shipping for the Gladius can be costly for a machine of
its size and weight. We will strive to source for a cheaper way of getting them
out but for now, please bear with us.

Shipping costs will be confirmed and billed to you when we are ready for
shipping and have collected your delivery preference. No need to add
shipping fees to your pledge amount. Below are current estimates of shipping costs for various countries (excludes import duties).


In case your country is not listed above, please contact us, so that we can work together to determine the optimal shipping strategy and cost.

story:
Briefly about the game:

   The game is being created since November 2014. Readiness is 35 %. The game is based on the platform Unity 3D. The genre is RPG. Currently the third level is being made. Ten levels are planned. As seen from the name of the game, the player will use magic and only magic. Forget the pleasant heaviness of the mace, put the sword and the scabbard aside, stop pimping the axe, let your shoulders rest from the shield. It’s time to steamroller the enemies by the force of magic. Burst out, freeze, groove!

Visuals and sound.

   The game has the absolutely 3D platform. The music is going to be floaty. The levels are very beautiful and atmospheric.

Brief history

   The protagonist of the game - Spellov Alexander. He was born in a farmers family but he was destined to become a great magician. One sleepless night Spellov decided to have a walk to the lake. Suddenly he meets the spirit of his grandfather who was an excellent wizard before the Great Magic Disaster. The grandfather makes his dream come true, he gave him force and opportunity to become a wizard. Alex was in a good mood on his way back to the village, he wanted to share good news with his parents. Suddenly he realized that death is near, down the hill he saw his village on fire... Who destroyed it? And why?

 Gameplay

 The magic.

In our Game primary focus is made on the skills of the hero than on different items of outfit. To become a great wizard one should go through a challenging field of endeavour. Many enemies should be destroyed on the way. And there will be enough magic spells that will help you to open up your magic power.

There will be 50 levels in the game 50 skills from elevation +10 can be found in the books that are scattered all around the world. All in all there will be three schools in the book of skills: the Magic of Life, Mana and Elimination. Each school has 12 unique spells. Each spell consists of 10 levels. There are tens of different combinations.

   For example a standard fireball. When it is improved it not only hurts stronger but gets unique opportunities. And while getting stronger it changes its look. On the first level it strikes one aim. Beginning with the third level it gets the opportunity to damage the zone. From the sixth level it has double damage bonus of personal characteristics. Since the tenth level it gets “self-directing” effect. And if in the beginning it engages only one target in case of successful hit, then on its maximum it always engages the target and fires the nearest enemies.


Inventory

   There are 4 types of items in the Game that you can use: the ring, the amulet, the bracelet and the staff.

   Destroying enemies the gamer can find the potion of life/mana which restores the relevant characteristics, staves or a pouch mood. A ring, amulet or a braceletcan be found in the pouch. 

   There will be more than 300 magic items. There will also be different books for the strengthening of the hero.

   In addition there will also be an opportunity to destroy unnecessary items and get Energy for them which can be exchanged for the improvement of different characteristics of the hero.

Enemies

   Lots of different enemies with unique characteristics can be found in the game. Some of them are very fast and furious. Some can damage you even after death. Some are slow but extremely dangerous.


About us:


Smirnov Konstantin – game director, programmer.

Shchipin Alexander – level designer, tester.


Our aim

   Inspired by such great games as Diablo, Magicka, Sacred, Neverwinter Nights, Badur's Gates, Icewind Dale, Titan Quest, Dungeon Siege we decided to transfer the spirit of magical RPG in you mobile devices. In the game there are will be loads of enemies destruction, variety of magical items and dynamic skills. So now it will be your time to judge the results of our work.

   

Risks


We are very nervous because its our first attempt to launch such a game. We hope to receive your feedback and loyalty. Since our childhood we were dreaming to create games. And now we are in several steps nearby our dream. To release our vision we need to hire more professionals: designers, programmers, testers, we need high-end equipment for testing and good expertise to build up a high quality product. By our own hands we created 35% of the game and we are keen to make the game of the future the game that we are dreaming about since our childhood. We hope that we can roll out a full version of the game in autumn with your help. Thats why we need your support. If you will be inspired by our project it will be our duty to make such a game that you will be interested to play hours and hours anywhere you will be. The game that you will be ready to share with anyone you meet. The game that will bring magic into your own life...

story:
For those who wants to see the 3D realtime Version: 
Klick > HERE to view in your Browser
(Unity Plugin necessary before playing)!


Experience HR Giger from a whole new perspective! Giger's Universe as an interactive App: the fascinating interactive Giger museum tour in 3D-technology. A unique compendium of his work, life, passion and vision. Discover a groundbreaking media production! Available for PC/Mac, iOS and Android.

Take a look at the virtual-tour-demo in the interactive Giger museum. Due to the fact that this is just a demo version, it doesn’t work interactively. With your support you get the virtual Giger museum with a lot of interactive features!


DVD Digipack with DVD Inside

>Giger's Universe is the virtual 3D-Giger museum in Gruyères. You can visit it interactive and navigate through different rooms and floors and even through the café. Every single artwork can be circumnavigated as if you were really there. If you click on an object you get a lot of additional information, audios and videos. Complex 3D effects make the experience exciting and intense.



Please share our vision on Facebook, google+, Twitter, instagram, and tell your friends!

Here you can see the DVD user interface.
This is a quick look inside - for more details (hi-res pictures) please visit "Gallery" here on indiegogo.




Giger's Universe can be visited comfortably at your home (PC/Macintosh/ TabletPC). With the funding we put the museum the architecture and the environment in 3D- technology. The basic version includes the interactive museum tour with a lot of unseen artwork information. As an add-on the DVD contains a short film documentation about the Giger Museum. In case of overfunding the product will also be released as an app for IOS and Android TabletPC Devices. We are planning  numerous additional features in the future. For hi-res visuals visit "Gallery" here on Indiegogo.





Seven years ago we met HR Giger and his wife Carmen in person. We told him about the idea to implement ​​his museum in Gruyeres 1:1 virtually. He was immediately enthusiastic and brought in his ideas: The museum should be moving, intelligent and comprehensive. At that point we had not expected, that Giger's Universe would be so extensive! Many more meetings followed, and HR Giger led us through his creepy museum and his private place. And guess what! Even his garden is so crazy that this already is worth a trip! HR Giger allowed us to film at all these places and we got insights into his working methods. He showed us artworks that had never been released before. We are proud to obtainded such an exclusive insight into Giger's life. It is very sad for us that HR Giger is no longer allowed to witness this moment. We are happy that his widow Carmen will be with us in this project.

April, 15th, 2014: HR Giger and Marco Brunner met in Zurich to start Gigers Universe.

Giger’s Universe has already passed conception stage. Now we need your financial support to do all the work which is necessary to make this project perfect. To produce Giger’s Universe we need EUR 90.000,00. The completion of the product happens in several phases and is expected on the birthday of the Giger museum in Gruyères on June, 16th 2015. All significant steps will be communicated here and on our Facebook site. As a backer you will receive the product of course at first and as a special limited edition. For more Informations, please visit our Project WebSite "Giger's Universe".



  • 3D Scanning with FARO Laser Scanner
  • Texturing (photorealistic surroundings) from real museum architecture
  • Mudboxing (Pixologic ZBrush / Autodesk Mudbox)
  • 3D Modelling with Autodesk Maya and 3D Max
  • Realtime game engine (Unity3D) authoring
  • Compatible with PC/Macintosh, iOS/Android and Console

In a complex procedure we bring the architecture and each single art- and designwork to life. First we use the latest 3D-laser-scanning technology to capture all the details of the museum, the artworks and the house and garden. After that, the entire object is shot with texture photography. From these results we generate a virtual model of the entire scene in Gruyère, including the village square.

Then all 3D-objects are scanned in detail in order to obtain a picture of the exact geometrie and make detailed 3D-models. From these data, accurate spatial reproduction and interaction with the exhibits can be possible by means of 3D-modeling. The reconfiguration of the museum is based on construction of the basic architecture. So it is also possible to create new spaces.



art Venture is a media production company in Vienna, which is specialised in virtual travels and interactive 3D-tours through museums around the world. We have already implemented a variety of such projects around the world. These are commissioned and paid for by museums. Our team consists of specialists and generalists in all areas of media production and communication. Learn more about our products and team on www.art-venture.eu.

What are your plans with the received funds?
We will use the funds to do the production of Giger’s Universe. That means to scan the museum and his environment, design the 3D interface and producing a wide range of additional content, objects and other things to make this digital monument perfect for you!

How will I get my copy of Giger’s Universe?
When we finish the the first media production for DVD, we'll send download vouchers via e-mail to everybody who backs for that – so you have a first glimpse on the project.

Will there be a production for Mac and PC as well?
Yes. We’re producing  a media package for PC, Macintosh, Tablet (iOS and Android) and Sony Playstation4 (Stretch Goal). This is a big goal for us. Your support will make it even more probable.

Do you plan to bring it onto other devices/consoles as well?
Yes. If we reach our Stretch Goal „Giger’s Game“ we will generate a PC-Game and a Application for Xbox 1. Our goal is it to provide it for as many as possible.

Where can I download the Beta Version of Giger’s Universe?
If we get your support, we provide Giger’s Universe on a download-Server to gave you some impressions of our work and the upcoming releases.

Can I make my own Exhibitions with your Production?
Yes! In case of Overfunding we will be able to develop a 3D community museum which gives you the opportunity to create your own Giger Exhibtion and share these with your friends our other communities.

How much will Giger’s Universe after your campaign cost?
We plan on a cost of EUR 35 per DVD, with reduced-price bundles and promotions for distributors and campaigners.

Will there be more features for Giger’s Universe in the future and when will they be available?
Yes. If we reach our goal of EUR 90.000,- we will make a first release of the production. If we reach EUR 1,895.000,-, we'll add a 3D community museum with special features (see stretch goals). Of course, there will be regular updates on Giger’s Universe once it is released (if necessary).

I just backed for a limited backer edition, when will I receive it?
After the campaign ends, we'll start producing, numbering and shipping the packages. Depending on the country you live, can take up to 8 weeks to receive the package.

How can I promote your project?
You can promote our project by funding, telling your friends and spreading the word about Giger’s Universe on social media worldwide and on Twitter.

story:
Pour les Français comme nous ;) Retrouvez le projet dans notre langue !

Here a pre-alpha demo of Gravit. enjoy and leave a comment!


A talented graphic designer, Jean-Baptiste Casasola, looked into Gravit. You can gaze at his first artistic research on the game.


We find that his artistic touch fit well with our project.
Here is a link to his portfolio, where you will find numerous works that rock :)

Basic game : To fund administrative costs and hire a graphic designer to produce basic graphics.

Graphic designer : To hire a full time graphic designer on the project to produce quality graphics.

Multiple environments : For the graphic designer to be able to create multiple environments in the adventure: marshy, arid, rocky, jungle, snowy

Light/shadow effects : To develop shadow effects, sunlight effects during the day and torches/campfires effects at night

Additional quests/donjons : Integration of additional quests, monsters, dungeons, bosses, treasures, mini-games, items (such as bombs, magical power, speed boots, water / lava shields, gloves of strength, etc ...)

Level editor : To make the level editor easy to use by the community, and enable an exchange system of levels / campaigns to make the game lifespan infinite

Sound engineer : To hire a sound engineer who will improve the game's sound effects

Against the clock : Addition of the mode against the clock that will enable to record your best times replay on specific levels, and to have the opportunity of watching other players best times replay

Multiplayer : Addition of the modes : co-op et versus. Several players can compete or solve side quests online (official campaigns and campaigns created by players!).

Performance optimization : To finance development in order to increase : the number of displayable characters/items, the liquids volume/realism (I would love to see a tsunami destroying everything in its path in Gravit !)

Ground/scenery distortion : To finance development so bombs are able to crack open ground or houses and flames are able to burn and attack the wood.

Porting : For the game to be available on Mac, Linux and Xbox360


"Gravit is a game that already lays its foundations very well and has a brilliant future ahead of it." Mr. Dorian71 - IndieWorld.fr

"... a great special mention for a very well-composed music, pleasant to listen and that enhances the atmosphere quite well." Mr. Dorian71 - IndieWorld.fr

"Tired of keeping your feet firmly on the ground? Gravity bothers you? You would have preferred that Newton takes an anvil on his head? And you like platform games? Then the little team of Uncommon Games is developping the game you need." - Wooly - Indius.org

"Gameplay seems to be really nice" Raphael Basaj, 1ndie World

"Oh! The game of my dreams! I can’t wait!" Sumitdasdevilised, user on IndieDB

Greenlight
Facebook
Twitter
DevBlog
Forum
IndieDB
Youtube

Any questions or suggestions? Please contact us at :
indiegogo@uncommon-games.com


Gravit is a 2D platform game mixing adventure and puzzle. You will be confronted to the end of the World.

The goal of this video game is to regroup several originalities around a main idea : a progressive change in gravity in a classic platform game.

But the word "classic" didn't delight us. So we added lots of complementary ideas designed to help you facing the gravity cataclysm : dynamic fluids for water and lava, grappling hook, sword of power, temporal vortex, anti-gravity boots...

The scenario has a real significance in our game to articulate all the elements around a main story.

As you probably understood, Gravit’s base is to play with gravity. This last is changing all along the game going through different steps. But not only does gravity affect the player. The environment and objects are also subject to its action.

Never forget, gravity can change any time!

Normal gravity
At the beginning of the game, the character will be subject to a normal gravity. He can do little jumps, leap from wall to wall, climb ropes and ladders, carry or throw light objects. A fall from few meters or a hard impact will be deadly to the character.

Light gravity
Then the cataclysm starts, gravity is decreasing of a half. We could believe we are on the moon. The character can double, even triple the length and height of his jumps. He can fall from higher level without dying and carry objects twice the initial weight. With this gravity, the character can reach inaccessible areas. Being able to cross a ravine of several meters will provide the player with a sense of power.

Zero gravity
Then comes the most original part of the game, no gravity at all. Like in the space, the character is floating in the air and can only turn on himself. But you can still move by using the scenery elements. You can use bubbles of water floating in the space to control your movements.

Reverse gravity
As it was not enough, in this step, gravity loses its control. The character is now attracted by the sky ! You need to use some elements of the scenery not to fall down in heaven. Water and lava are flying away to the sky and trees are uprooting.

High reverse gravity
For the last part, the character will be ejected to the sky. Gravity will be higher than the initial one. Your weight will be doubled : little jumps, cannot carry anything... Every action will be an ordeal.

Dynamic environments
The scenery elements respond to physical laws. The character can move objects and cross over unstable obstacles, but beware of violent shocks and big falls that will be fatal.

Dynamic liquid
In "Gravit", the liquid system that is set up enables to create any kind of hydraulic challenge (Archimedes' principle, dam, boat, mill, waterfall, ...) or simply reinforces the game aesthetic by coupling the gravity changes with realistic liquids. In zero gravity especially, the water will form big bubbles in which the player can swim to move. The player immersion is complete! (you can say that again !)

Grappling hook
The grappling hook is a rope the player can fix anywhere. Thus, he/she can throw it from one branch to another and overcome many obstacles.

The sword of power
It is a sword able to cut all that surrounds it. You can build bridges with trees by playing lumberjacks, lock mechanism by carefully cutting its gears, unlock passages blocked by rocks or cut a house in half! Your power has no limits! But the sword is also useful to solve tests in which the mechanism will be based on the objects weight: cutting an object in half is like dividing its weight by two.

Temporal vortex
This mystical object will allow you to save the world, but also help you to overcome many obstacles that you could not succeed because of time: door closing too fast, mill running too fast, projectile too fast to be avoided, …

Antigravity boots
Once equipped with these miraculous boots, you can reverse the character gravity at any time .Walk once on the ground, then once the ceiling. Some obstacles will force you to use the boots.

Mini games
Lots of mini games can be added to Gravit. Especially thanks to the game physics engine.

Level editor
The level editor is a small program that will enable you (well, mostly us!) to create levels without developing a single line of code. Thus, you can shape the ground, add items (box, trees, branches, ropes ...), add water, change the gravity, etc. ....

Death
To integrate realism in the animation of death, we used the well-known technique of ragdoll. Each body part of the character (arms, legs, head) is converted into dynamic objects that independently interact with its environment.

Music
Here are some music samples composed by Samuel PINTO SOEIRO that we find promising:


Scenario
For more information about the scenario, click on the following link : Game scenario outline


We want to create a whole world ! Not just a game !

When I look at Gravit prototype, I think that only a coating is missing to make it a small masterpiece. But make no mistake, a coating worthy of the name requires a lot of work!

For you to get an idea of what remains to be done : trying to incorporate ideas of original gameplay in an original scenery that will be in an original scenario with music and graphic designs in accordance with the set to create an authentic world. Oh ! And don’t forget that the player must be able to gradually get accustomed to the game. In short, probably one of the hardest puzzle-game to solve :)

So, with only the two of us, we find ourselves a little short to accomplish all the tasks incumbent on us. For this reason, we decided to resort to a donation campaign. In order to fund the coating worthy of our wildest dreams ! The game will be released whether we obtain a cash infusion or not. But we do not like to botch the potential of a game. This is why we appeal to you today.

This game coating only depends on you !


Help with the funding!
You can contribute to the project, we have plenty of rewards to offer you :) You can also contribute with the amount of your choice without reward, as a donation. Even $1 represent a lot (really a lot!) to us thanks to the snowball effect!

Talk about it around you!
Even if you can’t contribute financially to the campaign, you still have several options to help us. Talk about it to your friends and family, share this page on Facebook or Twitter. The more you talk about it the more what you may have invested in the project will be of a better quality! A single drop of water can make the ocean overflow! Don’t underestimate your power!


Uncommon Games history

Maximilien Moussalli : co-founder, developer, game designer
Romain Giraud : co-founder, developer
Katia Moussalli : scriptwriter
Samuel Pinto Soeiro : songwriter


Your name in the credits
Your name will appear in the game Credits in the section corresponding to your contribution. You can ask not to appear in the Credits. In this case, please contact us by email.


Digital copy
When the game is released, you will have access to Gravit download. If you want the game on platforms like Mac or Linux, you will have to be patient because our priority is to release the game on PC. The game will have first to demonstrate its success before these platforms are supported


Prototype
Access today to Gravit prototype, containing two hours of gameplay, by downloading it from our website. As well as all the game updates until its release: pre-alpha, alpha, pre-beta, beta, final game.


Beta forum
Access to a private area in the forum that will make you discover beforehand some game contents, such as the scenario (beware of spoil!), music, dungeons, items ... Also, participate in surveys/discussions that will directly affect the game! Submit your ideas, we are open to all your suggestions :)


HD Wallpaper pack
4 exclusive wallpapers in all kinds of resolutions.


Exclusive skin of the hero
Another skin for the hero can be chosen at the game launching. This skin may represent another version of the hero and/or one of the people who participated in the project: Max or Romain


Digital soundtrack
Gravit entire soundtrack composed by Samuel Pinto Soeiro will be available for download from our site.


Signed DVD version of Gravit


When the game is released you will receive the DVD version of Gravit, signed by the project members.

Signed CD version of the soundtrack
You will receive the CD version of Gravit soundtrack, composed and signed by Samuel Pinto Soeiro.

Signed poster
Receive Gravit poster using A3 format, signed by the project members.

Access to the level editor
Get access to the alpha version of the game level editor, allowing you to very easily create levels, and even entire campaigns and to share them online. For an overview of the Level editor preview

Philosopher*

"Max: But I'm telling you I'm not drunk ..."
Choose the skin of your character, his/her name, when he/she will appear in the game, what he/she does and what he/she says if one talks to him/her.

Troubadour*

"Max : ♪ I sing in the rain ♪, @%$!&§ guitar!"
Choose the skin of your character, his/her name, when he/she will appear in the game, what instrument he/she plays, what he/she says or sings, and the original music you composed. If you don’t have any music composition, we can always make one for you :)

Stallholder*

"Romain : Come and play to win balloons! Oh! Oh! Help me!" Choose the skin of your character, his/her name, when he/she will appear in the game, what mini-game he/she is offering, what he/she says.

Cheiftain*
Create your own level that will be integrated into Gravit adventure. The size of the level remains however limited to 10 HD screens, which is more than 500 meters of challenges of your choice. You just have to briefly draw/describe your ideas so that we can model them.

The Big Boss*
Choose the boss skin, its name, behavior , how to beat it...

The Architect*
Have you always dreamed of creating your side quest in games like Zelda? Don’t miss this opportunity with Gravit! Create your own quest with its story, its characters, its challenges, a boss that will protect an exclusive item of your invention! The story should not be long (less than 3000 letters), and must contain few characters (3-4 max). For more information, see the details of rewards: Philosopher & Chieftain & The Big Boss.

* For some obvious reasons, please note that we cannot accept every ideas! (technical problems, offensive ideas or out of context ...). We keep thus a minimum of control over your propositions. If your idea seduces us, we are ready to make more efforts to achieve it. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions about this.


On what platforms will Gravit be available, and when?
On PC in the first place, then on Xbox360, Mac and Linux if the game is successful. We want to release the game around the end of 2014 !

What lifespan will have the game Gravit ?
The prototype itself already counts up to two hours of gameplay. It is still early to determine Gravit final time of gameplay but we think we can exceed ten hours, and more depending on the campaign financing. In addition, thanks to the level editor, you will be able to play campaigns created by other players, allowing you to enjoy an endless lifespan !

In what languages will Gravit be available?
The game should include French and English. Depending on the financing, here are the other targeted languages : German, Italian, Spanish, Korean, Chinese, Japanese. If the fundings are too short, we will use an emerging concept : Weblate that would enable a basic translation by internet users.

Will Gravit be subject to digital rights management ?
The game will not be subject to such protections. However, if you choose to have the game on a platform like Steam, the game will be subject to its rules.

When will I get my rewards ?
Most rewards will be delivered after the game's release, however, some digital rewards can be sent to you earlier.

Can I improve my rewards ?
No problem ! Indiegogo doesn’t directly handle such possibilities, but here is how to proceed:
1 . Make a new contribution of an amount equal to the difference between the two rewards.
2 . Send us an email at indiegogo@uncommon-games.com with your user name on Indiegogo and point out the improvements you are willing to make.

An example : You ordered the "Traveler" reward at $30 and you want to get the "Adventurer" reward at $60. So send us a $30 contribution and an email. That’s it :)
Please note that it does not work with discounted rewards!
story_txt:
Pour les Français comme nous ;) Retrouvez le projet dans notre langue !
Here a pre-alpha demo of Gravit. enjoy and leave a comment!


A talented graphic designer, Jean-Baptiste Casasola, looked into Gravit.
 You can gaze at his first artistic research on the game.


We find that his artistic touch fit well with our project. Here is a link to his portfolio, where you will find numerous works that rock :)

Basic game : To fund administrative
costs and hire a graphic designer to produce basic graphics.
Graphic designer : To hire a full time
graphic designer on the project to produce quality graphics.
Multiple environments : For the graphic
designer to be able to create multiple environments in the adventure: marshy,
arid, rocky, jungle, snowy
Light/shadow effects : To develop shadow effects, sunlight effects
during the day and torches/campfires effects at night
Additional quests/donjons : Integration of additional quests, monsters,
dungeons, bosses, treasures, mini-games, items (such as bombs, magical power,
speed boots, water / lava shields, gloves of strength, etc ...)
Level editor : To make the level editor easy to use by the
community, and enable an exchange system of levels / campaigns to make the game
lifespan infinite
Sound
engineer : To hire a sound engineer who will improve the
game's sound effects
Against the clock : Addition of the mode against the clock that will
enable to record your best times replay on specific levels, and to have the
opportunity of watching other players best times replay 
Multiplayer : Addition of the modes : co-op et versus. Several
players can compete or solve side quests online (official campaigns and
campaigns created by players!).
Performance optimization : To finance development in order to
increase : the number of displayable characters/items, the liquids
volume/realism (I would love to see a tsunami destroying everything in its path
in Gravit !)
Ground/scenery distortion : To finance development so bombs are able to
crack open ground or houses and flames are able to burn and attack the wood.
Porting : For
the game to be available on Mac, Linux and Xbox360

"Gravit is a game that already lays its foundations very well and has a brilliant future ahead of it." Mr. Dorian71 - IndieWorld.fr"... a great special mention for a very well-composed music, pleasant to listen and that enhances the atmosphere quite well." Mr. Dorian71 - IndieWorld.fr"Tired of keeping your feet firmly on the ground? Gravity 
bothers you? You would have preferred that Newton takes an anvil on his 
head? And you like platform games? Then the little team of Uncommon 
Games is developping the game you need." - Wooly - Indius.org"Gameplay seems to be really nice" Raphael Basaj, 1ndie World"Oh! The game
of my dreams! I can’t wait!" Sumitdasdevilised,
user on IndieDB


GreenlightFacebookTwitterDevBlogForumIndieDBYoutube
Any questions or suggestions? Please contact us at :indiegogo@uncommon-games.com

story:
Want updates on the game & my other games? Join our verified Discord!

About the Game

SCP: Rebirth is my latest project and is based on the SCP Universe. This is going to be my major project and I will work on it as a full-time job for a while, at least until the game is released. SCP: Rebirth is a game that is being designed to provide you with a very aesthetic storyline closely related to the SCP Foundation. Your character used to be a member of "Are We Cool Yet?" and designed numerous possible world-ending SCPs. Eventually, you were caught by the foundation and thereafter held captive as a Class D for seven years until Chaos Insurgency raided the foundation you were kept in and broke you out. A strange old man (which you feel is closely related to "Nobody") knocks on your door one day and asks you a life-changing favour, one he wants in return for the Chaos Insurgents breaking you out. They had no idea what they were dealing with, and you were the cause of it all. There is only one way out.

With a decently-sized fun and engaging storyline, the game will feature numerous endings judging by the actions you take during the story and is being developed in the Unity engine. By donating to the IndieGoGo, you will greatly help fund the development as I am currently working on it on my own as a full-time job with absolutely no profits, so funding development is going to hard on my own. The game will be free to play and will be available on Steam. I intend on porting the game to other platforms later on. You are able to view the first reveal of the game on posts on my Patreon page. Keep in mind that everything seen on this page does not represent the final product at all and will severely change over time.

About Me

I'm a young indie game developer and have always been very interested in programming. I have developed many successful modifications for many successful games (some of my mods over 80 000 people have downloaded) and had always loved the concept of getting my work out to the public. After getting out of the baby steps (modifications) and getting into the bigger steps (making video games), it wasn't the easiest transition to make. Making video games is not easy and can cost a lot of money to produce. After I heard that I can fund a video game that I am going to make, I was fascinated, knowing that I can get some funds to help the game grow to its full potential before it even releases. My only revenue at this point in time is from selling modifications for a game I used to play a lot.

What do I get out of backing? Where will the funds go?

I'm trying to raise at least one thousand dollars to help fund the production of the game, to spice it up in every little detail and make it as best as I can. The game will be entirely free so all of the revenue generated will either be from IndieGoGo, sponsors or my Patreon page. All of this money will go towards developing the game. I've already got numerous talented voice actors willing to help for free, and it would be great if I can pay my entire team including them to increase production value.

When will the game release?

It is hard for us to say when the game will release. By funding, the game will take a lot less time to develop and the game will have higher quality. If the game gets no funding and remains in its current state, the game is expected to release by 2021. If we reach our goal, there is a possibility we may be able to release in 2019 or 2020.

By funding, the game will take a lot less time to develop and the game will have higher quality. If the game gets no funding and remains in its current state, the game is expected to release by 2021. If we reach our goal, there is a possibility we may be able to release in 2019 or 2020.

story:
In brief:

The project will use fixed funding. This means that if it doesn't reach the amount we're asking, you'll get your money back.

This project is about the production of a multi-specist alien squad at 1:56 scale (28 mm). The miniatures will be cast in metal.

Each alien will have two different heads. Most of them have separate arms and a couple of them have separate legs too. Since the torsoes are the same for most of the squad, you will probably be able to make some combos we haven't thought of.

The guns have been made via computer by the excellent and very cool John Bear Ross (or JBR) and the troopers with putty by Pierre-François Jacquet (or PF).

The squad:

1) Dylothian squad leader:

                               

2) Tabili shocktrooper:

                              

3) C' crysh shocktrooper:

                              

4) Nabh shocktrooper:

                                 

5) Hent squad leader:

                           

6) Lord of Xaam sniper:

                         

7) Majalan shocktrooper:

                           


8) Gobarite shocktrooper:

                           

9) Kurabian shocktrooper:

                        

10) Ovolo shocktrooper:

                       

Why make an Indiegogo campaign?

This squad is already a reality. The models have been made. We even had some samples done and painted by j3r3m1 as you can see.

The models now have inserts so they aren't too difficult to assemble.

Now, we need your help so we can make some new moulds. They will be made by an independant profesional mould maker.

If you think that in a far future where there is mostly war, there aren't enough species to annihilate, help us produce the toughest aliens in the galaxy! ; )

What do I get if I help?

You get unpainted miniatures.

For 21 EUR, you will receive a five "man" squad. Choose A or B squad.

Shipping included in European Union. Add 3 EUR outside of European Union.


For 36 EUR, you will receive a ten "man" squad. A + B.

Shipping included in European Union. Add 5 EUR outside of European Union.


For 60 EUR, you will receive two squads of ten aliens (20 miniatures). Once again, the aliens have two heads and some arms may be swapped or reposed so you could have twenty different aliens. However we don't want you to be disappointed so if your hobby skills are very limited, choose a lesser pledge level. 

Shipping included in European Union. Add 5 EUR outside of European Union.


For 100 EUR, you will receive two squads of ten aliens as described above (20 miniatures). Plus you will work with us on designing an unique alien head of one of the obscure species of the Federation so you can have your own fav guy. It will be truly unique as we will send you the head sculpt along the casts of the miniatures. The head will be sculpted in duro/ green stuff so it is resistant and durable.


For 300 EUR, you will receive two squads of ten aliens (see 60 EUR pledge). Plus you will work with us on designing a new unique shocktrooper of one of minor species of the Federation so you can have your own fav guy. We will send you the original sculpt as well as ten casts of it. We will keep a few casts for us as a souvenir.
The price might seem high but we'll try to make the alien as you wish it to be so we're talking about a complete new sculpt (plus a mould for it). If you're interested and think we could reuse some parts of the armor already made, we might consider making two guys instead of one. We'll discuss it privately.
There might be an additional delay for this level.

Will there be some bonuses in case the campaign is a success?

If we raise 4500 EUR, we will add a dr'akk armed with a heavy weapon and you'll receive it in addition of your minis. Citizen and scout levels excluded.

                 

If we reach 5000 EUR, we will add an officer and you'll receive it in addition of your minis. Citizen and scout levels excluded.

                

If we have more money, we have a couple of other bonuses to add but we'll see and we'll tell you in updates.

Do you have some other pictures of the miniatures?

Yes. Please see the following link for more pictures including bigger ones, back views, pictures of the sculpts with several angles, comparison pictures, etc.

http://spaceoperaminis.blogspot.fr/search/label/New%20federation%20project

Will it be possible to buy the miniatures from you if the Indiegogo campaign doesn't succeed?

No, that's very unlikely.

When will I get my toys?

Once the Indiegogo campaign is over, add one or two months for mould-making and then say another month for shipping everything and you receiving your package. Let's say june 2014. We find it more reasonable to tell you this than promise you'll have the squad sooner and disappoint.

Risks and challenges:

The squad is 95% finished. Things to do are:

-a second head and a new set of arms for the C'crysh. We will show you them before the end of the campaign as well as some other pics.

-the moulds. 

So we're confident things shouldn't get much delayed and that you will have your shocktroopers in a few months as mentioned above.

A bit of background:

The species among the Federation are many. Not all of them can join the shocktroopers. They need to meet several criteria:

-They must be able to carry and use the Unifier MK I gun. It usually means they got fingers but that's not mandatory.

                                

-They must be able to feed on the Standard Nutrient Of Troops. However, some species may join the shocktroopers because they can live without eating for long periods or can buy and carry their own food.

-They must be able to understand the orders. They may be transplanted with the Federation Universal Comprehension Kit for that. They don't need to be able to speak. They're shocktroopers not diplomats. Each shocktrooper gets an additonal chip for pinpointing him or her in case he or she is lost or missing. Non commisioned officers and Officers on theaters of operations are chosen among the species able to express orders through sound, usually vocal cords.

-They must have a minimum level of tolerance toward other species. Some species among the Federation are actually better at warfare than the ones found in the federal shocktroopers but if they can't live and fight next to other races, they are usually enlisted in special auxiliary forces such as the loors.

For more blahblah about the most encountered species in the shocktrooper corps see there:

http://spaceoperaminis.blogspot.fr/2014/02/painted-troopers_17.html

Warning:

These miniatures aren't toys and aren't suitable for children under the age of 14.

These miniatures require assembly.

story:
Project Summary

<Project Ivalon> is a Classic 2D Mature/Fantasy RPG made using RPG Maker XV Ace, Custom Engine and Custom Ruby Scripts.

Ivalon, a world ripe with strife and political intrigue. A world where people born with the ability to use <Incant> termed as <Maharlikas> and normal people called <Jindios> reside. <Jindios> are often cast aside as second-rate citizens while <Maharlikas> are often the ones who holds the seat to power, albeit feared and sometimes discriminated against.

The <Rune of Selwyn> is one of the most sought after treasure in <Ivalon>. It has been said to possess infinite power and knowledge and anyone who is able to obtain it will have the ability to manipulate the very fabric of reality.

Rauss, an adventurer and fame/fortune seeker is on a quest to obtain the <Rune> and for what reason? To obtain riches beyond imagining and to get a status above the small folks of Ivalon. But is that all?

Game Features:
Classic 2D Graphic Style
Anime-esque Art
Anime-esque Animation for Sequences
Class System
Action-Skill/Turn Based Combat System
Dating Sim

We are looking to add:
Farming System
Alignment/Relationship System
Multiple Endings
Small Monster Capture/Breeding System
Action-Skill/Turn Based Combat System
Dating Sim


A Look at the Battle System

(This by no means is the final system, it will be based on Yanfly's Battle Engine with some tweaks and further add-ons)


Art Book and Monster Book

Menu Prototype


(Thanks to Yanfly  for their awesome scripts)


Why so few images/videos/gameplay footages of the game?

Good Question. We are only two weeks into the game at the moment. The most we have is the story/script of the game. Arts and some small game sequences. Some flowcharts and we are still polishing the battle system.

We will keep updating this weekly or every 3-4 days from now along with our Facebook and Website.

When is the planned release?

Target Release would be Q4 2015. We aim to take as much time possible into this game so the finished product would be polished and we can add as much features as we can.

What platforms will you release to?

PC only at the moment.

What Games have you made before?

A lot! Most are lame from my early days. None of them were sold and only distributed to friends and family. We are thinking of adding them as free downloads to our website. But please...go easy on them as most of them were made when I was 14 (I am 27 now)



Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways you can help us.
1. Be one of our artists (We have 2 but i believe we need more)
2. Be one of our composers (We have 1 and also we believe we need more)
2. Send questions/feedbacks
3. Help us market the game to more people

For Questions/Suggestions or even RANTS.

Email us at: melwynne.santos@gmail.com

NEXT UPDATE ON March8, 2014

(Art, A few game footage and ....maybe just maybe... a video featuring one of our artists at her work)

story:
Yes, draw any 3D racetrack with one finger.

So, 12 months, 100,000 lines of code - and it works!

Grab the technology preview right now...just click...

If you've got a Mac, try it now. Click HERE to download the free "tech preview" right now. Windows, iPhone and Android preview underway!

That's 1932racing.com/gogo.zip

It's real: stick your finger on the screen and draw your own track.

The software creates the real 3D track, there and then.  (There is no offline processing, server processing, or any cheats.)

HEY! During the IGG campaign only, get your name literally INSIDE THE GAME, on a vintage billboard .... be sure to read the amazing perks listed on your right!

This is not a cheap system that "bolts together pieces." or any such trickery. It's as if a 3D modelling crew built a ground-and-track system in Maya - per your "map" - triangle by triangle.

Beautiful, simple vintage racing - let's race!

It's the 1930s and you're on a plain in the Dolomites. Stick your finger on the screen and draw whatever track you want - straights, esses, tights - and yeah, even bridges. (That almost killed us! You can only do one bridge so far in the preview!)

Just scribble (or carefully draw!) a track, as seen from overhead.

Did we couple this technology with some rubbish car models you've seen a hundred times? No way - vintage open-wheel racing is here. Enter a beautiful world designed, lit, and directed by an artisan studio.

If you love vintage race cars...

If you love vintage race cars, and don't care about technology, join us, please!

We definitely, want to hear from everyone interested in 30s vehicles - the magical era. We changed our minds often regardng what the title year should be - hopefully you agree that 1932 captures a real spirit that is special. Be sure to read the $50 perk on the right where YOU can decide on a car - have a look.

Proudly built by men in sheds...

There is too much crap in the world lately. People try to suck money out of the system with franchises, repackaging, and marketing. In contrast we believe that if you actually MAKE something, something NEW AND GOOD, the world gets better. Join us!

Crowdfunding is the end of marketing crap - either you like the game or not. All the crap is "disintermediated" - it's just you and us. Get on board. You're going to LOVE having your name actually on the front loading screen of a big video game title.

Terribly Clever Perks - check it out

Please read about some of our rewards on the right. Get your name in the game on a vintage 30s hoarding. Virtual!

If you care about game development, please join the beta team, or get content updates sent to your device as we produce the game.

Join the factory team to decide a cars you want in the game. If you know 30s cars, it's for you!

And indeed get encrypted unlocks to drive an exclusive car and paint jobs, as you'd expect. If you're not already a car fan, google up the Delage 15S8, and the unusual "tank" bodied Bugatti - from the era!

Please read about the ingenious credits!

We know that supporters want to see a backer credit on IGG projects. We've made an effort on this - backer credits will actually appear in the game, in fact on the front page (just by our names!), in a random rotation.

Note that, in fact, your backer credit will even appear in the preview app. True! They are fed to the tech preview app from a server. So if you purchase a perk just now, in a couple of hours it will actually show up in the preview app. So every single person using the preview app, in all platforms, worldwide, will see that credit! This is a fantastic way to show your support for this new technology.

Of course, you'll also appear on the actual "credits" page of the game in a fun scroll...in fact in the order of purchase - so be sure to buy a perk now! And naturally all backers will be listed on the 1932racing.com web page - the prettiest page on the web!

(Again, in the order of purchase - so it's a good reason to buy a perk now!)

Literally get your name built in to the game.

These days big companies actually pay to be in "roadside ads" in video games. You can do that in 1932 Racing! Read down to the "You are in the build..." perk. Your backer credit will literally be built in to every copy on all platforms of 1932. As players drive around, from time to time they will see these supporter "billboards" from the ten available "$70 backers"!!

Now if you don't want to spend $70, spend $15 and get your name in YOUR copy only of the game! (There'll be a personalised code to enter, confirmed on the servers, to make this work - you'll love it.) This is a great perk for kids, or anyone.

Note! Only family-friendly names accepted for all backer perk displays! Heh!

email help@smhk.com

That's our email address, use it! Don't forget if you want to see this made, tell some friends! That's really the key to crowdfunding!

If it's a game, it's going to be Unity3D©. If it's Unity3D, it's going to use middleware from Unikron©. And if it's complicated, the source control is gonna be PlasticSCM© from Codice in Barcelona - the only way to go! Let's drive!
