story: cpu gpu and some other stuff
story_txt: cpu gpu  and some other stuff

story:
Following our successful  campaign, our  campaign is set to unlock the Terran Shield stretch goals. 

Terran Shield is a tactical underwater and above water turn-based game where you must defend the Earth against an unexpected alien invasion.

 

Continuing in the line of X-Com and Jagged Alliance series, Terran Shield proposes new gameplay features and a rich and detailed graphic style developed using the powerful Unreal Engine 4. Furthermore, a complex AI that learns and adapts to the player's style will challenge them to play at their best, crippling their efforts to save humanity from the menace of the infamous alien rulers "The Council of The Six"!

Some of the important features that Terran Shield brings to the table:

  •  A Time Units based central mechanic to sustain a multitude of gameplay actions that can be executed in any order, for a rich and complex gameplay;
  •  The Six Headed Hydra AI, which can gather resources from the ocean bed, expand, attack player's bases, research new tech, manufacture weapons and breed minions. Also, on higher difficulty levels, it analyzes the player’s game style and reacts to it, tricking him and exploiting his weaknesses;
  •  A reaction fire system (old X-Com games style) combined with the interrupt system (Jagged Alliance style), that make for a dynamic combat gameplay on the adversary turn;
  •  A complex Inventory menu that allows the player to pick up items, dead or stunned aliens, weapons and ammo from the floor, change weapons, change weapon's ammo etc.
  •  Top view base management with building modules: in case of an alien base attack, the module arrangement is crucial because if the aliens reach critical areas they can steal info or even destroy the human base; 
  •  Underwater and land environment generated random maps, each with their unique characteristics and gameplay style;
  •  The upgradable transport and battle vehicle The Squid, which can be specialized through a unique research tree at player's liking;  
  •  The Aquanaut and Soldiers abilities that will improve after every mission, in direct relationship with their usage; also, unique perks that specialize the unit and make it more powerful; these can be unlocked for every human unit (scientists, too); 
  •  Fully destructible environment and assets powered by Niagara VFX toolset;
  •  Full 3D graphics with high definition textures and dynamic lighting.

 

Get into the battle and fight the menacing alien threat in the luxuriant Borneo jungle. Help the Terran Shield forces find The Lost Shrine of UM hidden alien base and reduce their influence on this part of the globe.

 Here is the playthrough of our alpha demo on Superhuman difficulty level, with live commentary and explanations. We wanted it to be a loss-free mission, but this time the aliens got Melnikoff with their terrific sonic gun.

Terran Shield playthrough on Superhuman (Alpha demo )

The aliens will take no prisoners and will fight to the last one. They are faster, with more Time Units, more Stamina and they have a 320 degree arch vision due to their laterally placed eyes. They see better in this jungle environment than us and it is likely they will spot us well before we spot them.

In addition, they are equipped with the powerful Sonic Gun that is extremely precise at any range and has a tremendous destructive power. Also watch out for the mighty alien superblaster grenade, with a smaller explosive range than ours, but with more firepower and longer throw range.

Last but not least: do not hastily engage on higher difficulty levels from the beginning. Without a proper expertise and experience on the tactical battlefield, you will find the combat frustrating and impossible to win.

Terran Shield long trailer

 

The most important part of Terran Shield is its strategy core component. We are striving to provide the best in the game’s other areas (graphics, sound, effects and animation), but strategy and tactics shall remain our main focus.

 

Time Units

The other core goal of our philosophy is to provide the player with the freedom to express themselves within the game: the freedom to play according to their own unique style and not get penalized by the game as a result of that. One of the main features a TBS can employ to achieve this are the Time Units.

The player is aided to better manage the soldier time units by the moving area graphic representation. Inside the blue area he can move and shoot, in the green area he can move and use the item in the other hand (throw a grenade, in this case) and in the red area he can only move and change stance to get better cover during the alien turn.

 

Damage types

Another feature that adds more depth to the strategy and tactical areas are the damage types. There are seven types of damage for the tactical combat (Battlescape) and three types of damage (kinetic/explosive, electric, sonic) for the Geoscape battles.

 

Stances

Another feature that takes benefit from the time units game mechanics are the stances that the soldier can have during combat. All the stances have their benefits and drawbacks. For the Air Force soldiers, the crouch and prone stances improve the aim, decreasing the chance to be hit by the aliens at the same time, but they lower the movement speed of the unit making the soldier vulnerable to enemy reaction fire.

The aim of the soldier is enhanced by 7% if going into crouch stance. That change of stance uses 7 time units, but gives the soldier just enough accuracy to hit the target.

The aquanauts have their stances, too: normal swim, fast swim mode and the additional shooting with medium and great support. The last two are available when the aquanaut finds something solid to grip himself onto, in order to avoid being snaked by underwater currents and miss the shoot.

Geoscape and base building

The Geoscape is the game level where the player can construct bases, intercept hostile alien crafts, launch missions, harass alien harvesting sites and bases. It will have all the old features of the ‘90s old and loved TBS games, plus some of the new features that we have in mind for our game.

The Squid detecting an alien base and targeting an alien medium fighter.

Building the environment and the destructible assets

The environment possesses resistances to certain damage, as well as vulnerabilities. The player will need to take this into account when attacking or hiding behind environment objects. The environment shall be fully destructible, but certain objects like rocks can be destroyed only with heavy artillery fire or explosives.

Our current tactical map terrain is a fixed layer over which the map generator lays several types of destructible assets, foliage and fauna. Having various heights on the terrain makes the random module placement very difficult to design because the edges of the modules won’t match perfectly. For the creation of a real generated terrain from modules we need additional financial resources. Until then, the current setup can make several different maps for the same landscape map, because the assets that lay over it are very diverse. For instance, on the same structure map, we can have in the same place rocks, or a building, or a forest.

More about the game can be found here.

The AI

Having Razvan Florian, one of the lead scientists on neural networks in our team will also aid us in this difficult endeavour. Because an AI of the complexity we need typically runs on very powerful servers, we must pack it and make it work on a usual PC, which is not an easy task.

More about the AI can be found here.

 

The story begins around the year 2035, with a rich treasure hunter named Rick Stenk and his wife Tina, who are searching for a lost artifact called “The Gift of Poseidon”. After months of no tangible results and with the aid of the psychic medium Ana Velkova, they finally manage to find the location of the precious artifact in a submerged cave near Crete.

After the discovery of the Poseidon Cave, Rick receives a phone call from his brother Eugene about a strange underwater footage in the Black Sea. On it, some unusual creatures resembling frogs can be observed, clearly intelligent, working around some underwater optic cables (the cables were ours, obviously). As nobody has a better diving team, Rick is asked to help the ongoing on-site investigation, as soon as possible.

More about the story can be found here.

 

The aliens appear to be perfectly adapted to both land and water environment, which leads us to believe that their strategy is to first invade the marine depths so that later they can surface and conquer the landmasses.

Ka-Um-La

Usually, the first alien encountered by Terran Shield forces in the game, named The Frogman by the aquanauts due to its appearance, the Ka-Um-La is anatomically closely related to lizards. Well adapted to an underwater environment, it uses its strong tail to swim fast and to suddenly change direction.

Its large eyes enable it to see very well in limited lighting conditions and the electro-sensors provide the ability to orientate in muddy waters. On its toes the Ka-Um-La has gecko-like pads, which can be used to climb vertical walls, thus making it a formidable foe in urban areas.

Jellyfish Sentry

This strange creature, named the Jellyfish Sentry by the aquanauts, is a gelatinous invertebrate that has received several unknown device implants at the hand of its alien overlords.

Due to its bioluminescent bacteria pouch, which can be used as a beacon, we can assume that this creature is used as a scout, uncovering the terrain and dangers that lie ahead of the alien assault units. Being a transparent creature makes it very difficult to detect in an underwater environment. The weak electrical signals it generates make it nearly invisible to the aquanauts' sensors and therefore extra effort is required to locate this perfect alien spy.

Ud'Glee

Ripper, killer, monster.

The incarnation of all the horrors lurking and hiding in the dark depths of the oceans.

The large eyes and the small fluorescent lure on its forehead are indicative of a creature that is very well adapted to the dark ocean depths. It comes as no surprise that the 6 alien rulers have assigned the sonic gun to this monster, given that its vision and perception area in an aquatic environment are unparalleled. If the aliens have more specimens of this living horror in their army, then it seems that we have already lost control over the Earth’s oceans! The only way for us to regain it and have a chance to stop the alien invasion is to capture and research one of those sonic guns, the weapon this monster handles with ease. But that is easier said than done…

More about the aliens can be found here.

Alien weapons

Designing the alien weapons was not an easy task. They must be designed and manufactured underwater by the alien scientists, so we had to invent a totally new manufacturing process. Also, they have to work in the air as well as underwater and they should be produced in large numbers in a short time.

The Gel Gun

The gel gun is designed to isolate the enemies by forcing them to avoid the areas covered in the weapon`s gel and thus forcing them to reveal their position.

The weapon can also be used to capture enemies that have had the misfortune of becoming trapped in the gel. The cartridge launched by the gel gun is propelled only a relatively short distance by means of a chemical reaction in the weapon. Once the cartridge slows down, it opens up and releases a powder which, when in contact with the surrounding water transforms into a sticky gel, forming a compact, irregular mass of approximately 6 meters in diameter. Any creature that becomes trapped in the gel will find it very difficult to become unstuck, as the gel acts like a spider web.

Sonic Gun

Unsurprisingly, the sonic gun is the main assault weapon used by the alien forces. 

The technology behind this artifact is incredible. Human researchers have admitted that even though they have a partial understanding of how the weapon works, they have no theory that can explain the existence of an energy pulse that can maintain the amplified sonic waves and only release them when coming into contact with a solid surface. The nature of the type of energy capable of moving at the speed of sound, while encapsulating the sound waves produced by the weapon, is entirely unknown to humans.

 

 

The Squid

During the whole game, the main and most powerful Terran Shield ship and transport will be the Squid. The Gods’ gift for humanity is no ordinary ship. It can evolve in time and as the players progress in the game, its super-powerful batteries are charging to their full potential unlocking new offensive and defensive abilities.

The Squid can be upgraded from its initial hiding place, the Poseidon Cave, where the scientists can find hints on how to unlock its powers. The Squid research branch will be very important in late game where the ship will have to compete with the enormous dreadnoughts of the aliens, with big shields and big guns.

More about the weapons can be found here.

 

Terran Shield Aquabase

The aquabases are constructed in underwater caves or, more frequently, directly on the bottom of the ocean floor. 

 

On this particular base iteration, maybe it wasn’t such a good idea to put the war module near the alien containment module. Should one of them escape, it could break havoc on our aquabase.

They are made from a few types of base modules and can host only 2 or 3 aquanaut teams. They can have alien containment modules, sub pens, sonars, living facilities, but no manufacturing of research facility. The main reason for that is that the underwater bases are filled with water, thus restricting those kinds of facilities.

The Aquanaut

The aquanauts have had gills implanted and their lungs have been modified with a special film that can collect the oxygen from the water and deliver it to the alveoli. In addition, their eyes were modified with a supplementary reflective area in their back, so that they can see 3 times better in low light environments than a normal human.

More about the Aquanaut and his equipment.

 

 

The Air Force soldiers and tactical battles

With his initial light armour and equipped with kinetic and electric weapons, the Terran Shield Air Force usual soldier can seem an easy target for alien forces that do so well in dense forests and humid environments. But this is a mistake, for all Terran Shield Air Force soldiers are experienced and well-trained professionals from all around the world, are resilient and have a lot of combat experience.

The good thing about the electric gun is that it can function under- and above water.

Another factor in favour of the Air Force is that the troop transport hovercraft can bring to the battle line up to 30 fully equipped soldiers, plus additional battle robots, drones and also small artillery pieces. In fact, they have enough firepower to destroy all the hunting aliens on the tactical map.

 

Tall and slim, the It-Um-La can sneak behind enemy lines and use a melee weapon or can launch an unexpected mortar barrage on enemy positions.

 

Some of the melee aliens that the Terran Shield forces will encounter. Well... nobody wants to get near those.​

 

The splitting of the Jellyfish Sentry.​

 

The modified Sonic Gun below is the favourite weapon of this monster. We wonder what is its favourite food...​

 

The Shark attack drone helicopter. Very fast, small target for the enemy, cheap and with decent firepower.

 

Terran Shield medivac is the fastest troops transport vehicle for small forces. It can deploy troops in difficult terrain and offer high medical assistance and recovery.

 

"The Defender" Hovercraft

 

"The Defender" Hovercraft - exterior​

 

Vehicles and soldiers placement inside "The Defender" Hovercraft​

 

Air Force vehicles and drones.​

 

The first concept for the Terran Shield Air Force soldier with advanced combat armor made with alien technology.

 

Terran Shield land base placed at the sea shore, with underwater heavy defenses and several heavy armored docks.

 

 

Not only humans are looking for lost treasures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are a fresh Romanian indie game company that enjoys making special games to challenge the players while giving them a polished game-play and great replayability.

At the same time, we want to remain in touch with the game community, talk to our fans about our games and adjust them if necessary.

 

Game development schedule

 

Risks and challenges

As with every game project, there is a risk that the end product will not be delivered as promised, or that the project will be cancelled. For strategy games in particular, the main risk is that the final game is unbalanced, as it happened before to other TBS games. In order to avoid this scenario for Terran Shield, we have established the balance between the strategy and tactical components of the game as our number one priority. Even if we run short of funds, we won’t deliver the final product until it is well-balanced and fun to play. We would rather have fewer environments and assets than provide an unfinished strategy game.

Hello! 
I present to you, Wing Of Misadventure , a true MMO created through RPG Maker VX Ace!, The game has come a long way over the last year and is very near BETA stages! As many will know starting a MMO is no easy task and requires lots of time and money to allow the game to reach its full potential! That’s the reason we have started this topic to gain financial support to improve all aspects of the game.


The proposal of the game
Wing Of Misadventure is a professional-quality MMO created through Forjerum , and is based on group battles. As the essence of a true MMO, it is impossible to evolve alone in this game, since most of the enemies have a power far superior to that of the player.

We bring through Misadventure a unique universe with its own history and particularities that revolve around 15 gods and 15 races.

 

The great work around a great project 
Wing Of Misadventure has been produced for years and is created by 4Tabern, the same team that made available the Open Source database for MMO's in RPG Maker VX Ace called Forjerum. 

We use in the project various illustrations and resources created by us, and we use the limit of the potential that we are guaranteed using the RPG Maker. 

Of course, since 4Tabern is a team that has always been contributing to the online gaming community, we will continue to strengthen Forjerum's potential through Wing.


Systems


Combat
Wing Of Misadventure has some carefully created systems that will give a full and complete 2D mmorpg experience! We have implemented a fast paced action combat system that will truly test players not only in the world of PVE but PVP also!
The System of battle of wing of misadventure will have only a few points.

First, the maps will have a few monsters, that why each monster is the strength of a player, and face monsters of your own level alone will be a real challenge. (except low levels where we facilitate things)

Our Defense system also will not make you immune to any kind of enemy. We call the defense of "resistance" and she is based on reducing the damage received in a percentage. Unless you regenerate more to life than receives as damage (which depends on the attributes of your character), you can die for any monster.

In spite of a monster to have the strength of a player, the reward that he will give is equivalent to the work that the player will have to defeat him, we want to create an interaction in battle where stand just attacking is sign the death warrant.

The Monsters will use spells and as soon as they start, a hint to get away from them will be shown on the screen. That is not always easy or possible. (for our cani kinchs iarumas and sure it will be easier)

Heads will be a real complication. Die in misadventure at the very least can cost you a level, and face a boss is a task in which anyone can die without the right team to help you. In addition, it is impossible to escape of the statement of a boss after he woke up.

But the risk is worth it, despite a boss could cost up to an hour of battle, in the end the reward could be a whole level.


Missions/Quests


On the system of missions!
The game will have a number of missions around the world, there will be only two kinds of missions, the secondary and primary.

The difference between primary and secondary are that the primary missions will release new aspects of the game, for example, spells and access to certain maps, apart from bringing high level awards for the player.

We are also working on an alternative system of missions that will "create" a temporary mission every time interval in a random place off the map with a difficulty and random prize.

(obviously, NPC and random story for the alternatives)

Equipment
A little bit about our system of equipment!
The equipment can make up to 14 different bonus and they always are based on points of status or direct points (such as physical endurance, chance of critical and etc...)

There are several levels to an item, we split in the following:
Transcendent
Divine
Holy
Legendary
Masterpiece
Only one
Copy
Super rare
Very rare
Rare
Unusual
Common
Useless

From bottom to top, the higher the level, the stronger the item will be. The level of the item is defined at random in two ways, dropping in the monsters or through the creation with a craftsman.

The chance is also lower for items above unusual, and transcendent items will be the most powerful (we will be able to say that they are going to be unique items on the server that will appear once or twice a month).

Despite the chance to be fixed in the drop. In the creation of items is different, the greater your level of Craftsman, the more chances you will have to create an item of higher quality (in the maximum level of craftsman is right that all your items will be copies, but transcendent items will still be really difficult).

To put in issues of force, an item of level 1 in the transcendent quality probably has the strength of an entry level 99 in the common quality.

Another important point is that not all the items that are on the same level they give the same bonuses, that's because we want to make each item of the game more "only".

 


Elemental System
On the elemental system of the game!
Each of the magic and weapons of the game will have damage based on one of the elements of the game.

The elements are:
Fire
Air
Water
Earth
Darkness
Light

Each of the elements have chances only to cause extra effects us enemies, for example, attacks of fire has a chance to burn the enemies, and attacks of water has a chance to recover your life.

Also there will be resistance elementals, certain monsters and items will have more resistance to certain elements in the game.

Each class will have magic based on 2 OR 3 elements. And we'll announce soon the elements of each class. 

 


MMO Standard Systems


Trade
Wing has a very simple but effective trade system that players can use to buy or sell items to each other!
Party 
Team with your friends to progress as far as possible against some difficult obstacles in the world of Wing. On screen health and specific class roles will all add to becoming the perfect team! 
Shops
Take a stop at the local stores in the game to find new and improved items and loot that can be purchased with gold to improve aspects of your character!
Guilds
Start your recruitment process as you embark on building a guild full of players that can help each other through Wing!
Crafting
Our developer has been working extremely hard in making a very special system for crafting that will truly engage players in developing their own custom made armors and weapons to use against foes in the game.  


The Story

The Michs worship the goddess Lyaloto, the protector of the winds. The history of his race is one of the oldest in the world of Misadventure. 

Misadventure emerged with the collaboration of 15 gods, but Lyaloto created the first living beings of Misadventure blowing towards the forests. Of all her creations, the one that brought her most happiness were the Mich Adapse, beings who carry in all directions the ideas and emotions of the goddess. Lyaloto left only two important rules for the Michs to follow suit: 

The Michs could not relate to any other race sentimentally. 

They should also protect life in Misadventure in all its form, especially the lives of the animals created by the goddess Mich. The murder of a creature Mich is a veritable affront to existence Mich and the goddess Lyaloto. 

The Michs had not been bred for combat, for Lyaloto, they should live in peace, but that changed completely when the god Oto placed his race in Misadventure. 

The Aiprahs were soon the second race created at Misadventure, and were put into the world by Oto, the god of thunder. Oto has always been the god with the most destructive air, and has placed in the Aiprahs a senseless irrationality, making them a race specially created to destroy. With the arrival of the Aiprahs in Misadventure, the world began to be destroyed little by little and the Michs were threatened. Lyaloto was furious with Oto, and the gods had their first battle. 

A battle of unspeakable dimensions happened, and Oto was finally put at the mercy of the final blow of Lyaloto, but the other gods intervened and caused Oto to withdraw the Aiprahs from Misadventure. The god of thunder felt humiliated and begged the Aiprahs to stay. A vote was made among the 15 gods, and by only one vote, the Aiprahs could stand on condition that Oto corrected the madness of the Aiprahs, and so he did. The Aiprahs had their folly erased. 

Lyaloto however, suffered deeply with the death of many Michs, and realized that, they could not live in Misadventure without the ability to combat. It was when Lyaloto cut off one of his wings, relinquishing half of his power, and delivered it to the most valiant Michs, who turned the wing into a spiritual source of Mich's existence. 

Lyaloto could no longer defeat Oto after that, but the Michs possessed the power of a true god in their hands. 

 

 

WOOAH

 

If you've read this far, thank you! Sorry for the lack of organization. To compensate, another picture of the game. <3

(except low levels where we facilitate things)Our Defense system also will not make you immune to any kind of enemy. We call the defense of "resistance" and she is based on reducing the damage received in a percentage. Unless you regenerate more to life than receives as damage (which depends on the attributes of your character), you can die for any monster.In spite of a monster to have the strength of a player, the reward that he will give is equivalent to the work that the player will have to defeat him, we want to create an interaction in battle where stand just attacking is sign the death warrant.The Monsters will use spells and as soon as they start, a hint to get away from them will be shown on the screen. That is not always easy or possible. (for our cani kinchs iarumas and sure it will be easier)Heads will be a real complication. Die in misadventure at the very least can cost you a level, and face a boss is a task in which anyone can die without the right team to help you. In addition, it is impossible to escape of the statement of a boss after he woke up.But the risk is worth it, despite a boss could cost up to an hour of battle, in the end the reward could be a whole level.Missions/QuestsOn the system of missions!The game will have a number of missions around the world, there will be only two kinds of missions, the secondary and primary.The difference between primary and secondary are that the primary missions will release new aspects of the game, for example, spells and access to certain maps, apart from bringing high level awards for the player.We are also working on an alternative system of missions that will "create" a temporary mission every time interval in a random place off the map with a difficulty and random prize.(obviously, NPC and random story for the alternatives)EquipmentA little bit about our system of equipment!The equipment can make up to 14 different bonus and they always are based on points of status or direct points (such as physical endurance, chance of critical and etc...)There are several levels to an item, we split in the following:TranscendentDivineHolyLegendaryMasterpieceOnly oneCopySuper rareVery rareRareUnusualCommonUselessFrom bottom to top, the higher the level, the stronger the item will be. The level of the item is defined at random in two ways, dropping in the monsters or through the creation with a craftsman.The chance is also lower for items above unusual, and transcendent items will be the most powerful (we will be able to say that they are going to be unique items on the server that will appear once or twice a month).Despite the chance to be fixed in the drop. In the creation of items is different, the greater your level of Craftsman, the more chances you will have to create an item of higher quality (in the maximum level of craftsman is right that all your items will be copies, but transcendent items will still be really difficult).To put in issues of force, an item of level 1 in the transcendent quality probably has the strength of an entry level 99 in the common quality.Another important point is that not all the items that are on the same level they give the same bonuses, that's because we want to make each item of the game more "only". Elemental SystemOn the elemental system of the game!Each of the magic and weapons of the game will have damage based on one of the elements of the game.The elements are:FireAirWaterEarthDarknessLightEach of the elements have chances only to cause extra effects us enemies, for example, attacks of fire has a chance to burn the enemies, and attacks of water has a chance to recover your life.Also there will be resistance elementals, certain monsters and items will have more resistance to certain elements in the game.Each class will have magic based on 2 OR 3 elements. And we'll announce soon the elements of each class.  MMO Standard SystemsTradeWing has a very simple but effective trade system that players can use to buy or sell items to each other!Party Team with your friends to progress as far as possible against some difficult obstacles in the world of Wing. On screen health and specific class roles will all add to becoming the perfect team! ShopsTake a stop at the local stores in the game to find new and improved items and loot that can be purchased with gold to improve aspects of your character!GuildsStart your recruitment process as you embark on building a guild full of players that can help each other through Wing!CraftingOur developer has been working extremely hard in making a very special system for crafting that will truly engage players in developing their own custom made armors and weapons to use against foes in the game.  The StoryThe Michs worship the goddess Lyaloto, the protector of the winds. The history of his race is one of the oldest in the world of Misadventure. Misadventure emerged with the collaboration of 15 gods, but Lyaloto created the first living beings of Misadventure blowing towards the forests. Of all her creations, the one that brought her most happiness were the Mich Adapse, beings who carry in all directions the ideas and emotions of the goddess. Lyaloto left only two important rules for the Michs to follow suit: The Michs could not relate to any other race sentimentally. They should also protect life in Misadventure in all its form, especially the lives of the animals created by the goddess Mich. The murder of a creature Mich is a veritable affront to existence Mich and the goddess Lyaloto. The Michs had not been bred for combat, for Lyaloto, they should live in peace, but that changed completely when the god Oto placed his race in Misadventure. The Aiprahs were soon the second race created at Misadventure, and were put into the world by Oto, the god of thunder. Oto has always been the god with the most destructive air, and has placed in the Aiprahs a senseless irrationality, making them a race specially created to destroy. With the arrival of the Aiprahs in Misadventure, the world began to be destroyed little by little and the Michs were threatened. Lyaloto was furious with Oto, and the gods had their first battle. A battle of unspeakable dimensions happened, and Oto was finally put at the mercy of the final blow of Lyaloto, but the other gods intervened and caused Oto to withdraw the Aiprahs from Misadventure. The god of thunder felt humiliated and begged the Aiprahs to stay. A vote was made among the 15 gods, and by only one vote, the Aiprahs could stand on condition that Oto corrected the madness of the Aiprahs, and so he did. The Aiprahs had their folly erased. Lyaloto however, suffered deeply with the death of many Michs, and realized that, they could not live in Misadventure without the ability to combat. It was when Lyaloto cut off one of his wings, relinquishing half of his power, and delivered it to the most valiant Michs, who turned the wing into a spiritual source of Mich's existence. Lyaloto could no longer defeat Oto after that, but the Michs possessed the power of a true god in their hands.   WOOAH If you've read this far, thank you! Sorry for the lack of organization. To compensate, another picture of the game. <3

story:
What is "Over The Pit"?

"Over the Pit" is a challenging pirate-themed game where you have a crew of 3 different pirates who stand on a platform that barely balances on a high thin pole. You control them by left-clicking anywhere on the platform, but can only control one pirate a time. To control others, you'll need to switch them with Q and E keys.

What are they doing there? Stealing stuff for you, of course! Every several seconds a random amount of different items falls down on the platform and your goal is to collect them by pressing the SPACE key. When you do it, all items that are currently on the platform, instantly disappear and add score points for each collected item. "Collect" ability has its colldown so you shouldn't try to spam it. 

Another important feature is the Patience bar that shows wether your crew is fine about doing their job or they are going to quit. It is important to keep their patience high by stealing items, otherwise when it goes down to zero you lose the game. Patience is decreasing slowly by default and instantly drops every time an item gets lost (falls off the platform). Once you collect items, however, the Patience bar is fully restored.

The amount of achieved score through stealing items depends on the amount and weight of items you collect - the more is the better. Also, the amount of items you get at once has different names and effects on the game process:

  • Poor Swag: Less than 6 items. No score reward + 1 skull;
  • Good Swag: From 6 to 10 items. Simple score reward + 1 coin;
  • Swaggy Swag: From 10 to 15 items. Score reward + Minor bonus score + 2 coins;
  • Swagganeer: More than 15 items. Score reward + Major bonus score + 3 coins.
Key elements here are skulls and coins. Every time you collect items you get one of those and the game counts them. Once you get 3 skulls or 3 coins, they transform into a special item that instantly falls on the platform:
  • 3 skulls turn into a Black Spot. The Black Spot stops you from collecting items unless you find a way to drop it off the platform. It's extremely important to get rid of it ASAP.
  • 3 coins turn into a Golden Anchor. With the Golden Anchor, the next time you collect items you get twice the amount of score reward for them. Golden Anchor, however, is collected too so it's a single-use bonus.

To sum up, the goal of the game is to reach higher score while:

  1. not letting any of your pirates fall off the platform;
  2. not letting them to run out of Patience.

Pirates

Before you start the game, you form your crew from several available pirates. All of them have different Weight, Movement speed and a single Special Ability that could help you a lot during the game. Here's the list of currently available pirates:

Younge Hannes

  • Weight: Average
  • Speed: Average
  • Ability: Sticks up to 3 little posts in the platform that catch the nearest items and hold them with a rope for a short period of time.

Sebastion

  • Weight: Heavy
  • Speed: Very Slow
  • Ability: Shoots a cannonball in a given direction, pushing the platform with the cannon's kickback in the opposite direction.

Roman Chu

  • Weight: Light
  • Speed: Very Fast
  • Ability: Teleports in another given spot on the platform, taking all of the items that lie nearby, with him.

Hookerjack

  • Weight: Average
  • Speed: Fast
  • Ability: Hooks up an item or another pirate and pulls them to him, while also being pulled to the target. As a result, they meet halfway before their connection breaks.

Antonio

  • Weight: Light
  • Speed: Average
  • Ability: Performs a fireshow that encourages or frightens other pirates, which as result makes them move much faster for a short period of time.

Druncan

  • Weight: Heavy
  • Speed: Slow
  • Ability: Makes a quick charge in a given direction, kicking away everything and everyone on his way. This ability ignores the platform tilt and can stop it from falling by forcely pushing it in the different direction. After the charge Druncan falls asleep for several seconds and can't be controlled until he wakes up.

Funding Goals

I won't lie, these money are needed mostly for keeping up the developement of the game (this includes food, purchasing equipment for making audio, hiring an artist to help with game design and etc.), but also as a motivation for improvements that are planned for the game. Every goal achieved during this campaign gives the priority to a certain feature.

$500. More Pirates!

The range of available pirates won't stop on 6, of course, and there are at least 3-4 ideas for more pirates and one of them is already drawn! So when we achieve th3e amount of more than $500 these pirates will appear in the game!

$1200. Drawing Livestream!

Once this goal is reached, there'll be a public YouTube livestream with real-time digital drawing of a wallpaper featuring one of the available pirates (chosen by your voting beforehand) with a following giveaway of the said wallpaper.

$2000. Wallpapers and Trivia!

Every pirate in "Over the Pit" has his own story. You can help them to appear in the final product along with full-screen wallpapers featuring each of the pirates. Supportrers of the project will also be able to recieve a digital archive with all of the wallpapers.
Also if you'd like the Drawing Livestream, these wallpapers would be drawn during livestreams too (without giveaways, however, to be fair with the supporters).

$3400. Challenges!

What is a game without actual quests and challenges? If we reach the goal of 3000 dollars, a system of Challenges will be implemented, where players are put to different tasks, such as:
  • "don't use any special ability for 10 seconds" 
  • "Get 2 Golden Anchors in a row (by collecting more than 15 items with the current Golden Anchor on the platform)" 
  • "Reach 1000 score without losing dropping a single item off the platform" and etc.
The system of Challenges works the next way: you are given an opportunity to recieve up to 3 random challenges(without knowing wich)  before you start picking your pirates for the game. When you choose to recieve a challenge, it's automatically accepted but it's not an obligation to have all three of them accepted. You can easily play with 1 or 2 challenge, or without them. These challenges are kept with you during the game and once you finish it (by Patience or falling off the platform) you recieve reward for completing the challenges.
The reward points are then used to unlock different pirate skins, surroundings, wallpapers and trivia.

$3500. Extra Content!

The final goal of the campaign will add more skins for pirates, the platform, surroundings and other things that you can unlock by completing challenges. There'll also be a pack of exclusive pirate skins for all of the supporters of the project.

Why is Your Help Important?

Of course the funding is the most valuable for the project, but more than that "Over the Pit" needs people who wish to see it on the market and play it. Even if you can't contribute financially, you can share this page with your friends, tell them about this project and draw more people to the game.
Forming a friendly community around the game would give a huge impact for improving "Over the Pit", creating new features for it.
This is a very important project for me as my deam is creating enjoyable games for everyone. (And the practical dream is to see that one day one of my favourite youtubers would make a let's play of it ^^)

The Risks

Even if we don't reach any of the funding goals, I'm not giving up on the project, but I wouldn't be able to fully concentrate on it.

Time is the main enemy right now. In July I'm forced to join the army training for the next year without an opportunity to work further on the game until I come back in July 2017. This means that I have only 4 full months to make the dream come true. Considering how much I was able to do alone for the last 1,5 months, I'm more than sure that with your support I'd be able to finish it on time and release a functioning version of "Over the Pit".

Once again, even if I don't make it on time, I'm NOT done as I'll be grabbing for any opportunity to work on the project even during the army training.

story:
Summary

My name is Cameron Jackson and this is my campaign to start my own gaming store in Statesboro, GA. I've been studying psychology and business here for the last 4 years and am months from graduating.


In all my 4 1/2 years of schooling and 3 years of delivering pizzas to every party, study session, and general gathering in Statesboro I've learned three things (outside of my fields of study): Everyone loves to play video games, every gamer has some kind of nostalgia from games they grew up with, and everyone is the best at whatever game they play (somehow). 


After months of meeting with every loan officer and branch manager in town, they've all come to one conclusion: "It's a good idea, we think it will work, BUT you're going to need assets or cash of your own because we can't give you the whole thing." - This is where you come in: 


By helping me reach this goal we'll receive a new store in Statesboro to provide games from Super Nintendo/Dreamcast or a Playstation3/xbox360 and anything in between. Besides a store we'll also get a place where all the gamers of Statesboro can come play to prove they really are the best (There can be only one!), and not just video games: Spades, Checkers, Chess, if it's a game and you're good at it then we'll gladly try to crown you the King/Queen of Statesboro at it. Some tournaments will be for free, but some will allow you to win money or other prizes (and they said your gaming would never amount to anything). 

Most importantly: you'll have a discount handy for when the next great video games come out, and having a competing store lowers prices by breaking the monopoly of Gamestop. Just think, giving a dollar (or more) today could save you so much more over time, and possibly earn you more money on your trade-ins.

With those benefits to your gaming career and your wallet, how could you not afford to donate/share? 


What We Need & What You Get

The bank wants me to put up 20% of the amount they give me as collateral. 5K is the minimum to open, but 10K is the true target amount because with that I can get funding for new games, old games, retro games, and the equipment to host the tournaments and run and advertise what will be a successful store/venue.  

Here's what can happen at different levels:

<5K: Game Over. IndieGogo will refund your money, and we'll be distant friends for life because you believed in me enough to try and help me out.

5K: We now have a store, filled with retro games to modern games, and a few consoles to play them on.

7K: Modern consoles, brand new games, and likely Ps4/Xbox1 games. Spade Tournaments and other card and board games will be held, any video game tournaments would be retro. 

8K: major items, like a console or a new popular game can be reserved/bought online, that way you wont even have to leave the house without knowing if your game will be in stock.

9K: We'll try to get some kind of customer loyalty program going.

10K: You've won, we can now play video game tournaments (Madden, Nba, Mortal Kombat), and there will be a wall of fame as well as grand tournaments where the winners from past tournaments have a chance to be the best of the best.

>10K: more games for tournaments (Fifa, boxing, baseball, ect), larger selections, and possibly form a league, maybe even have a lounge to meet other gamers.

The Impact

Anyone who wants anything to do in Statesboro has three options: Drink, see a movie, or go bowling. All of these things last an hour or two but get stale after a while, every Spades game starts with three people wanting to play and trying to find a fourth person, and finding people to play online who won't quit as soon as you start winning can be a chore. Gamer's Palace will be a place to fix all of that, where people who enjoy video games can come together, and where games of the past won't be lost forever.

And having a competing store lowers prices by breaking the monopoly of Gamestop. Just think, giving a dollar (or more) today could save you so much more over time, and possibly earn you more money on your trade-ins.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money (It's hard out there):

  1. Tell a friend, especially if all you ever see them do is play video games. 
  2. Tell your nephew, he never takes his eyes off the TV anyway and this will get him out of the house.
  3. Ladies, tell your boyfriend, let him sit on our couch and play instead of yours so that you can watch your shows and have some peace
  4. Fellas, tell your girlfriend because she wants to see you happy.
  5. Parents, tell your co-workers, get your kids in here winning prizes and money so they don't have to spend yours.
  6. Everyone else: tell someone, and then after they contribute be sure to invite them so you can beat them (it's only fair).

** If you don't want to tell someone because that takes too long, use IndieGoGo's share tools, let it do all the work for you!

And that's all there is to it - see you at the grand opening!

story:
Three generations. The historians will say it took three generations for the greatest empire ever seen in the civilized world to rise and fall.

As a child, I was taught the story. As a youth I trained and learned to keep it's people safe. As a grown man, I watched it crumble into anarchy and invasion.

Here I stand, near the podium of this great hall, in this castle. The hall and the fortress around it look well older than the crumbled empire. The floor is packed with tables and benches. The smoke of the fire and torches dim the ceiling, but keep the winter night out. But even the smell of smoke is dulled by the smell of perfumed men and women. And by wine, warmed and sweetened. The walls covered in tapestries displaying acts of heroism, during days long past. The last of this ancient family is gone, and soon their remaining supplies, rescued from Goblin murderers, will be used up.

Greater than the smells, a cacophony of noise fills the hall to it's breaking point. I see senators and captains, who took their small pieces of the imperial forces away from the boarders so that their own homes could be guarded. I see the Magi of Belgraven argue about the nature of their power, while dark magic seeps into our world. I see the High Priests of my beloved church demand their place of power, while demons and worse claim the souls of our people. I see greedy merchants, who horde their gold and buy stolen treasures from our invaders. This room of the selfish, the greedy, the petty, and the pompous, this is where all our hope lies.

How could the Lord of the Vanguard and his Nahaerhiim ever have let this happen?

The doubt washes over me and I waver. Behind me my last loyal followers sense my trepidation. Sir Ulric, ever unflinching, places a mailed hand upon my shoulder. “We stand with you.” His assurance is enough for me to look back to the squabbling mob.

“My good Lords and Ladies!” Calls out the herald, “The floor will now be given to the honourable Destrian Lord, Fendrel Hillgarret.”

At the mention of my name, Brother Benedict speaks a whispered prayer to five of the 10,000 Heroes of the Vanguard. It is enough, my doubt gone, I hand my personal banner to the towering Sir Gavin, and walk up the steps.

Some balk at my armour and weapons, still worn in the council chamber. I silence them with a stare, a look born in the pain of washing my sworn brothers' blood from my skin. “The Order of the Crimson Rose yet lives,” I announce to the gathering, “and we will bring order to this nation!”

Rack and Ruin is deisgned to be a game where players can take a small number of miniatures, from whatever company, and use them.  More than that, customize them and create them as the player feels they should be.

We also want any hero miniature to be effective on the table top.  Regardless of wether it is a Minotaur, Knight, Dancing Girl, Ghost, or the coolest wizard mini you've ever seen, you can design a character based on it and add it to your party.

But not every miniature in your party has to be a hero.  Our creature trait system allow you to take a monster you have and put it in the game.  Giants, trolls, dragons, treemen, triceratops, wolves, King Kong, horses, hydras and some 5" infernal bug-thing have all been written up and used on the table with our rules.

We've been playing Rack and Ruin locally for some time, but now we want to take it to the next leve and we want you to be a part of it.

We are undertaking this crowd funding project in order to add the final touches we need to publish Rack and Ruin. First of all we will be adding more art work for the interior and getting a professional layout done. Perhaps more important we plan to have a suitably impressive cover for this game we have put so much work into. Finally, we will be using what's left to have the game printed.

The Beta Test rules are now available here for those interested in trying out the game, though we still encourage you to sign-up for the beta test emails on our Facebook page.

Rack and Ruin Open Beta Test Rules

Rack and Ruin Party and Character Record Sheets

Rack and Ruin Character Reference Cards

Rack and Ruin is a game originally designed to combine role-playing and miniatures games into one customisable table top skirmish system. Each player selects miniatures they wish to use, beginning with four "hero" miniatures. Each hero is then built; much like one would create a pen and paper RPG character, with skills, traits, races, and items.

Traits are perhaps the most defining aspect of a character. They determine if a hero has followers, can wield magic, fills a specific role within a party, or has special abilities.

Followers can be characters of lesser ability than the heroes or monsters designed by the player to reflect his or her miniatures.

Once parties are created 2-4 players can join in a single game. Players select terrain, roll for scenario and the time of day the game is being played in. That combination will make almost every game completely unique.

In game, players will attempt to gather as many victory points as possible, the player with the most victory points at end of the game wins that game. Victory points also determine the amount of experience points each of the player's heroes will get for being fielded. Winning a game gives you bonus experience, as does playing against parties more powerful than your own.

Winning games, amassing treasure, and a few other factors give a party legacy. Legacy is the ultimate factor in determining who wins a campaign.

After a game, players check to see what treasures they have collected, if their party members took any permanent injuries and check to see if any of their heroes have gained enough experience to ascend to the next level learning more skills and traits. Then each party member may take a single out of game action. Out of game actions are often precious, so using them wisely is important.

In the core rules players can customize the rules for their miniatures using:

  • 8 Scenarios
  • 72 Magic Spells
  • Rules for 25 terrain pieces
  • 27 actions a miniature can take in game, plus 7 quick actions
  • 45 Follower traits and weaknesses so that players can design their own creatures

The Rack and Ruin core rules also contain:

  • 18 Skills
  • 8 Character races, of which 6 may select from 5 specific traits for their race (Beastmen and Humans work a little differently)
  • 68 Traits
  • 60 Items
  • 20 Out of game actions

When  you make a pledge to receive any perk with a "Thank  You" you will be recognized on the Crowd Funding Support Page of the Rack and Ruin Core Rule Book. You will be recognized based on the perk that you pledged for, starting with Thank You pledges being recognized under the main Thank You section, all three follower pledges being recognized as Followers up to anyone that pledges the Emperor perk being recognized as Emperor.

The Rack and Ruin Core Rule Book will be approximately 200 pages. The printed versions will be perfect bound soft cover copies with full colour covers and black and white interior pages. It will feature art from Thunder Bay area artists and give you all the rules you need to take your favourite minitaures to the Rack and Ruin gaming table.

Bizarre Bazaar Mini-Expansion - The Bizarre Bazaar sells some of the strangest items ever to be seen in the known world. And whether sinner or saint, crusader or corrupter, builder or destroyer, the hawkers there will happily show you their wares. But while the merchants seem happy to take a price in gold, the true cost might be more than even brave adventurers can pay. Bizarre Bazaar will be a mini-expansion of approximately 10 pages that will feature the "Visit the Bazaar" out-of-game action and 50 new items.

Rumbling Bellies Mini-Expansion - Ogres have returned, and they have returned hungry. Savvy captains can see the value of employing these hulking brutes. Especially, when all they require is food enough to fill their massive appetites. If a captain can provide enough snacks and supplies to keep an Ogre content perhaps they will have power enough to force their will upon the world. Rumbling Bellies, formerly know as Going Clubbing, will be a mini-expansion of approximately 10 pages that will feature new rules for snacks, new traits involving snacks and supplies, and the new Ogre character race.

Familiars Mini-Expansion - Familiars are thaumatergical (magic eating) animal spirits that serve a spell caster in exchange for feeding off the power of the magic their master creates. There are many different types of familiars that take any number of shapes. While familiars give the spell caster boons there are also drawbacks to using these always hungry magical beasts. Familiars will be a mini-expansion of approximately 10 pages that will introduce rules for using familiars and 20 familiars to share the stage with all of your parties spell casters.

Rack and Ruin Core Rule Book Spell Card Add-On - $25
With this add-on you will get a full colour deck of quick reference cards for all 72 magic spells in the game. These also come in their own full colour, branded box to keep them safe from wear and tear.

Rack and Ruin Core Rule Book Terrain Card Add-On - $20
With this add-on you will get a full colour deck of quick reference cards for all 25 terrain pieces in the game. These also come in their own full colour, branded box to keep them safe from wear and tear.

Rack and Ruin LE Tempest has Begun T-Shirt Add-On - $25
A limited edition Rack and Ruin t-shirt, that will be made exclusively for the Crowd Funder.

Stretch Goal: $4000 - Locked
Shattered Hope
Rack & Ruin Expansion Book I

The barriers of the dimensions have weakened. Otherworldy beings have begun forcing their way into the world and inflicting their will upon the citizens of the crumbled empire. But, in their rush to gain access to the mortal realm, they have made one misstep. The mortal spirit is not so easily overwelmed.

 Shattered Hope will feature:


  • Chapter 1: Clash of the Elements
    • Focus on 4 new magical power sources: Ignar (fire), Tydeholm (water), Zephyra (air), Kor (earth)
    • 36 new spells
    • New character race: Pawns, mortals possessed by elemental spirits
    • 25 New Traits
  • Chapter 2: Rise of the Demonbound
    • An expansion focused on the Acolyte trait.
    • New goal: Corruption
    • Two new character races; The Possessed and Devilkin
    • 25 New Traits
    • 20 New Spells
  • Chapter 3: Army of the Spider King
    • An Expansion focused on the Goblin character race
    • 25 New Traits
    • 16 New Spells
    • Expanded rules for Goblin Markets
    • 10 New Items
  • Chapter 4: Quaint and Curious Volumes
    • An Expansion Focused on the Knowledge Goal
    • 15 New Traits
    • 18 New Spells
    • Expanded Rules for Books
    • New quests and deeds of note relating to Knowledge
    • 15 New Books
  • And 2 appendices featuring new terrain and updated treasure lists.

When this stretch goal becomes unlocked anyone that contributed at the Greater Follower level or higher will recieve an e-copy of Shattered Hope.  Anyone who contributed at the Hero or greater level (retailer package not included) will also get a soft cover hard copy of Shattered Hope.

Stretch Goal: $4500 - Locked
More Art From Byron
Rack & Ruin Core Rulebook

The better part of my art budget from this campaign will be going to local artist Byron Satens.  Byron has some amazing work and you can see it on the conver from Shattered Hope (above) or here thegreaterdesign.tumblr.com.  However, I feel it's not enough.  If we can reach this point in the funding I will spend this extra pledges commissioning Byron to do even more brilliant artwork for the Rack and Ruin core rulebook and internal art for Shattered Hope.  What I hope to do is have a full page picture for the start of each chapter.

Help us gather enough pledges to get to this level and make Rack and Ruin look as awesome as it is to play.

Stretch Goal: $5000 - Locked
Special Hero Edition Core Rulebook w/Mini-Expansions

If we can reach $5k anyone getting the Hero package or greater (not including retailers) will get a Special "The Tempest has Begun" Edition copy of the Rack and Ruin rulebook.  The special edition will be specially marked, signed by Rack and Ruin creator Gene Capar and will contain all three mini-expansions as appendicies.  This is the only time we plan to print the mini-expansions at this time.

Stretch Goal: $7000 - Locked
Hardcover!

If we can reach $7k we will print the Rack and Ruin rulebook in hardcover.

To change your perk to a higher level perk you can make an extra contribution adding the diference in cost between the two perks. Go to contribute now and add the amount without choosing any perk. Then let us know by a comment what perk level you are upgrading to so that we can ensure you get exactly the perk you pledged for.

For everyone pledging from outside of Canada and the continental US and receiving a hard copy of the book. Please use the above method to add $20 to allow us to cover the increased cost of shipping.

We are very grateful for any pledges you can make, regardless of amount. If you've pledged or even if you are not in a position to pledge at this time, please join our open beta test from our Facebook page or directly by clicking here. We will send you a text only print and play version of the rules for you to try out with your gaming group.

Thank you,
Gene Capar
Creator and Writer

Three generations. The historians will say it took three generations for the greatest empire ever seen in the civilized world to rise and fall.
As a child, I was taught the story. As a youth I trained and learned to keep it's people safe. As a grown man, I watched it crumble into anarchy and invasion.
Here I stand, near the podium of this great hall, in this castle. The hall and the fortress around it look well older than the crumbled empire. The floor is packed with tables and benches. The walls covered in tapestries displaying acts of heroism, during days long past. The last of this ancient family is gone, and soon their remaining supplies, rescued from Goblin murderers, will be used up.
Greater than the smells, a cacophony of noise fills the hall to it's breaking point.
