story:
Netherworld has a playable Windows demo now! You can download the demo here. Check the question marks at the bottom of each screen to read up on basic instructions! Also, remember to click on the little dots as well – that is how you collect Essence that you will need.

Netherworld is an abstract exploration rogue-like game with tactical combat encounters, which takes place in a dreamy, ethereal space called the Netherworld. The procedurally generated universe makes sure that no two situations are ever the same, and the robust mechanics always invite you to come up with your own smart and creative solutions. For starters, construct your own custom spellpowers with the open-ended custom spell creation system!

Your exploration quest will take place in an abstract and otherworldly space called the Netherworld, where you can actually encounter places such as an Essence Vortex, a Crystalline Dreamweaver, or a Rich Viridian Cloud. We aim to create an ambience that will be at the same time mysterious, so that you will always want to explore the universe beyond the horizon, and sublime and ornamental in detail, so that you can have a relaxed and meditative aesthetic experience.

 

In its heart, Netherworld is an exploration game and plays around the most classic RPG core loop that we all love: You need to overcome obstacles, so that you can reach more resources, which increase your power, and allow you to overcome even more difficult obstacles and explore even deeper into the universe. There are several ways how you can win – you will need to either beat the ultimate combat encounter, activate all the beacons that are scattered in the world, or enact a unique ritual that requires several rare and exotic components.

 

You will encounter many different locations in your exploration, each with its own particular way to either help or block you on your way to victory. Some locations will provide you with more resources, while others will allow you to boost a particular statistic, or to construct a new spellpower. Some more malicious locations will try to block your exploration ambitions: these will be mostly tactical combat encounters, but could also be monumental wardens that will not let you pass until you activate certain beacons somewhere else, barriers that will open only when you have transmuted a certain crystal or a certain dust, and so on.

While some locations offer you immediate rewards, others provide you with an opportunity that you may choose to return to later, when the circumstances have changed and you possess the necessary resources, or when it turns out that you unexpectedly require their services.

For example, these are some of the locations that you can encounter:

Essence Vortex: You can spend some Essence to harmonise the vortex, which will make it provide you with a little Essence whenever you win in a battle. Essence is the most universal resource you have, and to harmonise a vortex is basically an investment.

Attentive/Observant/Sleepless/Wary Sentinel: The Sentinel will not let you pass, at least not until you learn its secret – which may be located somewhere else in the universe, maybe?

Chromatic Catalyst: You can use the Chromatic Catalyst to transmute your elementary dusts into more potent, composite dusts. For example, you can transmute Crimson Ashes, Scarlet Powder and Vermilion Cinders to create the Garnet Dust, and so on. You always exhaust the Catalyst a little when you use it, up until the point where you cannot use it anymore, and have to locate another one.

Azure/Carmine/Brass Transmuter: Transmuters allow you to transmute basic dusts that you have an abundance of into other basic dusts that you perhaps need more importantly at the moment. However, every Transmuter only works with the dusts of a particular color: Azure with blue, Carmine with red, and Brass with yellow.

Oscillator: You have two options how to calibrate the Oscillator – either to an Equilibrium Oscillator, which increases your Stability, or to a Considerance Oscillator, which boosts your Spirit. The Oscillators provide you with a more substantial bonus when you calibrate more of them in the same way, so you have to balance between a more substantial bonus to one statistic, or a less substantial one to both.

Transcendental Monument: The Monument allows you to learn a new vocation. Unlike at the Archway, where you can only learn the one vocation that is available at that Archway, the Monument allows you to choose which vocation you want to pick up. However, it costs you more Experience to unlock a vocation at the Monument than what it would cost at the Archway.

Crystalline Dreamweaver: You can spend Essence to unlock an additional spellpower slot that you can load up your spellpowers into while in a combat encounter.

The robust core mechanics allow for a lot of space for many unique locations, and we absolutely want to explore this breadth, so that you can encounter new locations even when many hours down the road!

In order to reach new locations and reap their sweet, sweet rewards, you will have to overcome many anomaly encounters, which is where Netherworld switches to its turn-based, open-ended tactical combat mode. There are several basic encounter schemes that determine what you have to achieve in order to overcome the encounter, such as Elimination, Assassination, Assault or Survival, and then there are several randomly chosen entities, each with its own particular mischievous way to try and stop you.

 

Every entity has a very simple action that it takes whenever you cast any ability: Noises will reduce your Stability, Spectres will drain your Spirit, while Abominations will countdown until they explode and hurt you real bad. Some entities, such as Wards, may raise barriers around or directly heal other entities, while Constructors spawn more entities until you stop them. And you better be ready when you meet the Nemesis, because, well, it doesn't like you.

The important part is that while the all the entities by themselves are usually really straightforward in what they do, it's their random selection system that creates an enormous possibility space of how many scenarios you can potentially encounter, each with its own very distinct dynamic. When you have an Abomination cluster that will blow your Stability away in ten turns time, a Noise Constructor that continuously spawns new Noises which reduce your Stability every turn, and a Spectre line-up which, in the meantime, drains your Spirit that you need to cast your spellpowers every turn – what do you do?

The most important decision that you have to make in a battle is what spellpowers you choose to load up into your spellpower slots. You can choose which spellpowers you want to load up into your ability slots whenever you want, but once you pick a spellpower into a slot, that is indeed what spellpower you will have in that slot for the entire battle! Your power selection will have primordial impact on how well you will probably do in the battle, because based on what entities are on the screen, and what do you need to achieve, some abilities will be pretty much exactly what you need, while others may simply make no sense. What makes or breaks your success is always how well can you understand the situation that you are in, and choose an appropriate toolset that will help you effectively achieve what you need to do.

TL;DR: You can leave your leet minmax Excel skills at home this time, because it is time to show some actual smart play!

 

'So, what is this that I hear about that I can construct my own spells? I have always wanted to do that!', I hear you say. I know! I have always wanted to construct my own spells in RPGs. I usually play as a caster class when I can, and I think that the most important reason why people choose to play a spellcaster is because you want to play as this awesome person who is badass, but in a smart, sophisticated way. You want to win thanks to how you have outsmarted your opponent, how you came up with a brilliant idea in the important moment, and how you can exploit the mechanics to make them serve whatever it is that you currently need to do. Because you are an individuality, a smart phenomenon to be reckoned with. Which means that obviously, it won’t do to just dumbly repeat the same spells that everybody does! You want your own! Duh!

 

Well, it's true – in Netherworld, you actually have to construct all your spellpowers that you want to have available in the combat encounters to come. You can construct new spellpowers in the exploration phase, when you encounter a special location called a Monolith. Every Monolith allows you to construct one particular spellpower based around the provided central core, which determines what the power will do and its basic numbers, but which also always comes with several runeslots into which you can load up runes that may take your new spell in many dramatically different directions.

For example, Destabilise, which is the basic offensive strike spellpower, can be constructed in such a way that it will either heal you based on the hits that it delivers (which makes it essentially a Drain Health spell), or maybe so that it will hit all the enemies in the cluster (which makes it basically an AoE), or have the Impact quality attached to it (which works as a stun), or you can even make it deliver the hits in a particular Force (so that you can make, say, a Chaotic or a Void spell).

The cool part is that the runeslot structure means that you can combine all these in any way you please, and thus create powers such as a chaotic stun, an AoE drain, or even a chaotic AoE drain stun (I know you want to!). However, you have to keep in mind that every component usually increases the spellpower's cooldown and/or the Spirit that you will need to cast it, or maybe have some other downside to it, such as that it can make the spell only available to be cast X times in any one battle. Which means that when you construct a new spell, you need to consider what your current stats will be able to actually make work in a battle, and what may be a little too cool for you at the moment!

Also, you can only use every Monolith once, and the power composition does cost some resources, so you need to think twice about how to design the power in such a way that it will work well in combination with the other abilities that you have, in the environment that you are currently in, with your attunements and traits, and so on. 

While what you have read above constitutes the core mechanics in Netherworld, there are also several complementary mechanics in play. We aim to have a very robust, yet intricate and ornamental mechanics architecture, which will provide you with many opportunities to capitalise when you pay attention to detail in your decisions.

To name a couple, the secondary mechanics include:

Forces: There are six Forces in the Netherworld: Darkness/Luminosity, Void/Matter and Order/Chaos, which some entities may be particularly vulnerable or resistant to.

Transmutation: In numerous Clouds, Hazes, and Mists, you can collect many peculiar dusts and powders that you can then transmute at catalysts and transmuters to create even more potent substances. You can then use these to enact various rituals at the Altars or the Immortals' Soulshards, which can provide you with many different boosts, such as to your stats or Experience, or even with some entirely unique qualities.

Crystals: You will occasionally stumble upon crystals, which may be required as a component in the most potent rituals, or can be used as a key to unlock locations that would be unreachable otherwise. When you cleanse the crystals, you will also be able to decompose them at a Quartz Disassambler to boost up your Essence reserves.

 

Vocations: Vocations – such as Explorer, Invoker, Transmuter, or Curator – allow you to unlock and level up various traits related to a particular mechanic or statistic. Vocations can be unlocked with Experience, which you earn mainly when you overcome the combat encounters. 

Pockets: Parts of the world (with some sweet rewards, of course!) will remain concealed unless you deploy some means to reveal them. This could be done by activating a nearby Vista, with a trait in the Observer vocation, or in a couple of other manners.

Attunements: Occasionally, you will encounter various Statues in the world, where you can adopt an attunement which provides you with a particular bonus, such as a straight-up numerical boost, or an entirely unique quality. You can only have so many attunements adopted at any one time, so you will eventually need to decide which ones to drop, so that you can replace them with the cooler ones that you encounter as you explore.

Certainly, this is not in any way an exhaustive list – we want to create a very rich and subtly interconnected mechanical system, but hopefully these should be able to make you understand the overall vision!

I'm Martin, I'm 25 and I currently pursue an MA in Digital Games Design & Theory at Brunel University in London, which BTW is absolutely brilliant. Shoutout to all the Brunel Games people! I have a BSc equivalent in Computer Science, and another BA that I have almost completed in French Literature.

 

I have made several games that you can check out when you have a spare minute, such as the experimental surrealist Wake Up Call, which is currently nominated in the Student Game Competition on CHI 2013 in Paris for Innovative Game Design; the narrative-heavy Spider, where you play as a hacker that penetrates networks within their 3D network visualisations; or Letteria, an intense type-'em-up arcade that I did about six years back and that I will probably rerelease sometime around now. 

 

I learned to code when I was 12, and I don't think there were ever more than a couple consecutive weeks since then when I wouldn't code in some way. I have made, as a contracted work or a personal project, 2D games, 3D games, online games, office applications, websites, magazines, mods, libraries, and cash register drivers, and I have learned many lessons the hard way, but as a result I can now quite naturally do whatever it is that I need to do, and can concentrate on how to create a deeper and a more creative design. I would not present you with Netherworld if I would not be absolutely sure that I can deliver on what I promise, but I am!

Games have always been my passion. I earned all my teenage money writing videogame reviews, and it was only natural that I chose to pursue a technical and an artistic university course, so that I could learn about games from both the perspectives. I moved mountains to come here to London this year, so that I could pursue an MA in Digital Game Design, which I am now about to complete in about two months. 

I started to think about what eventually became Netherworld about two years ago now, and I have made several experimental prototypes to arrive to the current design. I am confident that I have an awesome game on my hands now, and I need your guys' help to make it happen!

I am a code-oriented developer much more than I am a visual artist, so what you can see in the video and in the screenshots all around here serves only to demonstrate the visual concept that I have, and how I would eventually like Netherworld to look like – I will need to hire an actual visual artist, who will be able to realise this vision with the subtlety that it needs. I do have several very talented people in mind, and I think that I should actually be able to update you with some exciting news in this aspect soon!

Now, it is up to you to make sure that all that can actually happen! This is the make or break moment in the Netherworld development, and we really need your support now, so that we can make the concept that we believe is awesome become a well-polished reality.

You can see that there are several levels on which you can back the development, and I would now like to explain clearly how the reward system is laid out. These are the the basics that apply to all the contribution levels:

The reward system is cumulative: This means that whichever level you choose to contribute on, you always automatically have access to all the previous perks as well.

Achievements: Every contribution level automatically unlocks an achievement with the same name, so that we can make other people know that you have contributed when it was the most important. This means a Steam achievement, should we launch on Steam, and certainly one in the Netherworld's achievement screen.

Forum icons: There will be a Netherworld Forum to invite discussions about Netherworld, and each contribution tier will provide you with a very special icon displayed next to all your posts while over there.

Remembrance Wall: Remembrance Wall is a boundless wall that can be opened in the main menu and which eternally commemorates and honors all the backers that have helped made the Netherworld development possible. Backers in the upper tiers always receive a certain special visual distinction or a more prominent position on the Wall than the previous tiers.

Be sure to let us know in case that you would be interested in another way in which we could appreciate your help – we will surely work it out!

There are several special locations that are designed especially with you as the contributors in mind, so that you can leave an even more permanent mark on the Netherworld universe. Besides, we sincerely believe that these can create some brilliant crowd-sourced content, such as with the Obelisks, enable you to have your name sound unexpectedly cool, such as with the Immortals, or bestow you with some awesome and unusual meta powers, such as with the Broadcaster!

It is also important to know that since every contributor's copy will be connected to his or her backer contribution, a very special event will occur when you encounter your own Founder's Stone, or any other special location dedicated to you.

Founder’s Stone: Founder’s Stone is a rather common location, which instantly increases the player’s Stability by a small amount. Every Founder’s Stone commemorates a randomly selected Netherworld backer, whose name is displayed along a short poetic text in the location description.

Enlightenment Obelisk: Enlightenment Obelisk is a special location which, besides an instant boost to the players Spirit and Experience, displays an actual advice that has been supplied by a randomly selected backer with the particular perk. In other words, every Netherworld backer that has contributed at least on the necessary level can send us an actual advice that he or she wants to share with other players via the Obelisks. The advice should be about a sentence or two, and should at least remotely resonate with the overall transcendental ambience, but we promise we will be very open minded. For example, 'Fortune sides with him who dares' is a clear OK, as is 'Remember that today is the yesterday’s tomorrow', but we will probably need you to convince us a little more about 'Don’t shit where you eat'.

Immortal’s Soulshard: Immortal's Soulshard is a monument that is always related to a particular Immortal, and allows the player to enact a unique, expensive, but very potent ritual specific to the particular Immortal. When you back Netherworld on the respective tier, we will work with you to create an Immortal based around your name: that means that we will translate your name to match the Immortal name style, and because every Immortal also comes with an epithet (because that is indeed how they roll), you can choose how do you want your Immortal to be known in the Netherworld lore. We will also work with you to design a unique ritual that will resonate with your created Immortal identity.

For example, this means that Samuel Thompson can become immortalised and known in the Netherworld universe as Sa’Tho, The Executioner and his Soulshard would allow a ritual that provides players with a boost to their strikes on entities that are close to destruction, while Annabella Armanini could become Anna-Nini, The Most Brilliant and her ritual would increase the player’s Spirit restoration.

Extraplanar Broadcasts: When you contribute on the Extraplanar Broadcaster level, you unlock a new screen in the main menu where you can select an Extraplanar Transmission that you want to broadcast. Each Transmission represents a particular bonus, all the players' installations are occasionally synchronised via our server, and when other players encounter an Extraplanar Hyperstone in their universes, they will receive a reward which corresponds to a transmission that is randomly selected from those that the broadcasters currently broadcast.

In other words, when you are an Extraplanar Broadcaster, it is up to you to choose what reward do the players receive when they encounter an Extraplanar Hyperstone in their worlds, and you are randomly selected between all the broadcasters.

Every Extraplanar Broadcaster will have their own random Transmission selection to start with, but based on your achievements in the game, you will continually unlock more Transmissions that you can start to broadcast. You can always discuss with other players on the Forums what the best transmission is, but the decision is ultimately always up to you!

Developed in LÖVE, Netherworld will be available on Windows, MacOS, and Linux.

The amount that I raise will be spend in two primary ways: I will need to hire a visual artist that will help me realise the visual vision that I have, and I also need to survive the entire development process in terms of not starving to death and having a place to stay and an internet access.

I have learned to work entirely with open source or free-to-use tools, so there are no expenses in this column, and I'll also come back to live in Prague, where the living costs are much more reasonable than in London – so that's why the amount that I crowdsource is less than what it usually is with the videogame propositions. 

My expectation is to release Netherworld in the Q1 2014.

I wanted to let you know that 5% of any sales that I make on Netherworld when it releases will be split between the Red Cross, the World Wildlife Fund, and Child's Play.

 

Thank you! I really appreciate if you decide to help to make this happen. The most direct way is certainly to actually contribute, but it does really also help out a lot when you simply spread the word!
story_txt:
Netherworld has a playable Windows demo now! You can download the demo here. Check the question marks at the bottom of each screen to read up on basic instructions! Also, remember to click on the little dots as well – that is how you collect Essence that you will need.

Netherworld is an abstract exploration rogue-like game with tactical combat encounters, which takes place in a dreamy, ethereal space called the Netherworld. The procedurally generated universe makes sure that no two situations are ever the same, and the robust mechanics always invite you to come up with your own smart and creative solutions. For starters, construct your own custom spellpowers with the open-ended custom spell creation system!

Your exploration quest will take place in an abstract and otherworldly space called the Netherworld, where you can actually encounter places such as an Essence Vortex, a Crystalline Dreamweaver, or a Rich Viridian Cloud. We aim to create an ambience that will be at the same time mysterious, so that you will always want to explore the universe beyond the horizon, and sublime and ornamental in detail, so that you can have a relaxed and meditative aesthetic experience.

 

In its heart, Netherworld is an exploration game and plays around the most classic RPG core loop that we all love: You need to overcome obstacles, so that you can reach more resources, which increase your power, and allow you to overcome even more difficult obstacles and explore even deeper into the universe. There are several ways how you can win – you will need to either beat the ultimate combat encounter, activate all the beacons that are scattered in the world, or enact a unique ritual that requires several rare and exotic components.



 
You will encounter many different locations in your exploration, each with its own particular way to either help or block you on your way to victory. Some locations will provide you with more resources, while others will allow you to boost a particular statistic, or to construct a new spellpower. Some more malicious locations will try to block your exploration ambitions: these will be mostly tactical combat encounters, but could also be monumental wardens that will not let you pass until you activate certain beacons somewhere else, barriers that will open only when you have transmuted a certain crystal or a certain dust, and so on.
While some locations offer you immediate rewards, others provide you with an opportunity that you may choose to return to later, when the circumstances have changed and you possess the necessary resources, or when it turns out that you unexpectedly require their services.
For example, these are some of the locations that you can encounter:
Essence Vortex: You can spend some Essence to harmonise the vortex, which will make it provide you with a little Essence whenever you win in a battle. Essence is the most universal resource you have, and to harmonise a vortex is basically an investment.
Attentive/Observant/Sleepless/Wary Sentinel: The Sentinel will not let you pass, at least not until you learn its secret – which may be located somewhere else in the universe, maybe?
Chromatic Catalyst: You can use the Chromatic Catalyst to transmute your elementary dusts into more potent, composite dusts. For example, you can transmute Crimson Ashes, Scarlet Powder and Vermilion Cinders to create the Garnet Dust, and so on. You always exhaust the Catalyst a little when you use it, up until the point where you cannot use it anymore, and have to locate another one.
Azure/Carmine/Brass Transmuter: Transmuters allow you to transmute basic dusts that you have an abundance of into other basic dusts that you perhaps need more importantly at the moment. However, every Transmuter only works with the dusts of a particular color: Azure with blue, Carmine with red, and Brass with yellow.
Oscillator: You have two options how to calibrate the Oscillator – either to an Equilibrium Oscillator, which increases your Stability, or to a Considerance Oscillator, which boosts your Spirit. The Oscillators provide you with a more substantial bonus when you calibrate more of them in the same way, so you have to balance between a more substantial bonus to one statistic, or a less substantial one to both.
Transcendental Monument: The Monument allows you to learn a new vocation. Unlike at the Archway, where you can only learn the one vocation that is available at that Archway, the Monument allows you to choose which vocation you want to pick up. However, it costs you more Experience to unlock a vocation at the Monument than what it would cost at the Archway.
Crystalline Dreamweaver: You can spend Essence to unlock an additional spellpower slot that you can load up your spellpowers into while in a combat encounter.
The robust core mechanics allow for a lot of space for many unique locations, and we absolutely want to explore this breadth, so that you can encounter new locations even when many hours down the road!

In order to reach new locations and reap their sweet, sweet rewards, you will have to overcome many anomaly encounters, which is where Netherworld switches to its turn-based, open-ended tactical combat mode. There are several basic encounter schemes that determine what you have to achieve in order to overcome the encounter, such as Elimination, Assassination, Assault or Survival, and then there are several randomly chosen entities, each with its own particular mischievous way to try and stop you.



 
Every entity has a very simple action that it takes whenever you cast any ability: Noises will reduce your Stability, Spectres will drain your Spirit, while Abominations will countdown until they explode and hurt you real bad. Some entities, such as Wards, may raise barriers around or directly heal other entities, while Constructors spawn more entities until you stop them. And you better be ready when you meet the Nemesis, because, well, it doesn't like you.
The important part is that while the all the entities by themselves are usually really straightforward in what they do, it's their random selection system that creates an enormous possibility space of how many scenarios you can potentially encounter, each with its own very distinct dynamic. When you have an Abomination cluster that will blow your Stability away in ten turns time, a Noise Constructor that continuously spawns new Noises which reduce your Stability every turn, and a Spectre line-up which, in the meantime, drains your Spirit that you need to cast your spellpowers every turn – what do you do?
The most important decision that you have to make in a battle is what spellpowers you choose to load up into your spellpower slots. You can choose which spellpowers you want to load up into your ability slots whenever you want, but once you pick a spellpower into a slot, that is indeed what spellpower you will have in that slot for the entire battle! Your power selection will have primordial impact on how well you will probably do in the battle, because based on what entities are on the screen, and what do you need to achieve, some abilities will be pretty much exactly what you need, while others may simply make no sense. What makes or breaks your success is always how well can you understand the situation that you are in, and choose an appropriate toolset that will help you effectively achieve what you need to do.
TL;DR: You can leave your leet minmax Excel skills at home this time, because it is time to show some actual smart play!

Extraplanar Broadcasts: When you contribute on the Extraplanar Broadcaster level, you unlock a new screen in the main menu where you can select an Extraplanar Transmission that you want to broadcast. Each Transmission represents a particular bonus, all the players' installations are occasionally synchronised via our server, and when other players encounter an Extraplanar Hyperstone in their universes, they will receive a reward which corresponds to a transmission that is randomly selected from those that the broadcasters currently broadcast.
In other words, when you are an Extraplanar Broadcaster, it is up to you to choose what reward do the players receive when they encounter an Extraplanar Hyperstone in their worlds, and you are randomly selected between all the broadcasters.
Every Extraplanar Broadcaster will have their own random Transmission selection to start with, but based on your achievements in the game, you will continually unlock more Transmissions that you can start to broadcast. You can always discuss with other players on the Forums what the best transmission is, but the decision is ultimately always up to you!

Developed in LÖVE, Netherworld will be available on Windows, MacOS, and Linux.


The amount that I raise will be spend in two primary ways: I will need to hire a visual artist that will help me realise the visual vision that I have, and I also need to survive the entire development process in terms of not starving to death and having a place to stay and an internet access.
I have learned to work entirely with open source or free-to-use tools, so there are no expenses in this column, and I'll also come back to live in Prague, where the living costs are much more reasonable than in London – so that's why the amount that I crowdsource is less than what it usually is with the videogame propositions. 

My expectation is to release Netherworld in the Q1 2014.

I wanted to let you know that 5% of any sales that I make on Netherworld when it releases will be split between the Red Cross, the World Wildlife Fund, and Child's Play.



 

Thank you! I really appreciate if you decide to help to make this happen. The most direct way is certainly to actually contribute, but it does really also help out a lot when you simply spread the word!

story:
Vampire Run! The Game

Na jaren van terreur pikken de dorpelingen het niet langer en komen in de opstand. De vampieren vluchten hun kasteel uit en zoeken hun toevlucht in de grotten. En laat het nu net zo zijn dat de wanhopige dorpelingen daar hun maagden hebben verstopt. En wat doe je als vampier als je langs een verstijfde maagd rent? Vlucht je door of blijf je even staan om dat te doen wat vampieren altijd met maagden doen. Maar de dorpelingen komen steeds dichterbij. En was deze maagd het risico wel waard?

Wordt een vampier maar verbaas je niet als maar als de helft van de spelers weten te ontsnappen.

---

The villagers are fed up and start an uprise. Vampires have fled from their castle and areseeking refuge in the caves where the desperate villagers just happen tohave hidden their virgins.

And what do you when you are a vampire as you run past a frozen virgin? Do you keep running or do you stay and do what vampires always do with virgins? Remember the villagers are closing in. Was this woman worth the risk?
Become a vampire but do not be surprised if only half of the players manage to escape.


What do you get

Bestel het spel en ontvang het voor de Kerst. Vermaak je vrienden met Vampire Run!
Het spel bestaat uit 24 route tegels, 14 maagdenkaarten, 36 bewegingskaarten, 12 pionnen, 10 witte kubusjes en de spelregels.

Order the game and receive it before Christmas. Entertain your friends with Vampire Run!
The game contains 24 route cards, 14 virgin cards, 36 movement cards, 12 pawns, 10 white cubs and the game rules.

story:
Dawnkeeper - medieval 2D Action/RPG for iOS/Android/Mac by Planemo Studio, full of blood, hordes of furious monsters, whistling arrows and remarkable boss fights. Feed the monsters with arrows! Let 'em burn with magic!

* Help to our project with bitcoin you will receive rewards when the project will be released, regardless of whether the company has successfully completed or not.

Dawnkeeper is a classic 2D "the last survivor" action. The main character, Yakov, the only one who survived the ruthless destruction of his Order. Game concept in one sentence: defend your position and kill all monsters ! 

Of course, will make it much harder than to say. The game takes place in a fully 2D- dimensional projection with different awesome backgrounds. As the game progresses, Yakov will explore the various castles, cemeteries, ruins of churches, inhospitable swamps and abandoned villages.

Follow us: Facebook, Twitter, Vkontakte


* Two game modes: campaign and survival

* Three heroes with different mechanics: Hunter, Mage and Gnome

* Multiple endings depending on your choices

* Dynamic battles against hordes of enemies

* A lot of different weapons (crossbows, axes, stuffs, stake gun), powerful spells, various elixirs and customized skins

* Exciting and hard fights with bosses with unique mechanics

* Interesting quests and original characters

* The game is free-to-play. Perhaps in the future appearance of separate commercial expansion(extension) with new features done (about this, see below).

* Game is being developed in the COCOS2D-X game engine for Mac & iOS/Android.

Stirya - a huge empire, belted mountains on the one side and the sea on the other side, stretches from west to east. Controlled by the Emperor, it has all sorts of peoples and races. The fertile lands of the Empire divided into three main districts managed by vassals of the noble houses, the combined rulers these lands. Styria maintain friendly trade relations with it neighboring, Essorsky Empire.

But wealth and prosperity has not always been in these lands. Initially, the site of the Empire was constantly torn by many internecine strife and wars principalities, all power was concentrated in the hands of sorcerers and black magic. In those days was more chance of contracting the plague of the whole city, than the healing of the wounds of a dying soldier. In the end, tired of the gloom and endless wars comprehensive handful of rebels, united under the leadership of a great warrior founded the Order of Hyperion, sworn to serve the Eternal Light. Having seized the powerful artifacts, they were able to counter the sorcerers, and a huge number of people using the word and the sword to take control of all principality. Most dark sorcerers were killed, those whose soul is not completely absorbed Darkness sworn to serve the Eternal Light, formed Circle of Mages.

Empire already thriving 7,000 years since then, but there is no peace for the soul of the Emperor, recently heard rumors started from distant outposts of attacks unseen creatures, of the dead walking around in the dark...

Moving on, from endless battles with swarms of monsters Dawnkeeper has a storyline with many different interesting quests and remarkable characters, where you will be defend the villages, help to citizens, to overthrow the corrupt lords and put his governors. Also, there are a lot of side missions that allow to fight for unique weapon or armor.

Moving through the storyline Yakov not just have to choose what to do in any situation that would eventually lead him to one of several endings available. In our vision, that's what makes a full-fledged role-playing game RPG - freedom of choice.

Take a moment to listen to Dawnkeeper soundtrack samples, created by our talented composer.

SIMULTANEOUS RELEASE FOR


It's possible to release the game on additional platforms, but they will not be immediately available after the initial launch.

EARLY ACCESS TO THE PROJECT [Beta-Version] (iPhone + Andorid)

You can try to play the beta version of an existing project on your mobile device to assess its prospects, make up their minds or give any useful response.

For android users that's enough to join this group and then you can download a beta version of the link.

1. Join the group: 

https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104539681851241569531

2. Download the game: 

https://play.google.com/apps/testing/com.planemostd.dawnguard

iPhone users need to send an email to hunter@planemostd.com with text "BETA" to connect you to the platform for testing.

The full game with all the features we want to include in it will cost more than the sum we aim to raise through IndieGoGo. We have already invested a considerable amount of our own money.

We have chosen to put this project on IndieGoGo, because we wholeheartedly believe in the power of collaboration, and we want wonderful people like you involved!

Part of the funds received will cover IndieGoGo costs as well as transaction fees, taxes, and expenses related to manufacturing and shipping physical rewards. The rest of the raised by this project will be used mainly on the following:

* Full translation of the game to English by professional translators.

* Writing the full version of the game scenario and the individualization of the characters, dialogue and so on.

* Sound design, because it's one of the key elements of gameplay, which creating the whole game atmosphere, so this is going to be a large job requiring months of intensive work.

* Payment of testers to check the stability of the final version of the game on all planned platforms.

* All the extra work hired freelancers such as: polishing the GUI design, animated cutscenes, additional artworks and other small tasks.

We are determined to complete the game but without funds from IndieGoGo, though, it will take a much longer development time and we will have to omit some features and content, especially material produced by external designers.

Because game development is hard to predict, there may be delays in the original plan. Budget-wise, we plan to set aside a reserve fund to cover potential delays. Should our estimated workflow proceed as expected, the reserve will be used for free post-release updates, fixes, enhancements etc.; otherwise we are prepared for a possible longer development time.

We will keep everyone updated to make sure you know what we are doing at every moment and which phase we are in.

story:
About Subtle Stone

We're a two-man indie game studio based in San Francisco, CA trying to make the world a better place to live in through the power of video games. 

What is Dark Deception

Dark Deception is an epic sci-fi RPG to be released under an open-source license. The game takes place in the year 2019 in the former state of California, eleven years after civil war left the region under the rule of two private military corporations, MSF and ESA, which are perpetually at an uneasy truce. Xavier Harvey, a young mercenary from the former company, unintentionally breaks a peace treaty, thereby reigniting an apocalyptic war between both corporations. The player’s adventure follows Xavier’s quest to resolve the conflict and end the very war that he started. Will the corporations make peace, or will the war escalate to engulf and consume the world itself? This story can only be told with your help, so assess for yourself whether or not this fictional world is truly one worth saving.

Why We Do What We Do

17,106 game development jobs were lost in the last four years. Over one-hundred studios closed.

We believe that the contemporary game industry is headed in the wrong direction, and if the course of history is not altered, the medium will plunge into a Second Crash exceeding the scale of that of 1983. The current model of the industry, with hundreds of studios putting millions of dollars to create ludically identical games in competition for the annual holiday season, has proven itself to be unsustainable, sending the dreams of thousands of game developers into oblivion. The industry is a brutal and scary place for any young college student entering it for the very first time, our goal is to change that. 

A safe transition must be made to a smaller and more sustainable model of production. Lower financial risks permits studios to take greater creative risks, pushing forward video games as an artistic medium. In order to prevent a Second Crash from disrupting the medium, the video game industry must evolve past its corporate phase and adopt a smaller, independent model of production with higher creative risks and lower financial losses, this model has already proved successful on the App Store, Steam, and XBLA. Dark Deception, our epic open-source RPG, will support this movement by adopting an experimental model of distribution and releasing the entirety of its source code under an open-license, permitting anyone in the world to learn, explore and experiment with the intricacies of game development. This open-licensing will enhance the lives of indie game developers by providing a vast library of preexisting code, assets, and documentation for use in their own projects, commerical or otherwise. Furthermore, open availability of the game's code will greatly contribute to education in computer science and media arts by motivating students to explore and experiment to build their own games.


And Should We Fail...

Should we fail to acquire the funding we need to succeed and support this movement, we believe that the mainstream video game industry will enter a large period of recess, thereby causing the further loss of thousands of jobs. We need your help to move the industry as a whole to a sustainable model, and we hope that you can put your faith in us to keep the industry open, sustainable, and creatively welcoming.

What We Need & What You Get

We are entirely self-funded and work independently of any major game publisher. Thus, the costs of development are very high. Being an open-source project, the final product will be released free of charge; thus, we cannot make revenue from sales. To complete the game, we will need your help!

We will put our fundraising goal relatively low at $3000, which should be enough to file for FBN and to fund Dark Deception's development for a year, if we work part-time from home and make smaller, commercial releases to round things out. If we surpass that goal, that's absolutely fantastic! We will use the surplus money to move to full-time development, support more platforms, and to hire new personnel to add to the studio. We're going to make this fun. For donating, we have exclusive and rare rewards such as in-game equipment, signed copies, and opprotunites to influence development! Even better, by donating on a higher perk tier, you'll also receive all the perks from the lower tiers!

 

Exceeding our Funding Limit


If we exceed our funding goal by a huge amount, we will extend the ambitions and scope of our game by porting the game to more platforms. 

If we exceed 2x the funding goal ($6000) - We will try move the game off XNA to an alternate framework so the core game will be multiplatform. 

If we exceed 3x the funding goal ($9000) - I will write a novel about the experience of producing the game. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign! Tweet it, post it to your Facebook profile and blog about it! If you're a gaming journalist, do a write-up about it. If you're also a game developer, feel free to contribute art assets and code (C# and XNA please)! This can be both an incredible game and a milestone moment for open and transparent culture, education, and entertainment! Whether this endeavor is a historical moment for the medium or a total flop is up to you, so help us out and join the impact! Also, if you're interested in picking up some of our existing games, check out Y.A.Z.G.

story:
STORY:

"Hey dude ! Am I dreaming or did she just crush his skull with her breast ?"

The legend speaks of a place, in the Far North, were the Amazons began their journey. After years of wandering, they have finaly settled in the estuary of a huge river, far from their home, in one of the deepest jungle in the Old World.

Amazons have an extremely mobile game style and their capacity to dodge the ennemy's attacks allow them to develop numerous tactics.

So, if your wish is to trash over-manly opponents, this "full metal throng" team is waiting for you.

 

Here's my 1st  team, it has been made by a Gamer for Gamers : 

The miniatures were imagined and designed in 3D from the begining. Each of them has a stable stance, on both feet to avoid any risk of damage during games. They are designed to be easy to paint so that you can spend more time gaming rather than painting .

Some models have alternative heads to further customize them, and each miniature can evolve slightly over time.

Every miniature is printed in high resolution by a Envisiontech printer and cast in high quality resin by GRX Creation(made in France).

Delivery :

The players will be packed with care and love :-)

The deliveries will probably take place in February.

Risk :

Product images3D may be slightly different than actual product received, if during the casting we encounter unexpected difficulties.

The product has to be assembled and painted.

Thank you "KUMULO" for this new emblem

Thanks for your support !

selected four blitzer of a total of eight for your team

 

 

The stretch goals will be available with the pledges that include one team or more.

 




Example of " custom pack "

 

LEVEL 1:Thanks for your support : it means a lot to us.

LEVEL 2: two  Catcher( models 3 & 4)

LEVEL 3:selected four "blitzer" of a total of eight

LEVEL 4: tree random linewomen models

LEVEL 5:This pledge will get you a complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :
6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.

You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.

LEVEL 6:This pledge will get you a complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :
6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.

You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.

LEVEL 7:This pledge will get you a complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :
6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.

You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.

LEVEL 8:This pledge will get you 3 complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :
6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.

That means 36 models !

You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.

LEVEL 9:This pledge will get you 3 complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :
6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.

That means 36 models !

You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.

:-)The deliveries will probably take place in February.Risk :Product images3D may be slightly different than actual product received, if during the casting we encounter unexpected difficulties.The product has to be assembled and painted.Thank you "KUMULO" for this new emblemThanks for your support !selected four blitzer of a total of eight for your team  The stretch goals will be available with the pledges that include one team or more. Example of " custom pack " LEVEL 1:Thanks for your support : it means a lot to us.LEVEL 2: two  Catcher( models 3 & 4)LEVEL 3:selected four "blitzer" of a total of eightLEVEL 4: tree random linewomen modelsLEVEL 5:This pledge will get you a complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.LEVEL 6:This pledge will get you a complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.LEVEL 7:This pledge will get you a complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.LEVEL 8:This pledge will get you 3 complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.That means 36 models !You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.LEVEL 9:This pledge will get you 3 complete women team of 12 Fantasy Football Players :6 Linewomen models / 4 Blitzer models / 1 Thrower models / 1 Catcher model.That means 36 models !You will also have all the free strech goals unlocked during the campaign.

story:
New campaign:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lovecraft-tales-episode-1-adventure-horror

So, head over there if you happen to land on this page. We really need your support now!

Demo released

If you somehow navigated here, just go to http://lovecrafttales.com and get the demo! Despite we were not funded here, we're not dead. More than that, we are well. Follow our facebook profile for latest news


In the meantime stay tuned and check our official website (http://lovecrafttales.com) - it will be online soon.

 

Updates (more in "updates" tab)

 

Iä! Shub-Niggurath! The Black Goat of the Woods with a Thousand Young!

 

 

Video diary part 3
Video diary part 2
Video diary part 1

Leave feedback, please ♥

Because you are here, I assume, that Lovecraft Tales got your attention, right? If you can't wait to play that game, that's great, just skip that. Contribute :)... But, if something terrible prevents you from that, please tell me: What is that? What can we do about it?
I noticed that it happened for too many people, and I feel obligated to help you.  Please email me directly (lovecrafttales@gmail.com ) or leave a comment in our facebook page, but please - be sincere. It will take you about minute, but it will really help us make better game. We need you :)

If it's about amount collected so far - don't hesitate, because game like that can be funded within 24 hours, you know that :). So, if that's the reason, don't let it be the reason, because if you all start to contribute without thinking - "oh, maybe I would, but it doesn't make sense, because they won't make it anyway" - we will reach our goal within days! Don't listen to that little voice, because he is wrong - we can make it! So it's all up to you, really :).

If it's another reason, well, I want to know that - because without knowing your objections, I don't have a chance to handle them. So, if you have any objection, that's great, because it means that you want the game! Objection is a shy yes :)... And any objection - I can handle.

*** Ok, so that's it for announcements :) ***

 

 

 

 

 

A game of your dreams (or worst nightmares)

Imagine a lovecraftian game, that just drags you into it's cold, dark world, and forces you to face unknown terrors older than this world.

Imagine breathtaking adventure in a dynamic, living enviro nment, with a day and night cycle, hunger, fatigue and insanity. Add a beautiful, painterly, retro-like visuals and music that is a unique blend of dark ambient and orchestra on top of that.

Now you understand, why it must happen, right?

 

Features

 

Lovecraft Tales will be 2d side-scrolling game, but it will be built it full 3d, using Unity engine. I call it adventure game, but it's probably not what you think of, when you think of an "adventure game". I really don't focus on genres, I focus on creating immersive world and cool gameplay.

 

 

 

3d approach to a 2d game

 

 

I tried to use 2d engines, but none of them gives so much flexibility. Besides that, real perspective goes far beyond parallax layers, and makes whole game more scalable - it allows to use lights, mix some 3d models with 2d (although I don't want to do it, because I want to keep that style. Besides that, 2d is what is possible and what such a small team can handle). Plus, it handles lots of objects efficiently
 

Mechanics - keep it simple (but not too simple)

Whole idea evolved from my inspiration with Limbo, and my experience I gained from working on OddPlanet. I wanted to extend that concept, make it bigger, longer, scarier, more fun, more interactive, more lively and less linear. Unfortunately, it wasn't possible then, due to technical limitations of the engine and mobile devices.

 

Although, I want to keep the mechanics simple. Of course there will be some puzzles to solve, but I want to focus on creating some repeatable systems, that will add more fun at a relatively low cost, instead of focusing on sophistcated, unique puzzle.
By that I mean:

 

  • Day and night cycle (and playing some hide and seek with monsters)
  • Hunger
  • Fatigue
  • Insanity (beware of dark woods at night)
  • Diary (to collect pieces of story)

 

Non-linear level structure

 

To tell Lovecraft Tales right I need to create tension and it seemed to me quite difficult to achieve with a side-scrolling approach - because when you face thing, you just face it and that's it. You can kill it or be killed, but there's no way around.

 

But then it just struck me - of course there can be a way around it! I can just create layered level and switch between layers, back and forth. So, that's the concept that's gonna make this game different.

 

Art

There's one cool thing about 2d- it won't age. It will always look great.
I was raised on games that are back in fashion now. Although I really love pixel art, and right now there are more and more professional looking productions, I'd like to do something opposite - take that feeling that I remembered from the old games, take the best from their mechanics and use today's technical possibilities to push it beyond previous limitations.

It's kind an old-school done like a new-school, I hope you get my idea :).

 

 

 

 

Music

Ahh, here's my favourite part. It was playing in my head from the very beginning, I think, and maybe that's why I'm so clear and so excited about it - and now even more excited, because I found someone who is capable of doing is.

Music will be a unique blend of dark ambient (inspired by artists like Lusmord) and classical one (like Alfred Schnittke in some intense parts). It will be dynamic, context-dependent, and played on real orchestral instruments. I hadn't heard what Hubert prepared when I was writing these words, but your mind has been probably blown already :).

Talking about Lovecraft Tales:

 

 

Why do we need you?

The whole idea has been in development for about 1.5-2 years right now. It's difficult to trace it's start, because it began with some inspiration, thinking and drawing, It's been quite chaotic and I just took notes - I wasn't thinking then, that it will grow so big.

Quite lot of time, right? Well, but there was also a lot of other stuff to do - company, freelancing, etc. After that time I managed to form a team and now I'll have to pay all that great people so as to fuel the game development.  So now you know, why I need you :). 

Of course, we have a solidplan for that game. Let me introduce our stretch goals:

 

...And last but not least - I'm so excited about this game (cause it's gonna be awesome), that when we get funded, I'm going to perform a celebration dance in Cthulhu uniform, to the tune of Pharrel Williams'es "Happy"... And I'll share it with you. Trust me, you don't want to miss it :).
 

The cake

 

You can see how it looks like, so I hope it's pretty self-explanatory. Numbers are based on my research - I looked through many subcontractors to come with these. Based on that, I set our goal to $80000, because it's the smallest sum, that allows me to pay my teammates and myself and get things done.
 

What's in it for you?

As you'll be scrolling down, you'll see, that rewards are a pretty lucrative deal. Lifetime discount for all products! C'mon, who else will give you that?
Of course, I'll be always giving people as much value as I can, but for those, who are with me at the beginning, I want to do something special. You'll be kickstarting not only Lovecraft Tales, but the whole gaming brand. Yay!

 

So, whenever in the future when you'll see this logo:

 

...You'll be pretty excited :)

(Yeah, I had another name, but it was so silly... better forget about that)

 

GET IT FOR FREE! Spread the word!

I prepared even more coolness for you. I'll give my game for free to some of you. How will I make it and why it's a win-win deal for everyone?

Ok, so here is how it works
  • Post a private comment or contact me through e-mail, whatever you like
  • Leave me your e-mail address
  • I'll send you a promo code
  • Now bring me your friends, and ask them to write your promo code next to the name, when they contribute (like this: Name | Code)
  • If you bring me at least 3 of your friends, you'll get the game for free! Yay!
  • Each friend must contribute at least $10
You'll be able to get most rewards that way (believer and apostole rewards don't count, cause I don't think I could handle more people) - the general idea is that your friends need to contribute triple amount of your reward value (discount prices don't apply to you). If any of your friends buys a discounted package, price after discount will add to your value, not regular price.
 

One condition: your referral buddies can't have their codes, they must buy package - otherwise I'd give away for free everytning - and that's not how it works. It have to be win-win :). If you want a free package by referrals, but you bought first - no refunds. On the other side, time limitations don't apply to you. Fair enough, right?
 

Experience

I have several years of experience as a freelance artist in the game industry, I'm also running a company - a graphic studio - together with my wife. So, I also have experience as a web & graphic designer, copywriter and marketer (like everyone doing his own business).
I'm also on a good way to becoming a business owner, because more and more rarely I have this feeling that business owns me :).
 

I have worked on several games so far. I was a co-author of OddPlanet, where I did everything related to graphic - including level design, animations, logo, GUI, concepts and assets creation. I also created two games myself, using Construct2 engine - Scrap (2d Descent-like shooter) and Pulse (space themed tower defense, with some innovative ideas). Players reacted positively, but there were technical issues with html5 technology, so I decided to team up with a programmer. I also work as a main artist for Dungeoneers, where I care about every visual aspect of that game (right now we're redoing almost everything, so you won't see much of my work there yet).
 

Core Team
 

Sewer Hrehorowicz (that's me :)
The Author of the game and a lead artist. Creating games was the biggest dream of his childhood, and now he is making this dream come true. He has experience not only as a game designer and an artist, but also as a graphic and web designer, copywriter - because he did many different things while not realizing his dream. But that's a whole different story...

 

Ed
Ed began his adventure with programming computer games right after first computers were available, back in the Atari age. So obviously, he has a LOT of experience. He worked on his own and as a subcontractor. He created a real-life tram simulator. Unfortunatelly, I can't reveal his identity because we afraid that Russian government will go after him for hacking some nuclear missiles. Well, who hasn't done some silly things in the youth?

 

Hubert Świątek
He is a world-class composer and his work is going to make this game huge, because thanks to that you will really feel a cold breath of the ancient ones...
Hubert did music for movies, theater performances, he worked with a famous polish VFX studio.  He cooperated with Gdynia Film School and PWST National Academy of Theatre Arts in Krakow.
 

Other contributors

 

 

Daniel Niszczota
Concept and assets artist. His imagination really makes impression. I don't know how he does this, but it looks like he has a connection with some higher being, because concepts seem to just flow through him. Thanks to his passion and dedication to work, few years from now he will become one of world's best. 

 

 

4u4avfx
A great animator, that will make this game look alive. He's a godsend, because - to be honest - my animation just sucks and his is just great. That will prevent you all from throwing eggs at me. Win-win.

Tobias Ezra Queen
He did awesome deep, crushing voiceover for the intro. Thanks to him, you're still reading this, so for that I am really grateful.
 

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    I die.
    Well, I can't do pretty much then :(. That's the only risk I can't overcome really. I think that war, pestilence, earthquake etc. should also fall into this category.

    I get seriously sick.
    That's the second thing that could get me out of the business. Being aware of that, I try to eat and live healthy, and also keep some inner balance - yoga, sports, meditation - to be not only physically, but also mentally in a good shape. 

    We hit some technical obstacle impossible to overcome.
    There are few things that protects us against it. We use Unity engine, that has all tools necessary to make a game like this, and we try to keep things simple.

    One of teammates quits.
    Only Ed's quitting could really cause a problem. I hope it never happens but in such a case I find another programmer. Thanks to my experience in almost all areas of the development process, and due to some experience in recruiting people for our business, it will be easier. We also use Unity and Git for versioning.

    It gets more expensive than I supposed.
    That's why I assumec some buffer in the budget. That's why we try to keep things simple thus predictable, and that's why I began looking for subcontractors long time ago.
     

    Questions?

    If you have any questions about the game, please use comments section to ask them. I'll answer all of them. Not personally, though, because there will be thousands of you, but most of you will have similar questions.
     

    Thank you!

    -Sewer Hrehorowicz

story:
What is this?

Save the Galaxy is a revolutionary new puzzle game that might be the next thing! It's so easy to learn but still very addicting and entertaining thanks to all the different courses and different types of special-blocks!

Take a look at the video to see what I mean! It is a brilliant game!


How does the game work exactly? 

The main goal in every course is to get rid of all the blocks, but it's not as easy as you may think it is, every move has be in the right order and there are only a few ways to complete every course. You are only allowed to drag a line over three blocks at a time, horizontal or verical, not diagonal. If you do not make it the first time, do not worry, you can try as many times as you wish! 

There will be 300 courses in total and along the way you will be facing new types of blocks that makes the game even harder.


Why do I need your help?

I need your help because the project has stopped due to studies, money and time. I really need your help to finish making this game. I tried to make the video a representable copy of my vision but it is still a lot of work left:

  • There is no music (boring, right?)
  • Less than 10 courses have been made, it will have at least 300 courses when it is done! :)
  • iPad support
  • Some changes in the graphics
  • Behind the scenes (e.g. iCloud sync between iPad and iPhone so you can continue playing without struggle, Facebook publishing, friend invite, ad-supported version)
  • Appstore-expenses (Yes, it costs money to publish on the App Store)


Is this only for iOS devices?

Currently it's only developed to supported iOS supported versions but depending on the funds i might be able to present an android version as well! It will support iPhone and the iPad. (iOS version 7 and higher)

Behind the scenes (e.g. iCloud sync between iPad and iPhone so you can continue playing without struggle, Facebook publishing, friend invite, ad-supported version)
Appstore-expenses (Yes, it costs money to publish on the App Store)
Is this only for iOS devices?Currently it's only developed to supported iOS supported versions but depending on the funds i might be able to present an android version as well! It will support iPhone and the iPad. (iOS version 7 and higher)

story:
Orcland is a game about tribes of Orcs and their favourite hobby: Swinging their clubs! Lead them into action against other human players, alone or in coop.

The Orcies of Orcland are cute, clumsy and smart - not to mention fearsome! They are a rowdy bunch and love getting into fights - in Orcland, any day they are not clubbing each other over the head is a wasted day. Or at the very least a boring one, which is basically the same.

The Orcs live in small groups and villages and are not fond of technology. They have more of a Stone Age-thing going on.

Lead the Orcies into battle and help them become the strongest and most famous tribe in all the land! Explore huge tech trees and arm your Orcies with the very best weapons and items! Customize their outfit and make them look exactly the way you want.


We are a small team of four experienced game devs from beautiful Munich, Germany, best known for the infamous Oktoberfest and related Orc-like behaviour. :)

Building on our years of experience and our proven skills in the game industry, we want to realize our vision of a fun and accessible real-time-strategy game. We have spent the last couple of months building a fully functional, great-looking, well-designed, and most importantly, fun prototype for Orcland in our free time.

We are doing this without any money - we are driven by our passion and the fun of it. We have a vision for a great game and we want you to be able to play it!!


Our team loves real-time strategy games like Starcraft, Warcraft and Age of Empires. However, these games can be really hard to get into and need a lot of time-invest to play them. We would love to create a RTS that is easily accessible, and that you and your friends can play anywhere. Orcland is exactly about this!

Orcland is a multiplayer-only game with optional social features and focus on orc characters you can fall in love with. We want to make it easy to play, easy to find your friends and easy to immerse yourself in, while still having a great RTS feel.

What makes Orcland so special, you ask? We think it's the following 3 things which set Orcland apart from the rest:

Focus on Characters

We have created an intriguing game-world filled with beautiful and lovable characters. We want them to be in the focus of this game. These are not expendable marines that you recruit from a barracks - they are your tribe and they grow and develop with you. They do not die in battle and you can customize the way they look. They develop over time with the experience they gather.

Easy Entry

Orcland is a game which is very easy to get into. It will run on tablets and in web browsers using a free-to-play model. More and more game rules will be introduced over time, but this will be done gradually - we want players to feel comfortable in the game at all times.

Social Features

We feel that we can enrich the game with optional social features. That way it will be super-easy to find your friends in the game and play with them or against them. Trading items and other coop features will make the game more fun.


Until now we have spent our development time to create a great-looking multi-player prototype (the one in the trailer). We have put a lot of time into playtesting, making sure that it is really fun to play, and that all the concepts we came up with actually work!

Now we have the game running locally in our local networks and the time has come to bring it online, so you fine people can actually play and enjoy it!

The prototype is not a finished game, instead we have focused on the core mechanics.

Behind the scenes:


To bring the game online we will have to spend money on the game for the first time to buy a pro license of our game engine Unity3D. We need the pro version to be able to run the Orcland server on an internet host machine.

We currently do not have the funds to buy the pro licence which costs roughly 1100 €. We are turning to you to help us make this great game available for you!

We need roughly 1100 € ($1500) to buy the pro version of Unity3D. We will then build a web version of the Orcland server and host it online. The game will be available to all backers!

If there is an amount that exceeds the Unity3D license cost, we will use it to speed up the development significantly. Part of our team will then go fulltime on the game.


                                                                   

                                            


If we get funded, we promise to release our prototype online. Each and every backer will get alpha access to play the game whilst it is in development! We will then continue to work on the game and bring out new features. You will be the first to see them and your feedback will help to shape the game! Also check out the list of rewards below!

Alpha Access

Lucky you! You will get an alpha access to Orcland. This means you will be able to play as soon as it is online. You will be able to play and contribute and have your opinion get heard by us, the devs. :)

Fame, glory and a thank you!

Yes, you will get the alpha access to Orcland.
But also, we will immortalize you by adding you to the game credits and show our deep appreciaton through a unique thank-you-email from the dev team.

Internal Access

Be the first to see all the art and gameplay ideas! Participate in the process and help shape the game! You will have alpha access to Orcland, but you will also have access to our internal dev forum.

This comes with the 'fame, glory and thank you'.

Talk to us!

You will have an audio spoken word conversation with us, the dev team. We can offer either English or German.

Use this opportunity to ask us anything about the game or just chat with us. If we use skype or google hangouts it can be a video chat.

This includes all previous rewards.

Play with us!

Play the current state of the game with the team members in your own private session and chat with us over skype or teamspeak.

This includes all previous rewards.

Lunch time!

Have lunch or dinner with the dev team in Munich! Get treated for some nice food and have a chat with the devs. Food is on us, transport and accomodation on you.

This includes all previous rewards.


Part of the world

Become a part of the Orcland world - literally!
We will name an element in the multiplayer map after you, like a stone, a mushroom or the likes of it. Whenever a player clicks on the element your name will appear on the screen. You get to decide if we use your actual name or an 'orcified' version.
Even if we later change the maps, your name-element will persist. If Orcland becomes big, you will be able to brag about it forever!

This comes with all the other rewards, except the lunch.


Real-time Multiplayer

Play against other people in real-time - no taking turns, no waiting, only intense action!

Equipable Items

Take your time to prepare your Orcs for battle. Collect a large number of weapons and other items, they will open you up to huge tactical possibilities. Melee, ranged, one-hand, two-hand, weapon-and-shield, area effects, supporting roles and the likes.

Fill up your inventory with traps, healing potions and loads of other stuff.



Huge Tech Tree

Start out with the basic version for every weapon type. As you use these weapons you will be able to upgrade them to a variety of more advanced weapons and expore new game-play options in battle.

Character Customization

You decide exactly how your Orcs will look, what they will wear, how they will talk, what their name is and what haircut they have. Be individual!

We feel extremely lucky to be blessed with such a great team. We are filled with passion and love for the game, professionalism and proven industry skills. All of this clearly shows in the Orcland project.

Members of our team have worked on games like MUD TV, Dungeons, Dungeons the Dark Lord, Dark and Evolution: Indian Hunter.


(from left to right)


Senad worked for game companies in Munich on things like game engine design, AI, networking, graphics and game programming. Also he did research for companies like BMW. He is our coding wizard and also manages the team and the project.

Thomas has years of professional experience designing games. He is our source of good ideas, and always has something smart to say about Orcland. Have a look at his portfolio.

Flo graduated from the SAE Institute Munich with his Bachelor in Interactive Animation. Besides freelancing he now organizes a sketch-group in Munich and is giving a 3D workshop at an art school. He invented the Orcies! And did other visual concepts, 2D and 3D art. Have a look at his portfolio.

Alex graduated from the SAE Institute Munich with the Bachelor in Interactive Animation. He works on environment, 3D art and animations. Thanks to his talent the orcies are swinging their clubs and walking through beautiful forests and landscapes. Have a look at his portfolio.

Joh is an experienced stage and studio musician, composer and audio designer. Everything he touches becomes musical. Apart from this he manages his own professional recording studio not far from Berlin. We could not be happier to have him on our team! Check out his web page and go see him live when he tours with one of his bands!


Also please do contact us, we would love to hear what you think about Orcland! Send us your comments and questions, anything. We are all ears! :)
If you can not contribute with money, we would still love your support. Please spread the word about our campaign and let all your friends know about it!
