story:
Check The Media Section For Details On How To Play And Example Of Play

Strech goals will be added as limits are reached. I don't want to bait you into helping more than you want to.

Have you ever wanted to do more than roll some dice to see if you won an argument? Is the randomness, finality, and overall lack of control, unable to give the sense of drama in your RPG sessions? We'll Send It To Them is a universal system that could be just the thing you're looking for to enable such desires.

What makes it so special? The first thing that makes this essential is the level of involvement for the players. Whenever a conflict occurs, both parties help create the focus of the roleplay. They frame the tension, the passion and reality of the situation as their characters would see it and enables an experience that can't be achieved with freeform techniques found in most story games. It allows for players to become tied to their character and perform closer to what they intended the character to be in their head than just another backdrop dressing for a typical adventure of slaying dragons in some dark dungeon.

The system itself is simple, cohesive, and fast. You'll never have to flip thru hundreds of pages to fully understand it or play dozens of sessions to master it. In fact, you can fit everything you need on a 4''x6'' card with room to spare!

 

How does it achieve this? How does it work? If you read further, I'll explain how it works, then why I need your help to make this.

How To Play

Play begins whenever you want to have an in-depth debate, conversation, or argument. This could also be used to stretch out tension in a duel or other dramatic moments in your game. Both players agree with who will go first, then state what their characters want to accomplish if they win. Then, the first player gives preferably a one word emotion/object or phrase that could affect both characters. This word or phrase is called a weakness; a thing that could affect either character and cause them to lose. Each player goes back and forth repeating this step until both players do this 3 times, with a total of 6 weaknesses.

Both players then secretly choose 3 of those 6 weaknesses they think fits what their character is feeling. After that, they can begin play. Already from that framing of the scene, both players now have a great understanding how to roleplay their character without resorting to out of character discussion of what has happened in this scene. The focus stays on their characters, allowing for a greater sense of immersion most scene framing mechanics don't use.

Finally, the first player selects 3 of those 6 weaknesses and includes them in his first attack on the second player. The player applies those weaknesses as methods of manipulation to win over the other player. Once done, the second player will respond to each attack based on the weakness chosen. If a weakness was correctly chosen, the attacked player must acknowledge it worked. For every one that wasn't their weakness, they must respond in a negative way to let the attacking player know it didn't work. The second player then begins their turn and repeats the order of play again.

Once one of the players correctly selects all three weaknesses in one attack, that player wins the conflict. As you can see, the system itself allows for easy modification as well as enabling both players to express what their characters want and how they feel in the moment. It's great for that imposing villain spouting his dream for world domination or a pivotal moment when trying to prevent a character from jumping off that ledge to their doom.

Why I Need Your Help

While I want the system to be freely distributed for people to use, I also want to create a central hub to gather peoples' creations. The system works very well as a written format since it allows for people to take their time and respond in a sincere manner. If written, a trace of the game is left for others to read that are typically more intriguing than any actual play report could ever give. I want that space to exist so everyone can go there and read all these stories while also meeting each other for playing the game. I could get a free forum to try this, but users won't be able to upload photos directly to the site and they'll be quite a few other problems with ease of use if I went with a free site. That is where you come into play.

To help fund this dream, I created a 4x6 template that if used, can be printed out to make your very own postcard to play the game via mail. The rules will be on every postcard for ease of reference and include a picture on the front for inspiration. That picture can be customized to fit your needs as well, so your imagination is the limit.

The postcard template plus some original scenarios for play will be included with some postcards and shipped directly to you. The postcards will be used to include your scenario, so use it as a starting point to begin your first game. With the money raised and your products delivered, the $500 goal will enable me to start the website and host it for a year along with other funding if your pledges total over the goal.

Please note that I am taking almost none of your money for myself. This is truly one of those rare fund raising requests where very little of it will go in my pocket. Out of the $500, $50 will be taken by credit card fees, $140 from ordering the postcards, $100 to host the website for a year, $100 for shipping out the postcards, $100 for artwork on the postcard that'll be shipped to you. Pretty much that $10 left over will be spent on clerical errors I need to patch up when everything is ordered.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with any fellow writer or tabletop RPG player. I have very little influence in my community but want to make this dream a reality. Any donation will be great and any word of mouth support will enable others to know about it and use it if/when this becomes successful.

story:
My name is Andreas Propst and I am a young, up and coming designer of board and card games (as well as artist, fledgling book author and much more that does not matter now...) from Austria, who has been designing games with great passion - more or less successfully - for about 7 years now. On this here Indiegogo fundraising campaign, I want to introduce you to my World War 2 themed, highly customizable but non-collectible card game PANZER CLASH!

Panzer Clash is an easy-to-pick-up yet highly strategic, fully customizable card game for 2 - 4 players (best with 2 players) all about Second World War Panzer Battles. What we are offering you is a huge box of no less than 430 cards (probably more depending on the success of this very campaign) which will serve as an extensive card pool for countless hours of deckbuilding madness, from which countless hours of highly enjoyable, actual gameplay will result. Panzer Clash features many great mechanics such as an unique resoure system and, best of all, a modular battlefield consisting of various Terrain types, on which you will be moving around your Units, that will be generated at random at the beginning of every game. So no game of Panzer Clash will be the same! More on the actual rules and gameplay later. Alternatively you can watch the video review above, know however that said review is based on an older "incarnation" of the game. Still it will give you an idea of how Panzer Clash is played and what makes it a great, deeply strategic and overall enjoyable gaming experience.

Through this here campaign I am trying to realize Panzer Clash, which I have carefully and relentlessly developed and refined over more than 5 years, with my ultimate goal being not to "make the big buck", but rather to spread the game among as many gamers as possible for the greatest pleasure for me derives from  the notion that many people enjoy what I created and are just having a good time with some friends playing Panzer Clash for instance. Hence all is priced for us to break even, not to maximize personal profits.

And this is where YOU come in, valued potential backer! Having a large print run of a 430+ cards game manufactured and shipped out to customers (that is you, the gamers)  entails immense costs which I could not by any means cover myself, and hence the need for this campaign and hence the need for your pledge!

Let us make Panzer Clash a reality - Together we are strong!!

By means of this fundraising campaign, I intend to fund the manufacturing and worldwide distribution of a minimum print run size of 500 Units (copies of the game), which is an immensely costly thing to do and hence I am asking for your pledge to realize the game. One man like myself cannot possibly fund a huge project like this on his own, but if many people make their relatively small contribution, even seemingly outrageous amounts of funds can be raised in order to make a project like Panzer Clash a reality - and such is the very nature of crowdfunding. So: Long story short, the money you pledge will go entirely into the manufacturing of the Panzer Clash Customizable Card Game and into sending it out to the backers from all over the world. So the bulk of the costs are twofold basically: Manufacturing / Printing costs and shipping fees.

Now to what everyone has been waiting for:

We are both pleased and proud to be able to offer you some very fair and also unique PERKS!

We tried to keep the different perks as simple as possible while still offering you some very special deals. 
The basic perk will be the called the "Private" perk and will ensure you one full copy of Panzer Clash, that is more than 430 cards for just $50 shipped right to your door (If you happen to be based in the US. We do apologize for higher pricing for EU and Canadian backers due to increased shipping fees!). But that is not all we will be offering you:
  • Firstly we have an "Early Bird" special deal for you in store: The first 25 backers who pledge at the Private perk will receive their copy of Panzer Clash at a $10 USD discount, so if you act fast, you can get the full game for $40 USD shipped (provided you are in the US - international shipping will still be adding extra cost!). And if you are not quite so fast, there are also 25 copies of the game reserved for the first to grab them at a $5 USD discount (so the basic "Private" deal will cost you $45 USD - shipped within the US). 
  • Secondly, if you thought the regular Private deal itself was great, then get this: There will be a limited "Private First Class" perk that will ensure you a copy of the game PLUS the AWESOME Panzer Clash Official Soundtrack Audio CD AT NO ADDED COST FOR YOU. This deal is limited to 300 copies. The Soundtrack CD features a mighty line-up of metal bands from around the globe, big and small, popular and nearly unknown alike and is the perfect addition to anyone's heavy metal CD collection! The state-of the art Soundtrack CD does already exist and we have it readily in store. Here is some visual proof:

  • Besides the "Private" perks, we are especially pleased to offer you a truly unique, maybe even a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. Did you ever want to be IN an actual game or did you maybe even want to see you as a proud and fearless Panzer General? Well we can make this real for you - if you decide to pledge for the "General" perk! At this prestigious pledge level, you will not only receive a Panzer Clash Goodies Package, but, most important and unique, we will have our talented artist Robert Treherne paint you as a WW2 Panzer General, so your likeness will be on a card to be included in the finished game!! And this is what YOU could look like in the game (the sample below

    depicts an actual, real life person!):

  • If for whatever reason you would want two copies of the game and also the CD, we can offer you that at the "Sergeant" and "Staff Sergeant" perks (Staff Sergenat includes the CD). So maybe you know a friend who might be happy about a gift like the Panzer Clash Game, consider backing as "(Staff) Sergeant"!
Besides the diverse and fair perks, we are happy to offer you custom printed 

Panzer Clash Fan Shirts 

as extra goodies you can "purchase" by adding $45 USD (worldwide shipping included) to your pledge. We got them in 4 awesome designs, one for each Faction so you can pick your favorite! Here they are for you:

As in every decent crowdfunding campaign, rest assured that 

we will have Stretch Goals!

(For those who are new to crowdfunding projects: Stretch Goals are extra items or benefits for all backers for free if a certain number of overfunding is reached - so basically when we raise more money than necessary to meet the funding goal.)
But for this campaign we will be very sneaky about those and all I will say for now is that the first Stretch Goal will be revealed and unlocked and all backers will gain some exclusive bonus items at no further cost to them at all at $14000 USD. The Stretch Goals will be revealed once they are met. So if you are curious what we will have in store for you when we make an extra $1000 USD, do what you can to make this happen!
One more thing I will give away now: How about Custom Card Sleeves with an exclusive Panzer Clash design on the back? Wouldn't this be both awesome and useful to protect the cards in your decks from wear and tear? Anyways this will be not exactly cheap so expect this to be a high-end Stretch Goal. More info on this will be revealed soon, don't you worry!

Here, the basics of the game will be explained and we will treat you with some actual card samples for your viewing pleasure. It is however recommended to just watch the Preview Video on the top of the page to get an idea of how the game actually works - it is up to you.

And for those who are curious about the rules of Panzer Clash in detail, here is the download link to the full rules! (It is just plain text as of now but the final product will contain a nicely designed, full color rules booklet. Also, the wording may still be subject to changes - mechanics and rules themselves WILL NOT). Here's the link:

Panzer Clash Full Game Rules

In Panzer Clash, the goal of the game is to reduce the opponent "Supply" (their custom built deck of 60 or less cards) to zero cards by means of dealing damage through Units and Events. For each point of damage the opponent receives, they have to discard the topmost card from their Supply to their Junkyard (Discard Pile).

Is a player required to draw a card, for example during Draw-Phase, which occurs every turn, but cannot do so because their Supply is empty, they lose immediately.

In the Panzer Clash Base Game, which is what we are trying to raise funds for in this here campaign, there are 4 Factions which are the four main actors in the terrible events of WW2, namely the Germans and Japanese (Axis) and the Americans and Soviets (Allies). Factions only matter in deckbuilding as you cannot mix Axis with Allies cards in one Deck, for reasons of historical accuracy of course! However there are also many, many neutral cards that are not associated with any Faction in particular and that can hence go into any deck.

Probably the most unique and innovative feature Panzer Clash has to offer when it comes to gameplay is the Terrain Cards. Unlike in your normal, everyday Customizable Card Game, in Panzer Clash you have a modular battlefield created at random before every single game, consisting of different Terrain Cards...

...which may have positive or negative effects on the Units stationed on them, which adds a great amount of strategical depth and another, highly challenging and enjoyable tactical layer to the game. And what's more, the Terrain System also creates sort of a "Fog of War" situation, as Terrain cards are randomly placed face-down and only by moving a Unit there they are flipped face-up and you'll know if you get a bonus on movement as you hit a "Main Road" or your movement will be slowed down by some Mountains or Marshland for instance. Here is what the battlefield with the face-down Terrain cards would look like in a 2 player game:

On this battelfield you will be deploying your Units, which are built or recruited in your Factories, right behind your Back Line, and move them along on the different Terrain you will be discovering, with the ultimate goal of breaching the opponent lines of defense to reach their Back Line, from where your Units will be able to inflict damage to the opponent Supply/Deck directly. Here some samples for Unit cards:

Besides Units, you can unleash mighty Events that are also activated on your Factories (You will be stacking Factories in order to be able to afford higher cost Units and Events - costs range from 1 to 3). These Events have certain effects on the game and either affect you in a beneficial way like drawing extra cards for instance or are of harmful nature to your opponent. Here some samples:

Lastly, there are Terrain Modifier cards which do just what the name suggests: You put them on a face-up Terrain card and they will add certain abilities to the Terrain you placed the Modifier on. Here the samples:

And these are pretty much the basics of how a game of Panzer Clash is played. If you want to have a more in detail idea of the rules, just check them out on the link I gave above!
Furthermore, if you are curious about the cards that will come with Your Panzer Clash "Mega Pack", you can actually take a look and check out ALL the cards included here (Minor changes in wording could or will happen!):
Panzer Clash Full Visual Card Spoiler

    So the first 300 backers to grab this very special deal of us just giving away a kickass heavy metal audio CD - The Panzer Clash Official Soundtrack - on top of your copy of the Panzer Clash Card Game, will receive said CD along with the huge box of cards. Here some info on the Soundtrack:
    The Panzer Clash Official Soundtrack features a broad variety of bands, from really huge like Sabaton (Sweden), Hammerfall (Sweden) and Endstille (Germany) to small-scale, rather unknown and local, many of the latter being from my own home country Austria. The songs on this compilation all deal with the general subject of war or WW2 in particular and are a good mix from several Metal genres, from Black Metal over Trash and Death to Power Metal. Note that some of the smaller bands on the Soundtrack have written and performed songs ESPECIALLY for this exclusive Panzer Clash Soundtrack. Here's an example done by some friendly compatriots of mine - especially for this Soundtrack to emphasize it again:

    In case you want to know the detailed line-up of tracks on the official Panzer Clash Soundtrack, here you have it:

    Panzer Clash has been around for more than 5 years now, being available in various previous incarnations. This means the game is ready and has been ready for printing and publishing for years now. We have all the art and visual assets readily available and all that is needed to realize the game and send it right to your door, dear potential backer, is the money we are trying to raise from this very Indiegogo campaign.

    So you can expect and rest assured that there will not be any delays caused by further development of the game - no testing, tweaking, refining. All is ready and set for printing and distribution, which we intend to do ASAP after this campaign ended in successful funding. We will go out of our ways that your waiting time until you hold your copy of Panzer Clash in your hands will be reduced as far as possible for you.

    Furthermore, as you have seen in the photo above, the Panzer Clash Soundtrack CD already exists in physical form, is licensed and everything, and in fact just sitting in a huge box in my basement, ready to be shipped to you, valued backer!!

    Panzer Clash will be printed "clean&green" in the United States of America,

     by our trusted partner

    Quality Playing Cards & Games, based in Orlando, Florida, USA.

    Distribution of the games will be handled from the US as well through a trusted, long-term partner. This means there will be not much of a delay from printing to shipping all the games to our US-based partner to eventually shipping the product to you, the backer. 

    As this whole project is operated from the United States pretty much, we do apologize for the increased pricing for Canadian and EU backers. We are sorry, but there is no way around costly international shipping fees!

    Even if you cannot, for one reason or another, support this campaign in a monetary sense, for instance if you are all out of money or such, you can still, and we would humbly ask for you to do that, show your support and make your contribution to making this campaign a success and thus Panzer Clash a reality. How? It is easy. Tell a friend (or 2, or 20, or 200!!) about this campaign. Spread the news about the Panzer Clash Indiegogo fundraiser on your social media like twitter or facebook. If you have some friendly advice or helpful tips please do contact us (the designer's personal email address can be found below). Everything and anything to help us realize Panzer Clash, no matter how insignificant it may appear will be very welcome and most appreciated!

    Andreas Propst, born in 1987, grew up and still lives and works in rural Upper Austria as a freelance artist and illustrator, book author and designer of board and card games as well as as your general guy for pretty much anything creative.

    Andreas has been actively involved in game design for over 6 years and has great experience not only with designing tabletop games but also when it comes to the gaming industry itself. Over the last couple of years, the creative head has designed about two dozen games, many of which were well received in the boardgaming scene and got excellent critiques for the most part by experts and reviewers.
    Andreas' first game, Elemental Clash, on which Panzer Clash is based when it comes to rules and game mechanics, is probably the most well known among all the games Andreas created so far and is considered a "hidden gem" of a game by many  - as rumor has it! You can check out the game at www.elementalclash.com.
    If you are interested in Andreas' artwork and other creative projects, please have a look around on his online portfolio to be found at
    www.arsetalea.com
    Furthermore, if you have ANY ideas, comments, feedback, input, money or constructive criticism, do not hesitate to contact Andreas personally at
    andreas.propst31@gmail.com
    He will be happy to hear from YOU and answer any and all mails with pleasure and in a timely manner.
    One last thing, just to be clear: Andreas is an unpolictical, anti-fascist and "hardcore-pacifist". This may seem illogical and irrational at first as he is trying to sell a game about war on here. For Andreas, there is no contradiction in this whatsoever, as he sees Panzer Clash, which is utterly unpolitical as well, as a way to raise awareness for important historical events or eras and as a way to contribute to something important: The terrible events of the past shall never be forgotten, lest history will repeat itself!

    THANK YOU VERY MUCH for considering to back this project and/or for supporting it any other way within your powers!!
story_txt:
My name is Andreas Propst and I am a young, up and coming designer of board and card games (as well as artist, fledgling book author and much more that does not matter now...) from Austria, who has been designing games with great passion - more or less successfully - for about 7 years now. On this here Indiegogo fundraising campaign, I want to introduce you to my World War 2 themed, highly customizable but non-collectible card game PANZER CLASH!


Panzer Clash is an easy-to-pick-up yet highly strategic, fully customizable card game for 2 - 4 players (best with 2 players) all about Second World War Panzer Battles. What we are offering you is a huge box of no less than 430 cards (probably more depending on the success of this very campaign) which will serve as an extensive card pool for countless hours of deckbuilding madness, from which countless hours of highly enjoyable, actual gameplay will result. Panzer Clash features many great mechanics such as an unique resoure system and, best of all, a modular battlefield consisting of various Terrain types, on which you will be moving around your Units, that will be generated at random at the beginning of every game. So no game of Panzer Clash will be the same! More on the actual rules and gameplay later. Alternatively you can watch the video review above, know however that said review is based on an older "incarnation" of the game. Still it will give you an idea of how Panzer Clash is played and what makes it a great, deeply strategic and overall enjoyable gaming experience.
Through this here campaign I am trying to realize Panzer Clash, which I have carefully and relentlessly developed and refined over more than 5 years, with my ultimate goal being not to "make the big buck", but rather to spread the game among as many gamers as possible for the greatest pleasure for me derives from  the notion that many people enjoy what I created and are just having a good time with some friends playing Panzer Clash for instance. Hence all is priced for us to break even, not to maximize personal profits.
And this is where YOU come in, valued potential backer! Having a large print run of a 430+ cards game manufactured and shipped out to customers (that is you, the gamers)  entails immense costs which I could not by any means cover myself, and hence the need for this campaign and hence the need for your pledge!
Let us make Panzer Clash a reality - Together we are strong!!   

 By means of this fundraising campaign, I intend to fund the manufacturing and worldwide distribution of a minimum print run size of 500 Units (copies of the game), which is an immensely costly thing to do and hence I am asking for your pledge to realize the game. One man like myself cannot possibly fund a huge project like this on his own, but if many people make their relatively small contribution, even seemingly outrageous amounts of funds can be raised in order to make a project like Panzer Clash a reality - and such is the very nature of crowdfunding. So: Long story short, the money you pledge will go entirely into the manufacturing of the Panzer Clash Customizable Card Game and into sending it out to the backers from all over the world. So the bulk of the costs are twofold basically: Manufacturing / Printing costs and shipping fees.
Now to what everyone has been waiting for:
We are both pleased and proud to be able to offer you some very fair and also unique PERKS!
We tried to keep the different perks as simple as possible while still offering you some very special deals.

as extra goodies you can "purchase" by adding $45 USD (worldwide shipping included) to your pledge. We got them in 4 awesome designs, one for each Faction so you can pick your favorite! Here they are for you:

story:
From Paper To Paper:

   Greetings, and thank you so much for taking the time to check out this crowdfunding project!  

   My name is Owen Shen, and I fancy myself a little odd.  I've been a longtime fan of art, magic, and cards, and I'm thrilled to have this opportunity to put these passions together.

   As a kid, I've always loved the idea of sorcerers and their magic spells, summoning bolts of flame into the sky.  As I grew older, people have told me that magic doesn't exist.  

   I'd like to think that with enough dedication, even the insurmountable, can be surmounted.

   Enter REDUX:

   A custom deck of playing cards from head to toe, I wanted to create a deck that was fully customized in a world where all too often, a retooled back and an alternate Ace of Spades counted as a new deck.

 

Original Court Card Art:
From hand-drawn images sprung the final copies of REDUX's courts.  Each card made the transition from paper to card stock in varying amounts of time.

 

 

 

 

 

 

   The Finished Cards:

 

    Featuring:

  • Custom artwork for every court card.
  • Completely redesigned pips and font.
  • Two-way, borderless back designed to make fans and flourishes pop.
  • Elegant tuck case.
  • Luxurious 310gsm card stock.
  •  Two Jokers with a reveal utility for magicians.   

 

PLEASE NOTE: Though the card art is technically finished, there may be some minor revisions over the course of this campaign to improve the layout and design.

Fully Customized Suits:

Custom Court Cards:

The Four Aces:

Two Jokers, With A Reveal Utility:

All Of The Custom Court Cards:

 

 

 

 

Funding Breakdown And Printing:

   As this is my first crowdfunding project, I will do my best to set a realistic delivery date, and be upfront about the costs.  Below is a breakdown of how the $3500.00 goal will be distributed:

   REDUX will be printed through MPC, a nationally recognized company that has won awards for their quality control and ethical practice, as well as over 30 years of experience in the printing industry.

                                   

   The shipping costs cover a significant portion of the goal, but by working with MPC, I hope to reduce unnecessary "stopping points", before REDUX is delivered into your hands.  I'm not making anything off this portion (MPC charges a rate of $5.99 for 1 deck), and I hope everything will be delivered in a timely manner.

  Shipping does decrease of multiple decks are shipped to one address, however, and I have reflected this in the different pledge amount.

   * Also please note that Non US backers must add on a $1.00 handling fee per deck.

    Risks & Challenges:

       Things are bound to go wrong in a large undertaking such as this one.  This is also my first time handling a crowdfunding project.  

       With these two things being said, I will do my best to set goals that I can deliver, and set time frames I can deliver them by.

       In the event that something goes awry, I believe I have enough overhead to solve the issue, and provide for a replacement.

       Still, unexpected things can happen, and I will keep you all updated on what the latest developments are.  This is a joint effort, and I must do my part to let you all know how everything is faring.

       

      Other Ways You Can Help:

         I understand not everyone can pitch in.  That's okay!  

         If you think this design is pretty excellent, I would be super excited if you could share this page with a friend or on a social network like Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter!

         Every little bit and impression puts us a step closer to our goal!

        If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!
story_txt:
From Paper To Paper:
   Greetings, and thank you so much for taking the time to check out this crowdfunding project!  
   My name is Owen Shen, and I fancy myself a little odd.  I've been a longtime fan of art, magic, and cards, and I'm thrilled to have this opportunity to put these passions together.
   As a kid, I've always loved the idea of sorcerers and their magic spells, summoning bolts of flame into the sky.  As I grew older, people have told me that magic doesn't exist.  
   I'd like to think that with enough dedication, even the insurmountable, can be surmounted.
   Enter REDUX:

   A custom deck of playing cards from head to toe, I wanted to create a deck that was fully customized in a world where all too often, a retooled back and an alternate Ace of Spades counted as a new deck.
 
Original Court Card Art:From hand-drawn images sprung the final copies of REDUX's courts.  Each card made the transition from paper to card stock in varying amounts of time.
 
 
 
 
 
    The Finished Cards:
     Featuring:


Custom artwork for every court card.
Completely redesigned pips and font.
Two-way, borderless back designed to make fans and flourishes pop. 
Elegant tuck case.
Luxurious 310gsm card stock.
 Two Jokers with a reveal utility for magicians.   

 
PLEASE NOTE: Though the card art is technically finished, there may be some minor revisions over the course of this campaign to improve the layout and design.
Fully Customized Suits:
Custom Court Cards:
The Four Aces:
Two Jokers, With A Reveal Utility:
All Of The Custom Court Cards:  
  Funding Breakdown And Printing:
   As this is my first crowdfunding project, I will do my best to set a realistic delivery date, and be upfront about the costs.  Below is a breakdown of how the $3500.00 goal will be distributed:

   REDUX will be printed through MPC, a nationally recognized company that has won awards for their quality control and ethical practice, as well as over 30 years of experience in the printing industry.

                                   
   The shipping costs cover a significant portion of the goal, but by working with MPC, I hope to reduce unnecessary "stopping points", before REDUX is delivered into your hands.  I'm not making anything off this portion (MPC charges a rate of $5.99 for 1 deck), and I hope everything will be delivered in a timely manner.
  Shipping does decrease of multiple decks are shipped to one address, however, and I have reflected this in the different pledge amount.
   * Also please note that Non US backers must add on a $1.00 handling fee per deck.



Risks & Challenges:
   Things are bound to go wrong in a large undertaking such as this one.  This is also my first time handling a crowdfunding project.  
   With these two things being said, I will do my best to set goals that I can deliver, and set time frames I can deliver them by.
   In the event that something goes awry, I believe I have enough overhead to solve the issue, and provide for a replacement.
   Still, unexpected things can happen, and I will keep you all updated on what the latest developments are.  This is a joint effort, and I must do my part to let you all know how everything is faring.


 
Other Ways You Can Help:
   I understand not everyone can pitch in.  That's okay!  
   If you think this design is pretty excellent, I would be super excited if you could share this page with a friend or on a social network like Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter!
   Every little bit and impression puts us a step closer to our goal!
  If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!

story:
- What are the risks and what are your guarantees?

Up to this moment we have already created (made) the main core of the game (main gameplay), laid out more than thirty levels and almost finished working on the level that has the Boss. You don’t risk anything by supporting us, as the game is already on the stage of beta-testing. We guarantee that the game will be finished either way. Fundraising is necessary to speed up the development process and increase the amount and the quality of the content in the game.

- Why does your company have the type “Flexible”?

We really want to finish our game as soon as possible, and we need funds to do that. We wanted to let customers decide for themselves what quality of the game they would like to get. The more funds we can collect, the more rich and complete the game will be. We chose this type of company because we already have a working demo version and we received a great amount of positive feedback. In choosing this type we didn’t realise that it could scare away possible customers. Unfortunately, it’s not possible to change the type of the company now. We only hope that our fans and people who fall in love with the game, will help us reach our goal.

- Who are you?

We are a team of independent developers with freelancing experience, working in different fields for more than eight years. Both of us are artistic people, full of fresh ideas and desire to create.

-Why have you decided to make this game?

Working as freelancers for a long time, we amassed lots of our own ideas that we would like to bring to life. We believe that making and playing games is one of the best ways to express yourself.

- For how long have you been working as a team?

Our team was created a bit over six months ago for work on this and other projects. It consists of like-minded people who aspire to make good and unique products.

- Why $50,000 specifically?

$50,000$ is an optimal amount that will let us finish the game and make it as rich and complete as possible. If we gather less funds than this, the game will still be finished, however, part of the story and ideas would have to be sold separately as DLC (additions) to the game. We would prefer to avoid that. If you help us to make the necessary amount, we guarantee that all bonus features and upgrades will be added for free.

- Why would I donate the money?

The number of truly interesting and high-quality games decreases every year. It’s especially true with regard to the Indie genre. Our main goal is to make interesting games of high quality which most people would like. If you want to support the future of the game industry, please help us to gather the necessary funds. We promise that we will do our best to help the game industry evolve.

You can play demo here:
https://madmanuel.alienprism.com

Hi! My name is Bogdan Sheliakin. I represent Alien Prism, an independent studio of game developers. At the moment we have two people in our team. Nikita Tulinov is an artist works on the main part of the visual content. My job is programming – bringing the graphical elements created by Nikita to life. We’ve put lots of time and effort to make our dreams come true and now we want to introduce to you our game Mad Manuel.

We like to play games a lot. We both believe that the more complicated a game is the more interesting it is to complete it. Many hours spent on trying to complete “Boss”, the joy of completing every new level, the beaten to death keyboard – these all are the criteria for any good game. That’s why we decided to create a game that would make a gamer cry trying to complete every new unbelievably difficult level and laugh from the joy of completing it. We took old-school difficulty, covered it in an unusual visual style and enhanced it with the use of comical stereotypes.

This is how our project was born.

I would like to tell you a bit about the way we work. The game detail is a result of our joint effort and imagination. At the moment we both have other jobs apart from game developing. We use Skype in the evening to discuss all ideas that come to mind during the day. Then we share our day’s achievements and get to work.

Based on our ideas Nikita creates preliminary sketches, which we will discuss later. The sketches are then loaded into the project where I begin my magic. After deciding what a particular object will be used for in a game, I start programming. Each object has to be checked hundreds of times to make sure it looks and works the way it supposed to. When all the elements are ready we start developing levels, in which the objects will be placed. When several layers are ready, I start putting the project together. Each of us checks the functionality of layers and elements and makes sure that the game works overall. We do necessary adjustments and start the process again.

Idea -> preliminary sketch -> uploading and programming -> levels development -> project assembly

Our main goal is to bring the satisfaction and joy of playing our games to as many people as we can. It doesn’t matter if you are a fan of old-school hardcore, groper for something new or a grandma who wants to show her grandchildren that she is trendy too. It doesn’t matter if you are alone or with a group of friends. The only important thing for us is that every gamer can have some fun.

“Mad Manuel” – hardcore crossplatform platformer??? (я не знаю, как это перевести) Two characters who were brought together by destiny. One adventure that they’ll have to follow to the end to get their freedom. Hundreds of unique levels where each one is more difficult, interesting and diverse than the previous one. Thousands of obstacles to overcome on the way. Ground levels, underground levels, air levels, underwater levels, night time levels, bonus levels… Countless crypts and secrets. Grim bosses. Breathtaking plot. More than 25 characters to choose from. Pleasing colourful visual design. You can choose yourself which platform to use to conquer the game world: Steam, PS4, Xbox or even a web browser. You can play anywhere, on any computer or laptop (with WebGL technology). All this and much more is waiting for you in game “Mad Manuel”! Show us how mad you are! 

The main character’s name is Manuel. Being an outlaw he decides to leave home and run across the border. Wandering in the desert he finds a comrade, Diego. Trying to reach different goals but heading same way, they overcome all obstacles together. Being almost at the end of the journey, Manuel remembers about some unfinished business and has to go back home. But someone is already waiting for him there, so now Manuel has to move much faster because he’s being chased. His friend is also eager and helps in any way he can. For the second time Manuel and Diego are close to the end but they get caught and put into jail. Nevertheless, two friends don’t lose hope and scrape to freedom. Wandering through the jail tunnels they find a way – sewage system!

Why did Manuel have to run away from home? What’s his friend’s story? Why did they have to go back home? Will they be able to find a way out of this difficult situation? You can find the answers to these questions if you buy our game after it’s released.

$ 10,000 - “Time to work”

  • Story review, 45 levels, 1 boss

$ 15,000 - “Let’s start”

  • Story review, 75 levels, 1 boss

$ 20,000 - “I want to work!”

  • Story review, 110 levels, 3 bosses

$ 25,000 - “Time to create”

  • More complete plot review , 150 levels, 5bosses

$35,000 -  “I want to create!”

  • Full plot presentation -  200 levels, 8 bosses, 5 bonus levels

$ 50,000 - “Done deal”

  • Full plot presentation - more than 200 levels, more than ten bosses, more than ten bonus levels

 $ 100,000 - “Finished yesterday”

  • Full realization of all ideas. Maximally full plot presentation, more than 300 levels, bonus levels, more than twenty bosses

August-September 2017

  • Collecting necessary funds (to complete development)
  • Development and launch of the game website
  • Development and launch of the studio website
  • Processing (designing) a page in Steam and other platforms (PS4, Xbox)
  • Adding new obstacles, new levels and soundtracks to the game

October-November 2017

  • Finishing collecting the funds for completion of the game development
  • Final refinement (modifications) of the game
  • Open testing for customers who bought the “Looking forward” kit and above

December 2017 - January 2018

  • Launch of the game on Steam, PS4 and Xbox platforms
  • Development of the game for WebGL

Spring - Summer 2018

  • Launch of the game’s web version

Alien Prism Studio is in the beginning of its way. However, each of us have been growing in different directions for more than 8 years. We both took part in different projects. We have plenty of interesting ideas which we would like to live out in the future. Now we are hoping for your support which will give us a good start and let us keep going as an independent development studio. We want to be able to make people happy with new projects, which we hope will bring joy and satisfaction to even a very picky gamer.

story:
What is "The Darkest Hour"?

"The Darkest Hour" is a 2D platformer, but with nice graphics and RPG elements. Formulating concept of the game we guided ourselves with 2 main ideas:

  1.  We want create a game, that we would play with great pleasure ourselves.
  2.  We take only the best things from our favorite genres.

We carefully created all aspects of our game. But most of all we concentrated on two of them - gameplay and talents system. There is a NON-class Hero evolution in "The Darkest Hour" with two talents systems.

One of them has a lot of powerful active and passive abilities. There seven schools in this system: melee combat, Fire, Water, Air, Death, Life (coming soon) and Earth (coming soon). You may use abilities from all of this schools at once creating great COMBOs and specializations. There is a small example. You can take water bolt with AOE splashes, that will apply debaff "Drench" on enemies. Then take "Ball Lightning", AOE spell that has always critical effect on enemies with "Drench". You may also take "Ice ball", AOE ability that deals double damage to enemies with "Drench" and dispels this debaff freezing them (frozen enemies always take critical damage from physical abilities). Finally, you may want to take physical ability "Spiritual charge" to deal critical damage to all the frozen monsters and a passive ability "Bloody wounds" that applies a powerful DoT on those who took critical physical damage from you. It looks like nice COMBO, isn't it? And there are much more in "The Darkest Hour"! But you can take no more then 16 abilities from this system. So, choose them carefully. All your active abilities will be shown on the command panel.

Second system simply upgrades your characteristics: health, armor, strength, intellect, passive energy regeneration, haste (reduces cooldowns of abilities), critical chance and critical damage. Some of this characteristics becomes extremely helpful with one set of abilities and useless with another set.

Energy management is also important. You have small passive regeneration, but most of your powerful abilities spend a lot of energy. So you have to use your spells properly, use special passive talents. But sometimes this is not enough. So, you will have a talent to regenerate lots of energy points with melee strikes and "Spiritual charge".

What about story?

Indeed, any good game must have a good plot. We want players to learn the story gradually from dialogs and books. Each of significant characters will have its own story. This stories you can find in hidden books in different locations. But, probably, you want to find out what is the world of "The Darkest Hour" about in general... We will try to explain you everything briefly.

So, mysterious ancient demiurges created the planet and started to spread life on it. But their antagonists, the chaos lords, distorted the process of creation life and so, the first living creatures became bloodthirsty aberrations empowered by Chaos, which mortals will name demons later. To help them eradicate this threat demiurges created a second race - humans. They granted them mind and tought them primitive magic spells. Together, gods and humans destroyed the demons and imprisoned remaining aberrations in another realm.

After the war, demiurges granted a great power to the 5 greatest human warriors. And then, the gods left this world. This warriors became Guardians and their main purposes were to protect the world from the evil and keep peace. The Guardians' previous names are long forgotten. Their new names became Strength, Wisdom, Mercy, Balance and Justice. But, one day Justice betrayed his brothers and sisters. He released demons, captured his former friends and attacked united human kingdom of Primehold. That day Justice became Vengeance.

Our hero was commander of the elite king's guards in Primehold. He failed to protect his king, the capital and his people. Vengeance destroyed his homeland. The hero couldn't take this shame and burnt his violet cloak of elite guard and a mark of commander. He started his journey to find solvation...

How to play?

You can try demo version of  "The Darkest Hour". Here is the link for setup.exe on GameJolt:  https://gamejolt.com/games/TDH/333401

There is a problem may accure on windows 8 and earlier (and extremely rare on windows 10). if you can't run the game and get errors (such as absense of msvcp140.dll or error 0xc000007b) you should download Visual C++ 2015 redistributable. If the problem was not solved by downloading Visual C++ 2015 redistributable send an email on ChaosGaming@yandex.ru and we will help you.

What We Need & What You Get

Our stretch goals:

  • $14k - complete the game with 6 locations and village.
  • $20k - we will add alchemy
  • $25k - we will add blacksmithing
  • $35k - customization
  • $50k - 2 additional locations
  • $70k - much more craft and recipes

Our Perks:

  • 5$ - Donor. We will send you personal thanks on your email.
  • 10$ - Buyer. You will get the final version of the game for free (when it will be completed it will coast 15$)
  • 22$ - Great Buyer. You will get the final version of the game for free and 3 weeks before official release (even earlier than bloggers).
  • 36$ - Helper. Your name will be in "Authors" (in game menu) in section "Special thanks".
  • 40$ - Helper +. You will get digital sketches of all our characters and posters. You will also get 2500x2000 digital versions of our posters. One of the sketches of our current poster looks like this:

  • 60$ - Helper Deluxe. You will get .pdf book with extended stories of all the characters with images.
  • 225$ - Developer. Your name in game! One of the characters will have your name. At least its a little bit changed version. You will not know how we used your name until you see the game, but don't worry it won't be difficult to find.
  • 475$ - Developer +. Create a room! You will be able to create a room for 1 of locations. But 1 small condition - nothing obscene or rude.
  • 650$ - Professional. Your name will be among professional developers in section "Level designers".

If you donate for 10$+ you will get all perks granted for smaller donations. For example, if you donate 36$ you get not only perk for "Developer beginner" you will also get the game for free 3 weeks earlier and personal thanks on your email.

When you get perks?

Some of them (like personal thanks) you will get within 24 hours, another (like creating room) - after successful ending of the campaign. But perks like final version of the game or your name in game will be available when we complete the game. We think it takes from us about 5 - 6 month to finish "The Darkest Hour". But If we reach highest goals (like $50k - $70k) it might require much time. But don't worry the game will be ready no longer then the beginning of 2019.

About us

"The Darkest Hour" is being developed by Russian company LLC "Chaos Gaming". Here our current developers:

Head programmer & game director: Alexei Lazarev.

Designers: Nadezhda Nikolaeva and Konstantin Vlasov.

Sound designers: Nikita Kudakov and Grigory Danilov.

Composer: Grigory Danilov.

Thanks to you help, our team will become bigger and we will work faster for you! :)

Risks & Challenges

Fist of all we want to say, that we use fixed goal. So, if we don't reach the goal, all your money will be returned.

We are having a playable DEMO of the game and a great team that becomes bigger. So, after successful crowdfunding campaign, we will finish "The Darkest Hour" shortly (for about 5  - 6 month).

We have already finished the game engine, so we only need to draw remaining locations, characters and a few special effects. Our team will complete this tasks easily!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, you still can help:

  • Please, tell about us your friends.
  • You can make some noise about us in social networks.
  • Subscribe our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/chaosgaming.official/
  • Subscribe our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpNemRRp8L4uQj...
  • join our twitter: https://twitter.com/LLC_ChaosGaming
  • join our facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LLC.ChaosGaming/
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you have any questions send us an email to ChaosGaming@yandex.ru

Thanks for help! :)

Second system simply upgrades your characteristics: health, armor, strength, intellect, passive energy regeneration, haste (reduces cooldowns of abilities), critical chance and critical damage. Some of this characteristics becomes extremely helpful with one set of abilities and useless with another set.
Energy management is also important. You have small passive regeneration, but most of your powerful abilities spend a lot of energy. So you have to use your spells properly, use special passive talents. But sometimes this is not enough. So, you will have a talent to regenerate lots of energy points with melee strikes and "Spiritual charge".
What about story?
Indeed, any good game must have a good plot. We want players to learn the story gradually from dialogs and books. Each of significant characters will have its own story. This stories you can find in hidden books in different locations. But, probably, you want to find out what is the world of "The Darkest Hour" about in general... We will try to explain you everything briefly.
So, mysterious ancient demiurges created the planet and started to spread life on it. But their antagonists, the chaos lords, distorted the process of creation life and so, the first living creatures became bloodthirsty aberrations empowered by Chaos, which mortals will name demons later. To help them eradicate this threat demiurges created a second race - humans. They granted them mind and tought them primitive magic spells. Together, gods and humans destroyed the demons and imprisoned remaining aberrations in another realm.
After the war, demiurges granted a great power to the 5 greatest human warriors. And then, the gods left this world. This warriors became Guardians and their main purposes were to protect the world from the evil and keep peace. The Guardians' previous names are long forgotten. Their new names became Strength, Wisdom, Mercy, Balance and Justice. But, one day Justice betrayed his brothers and sisters. He released demons, captured his former friends and attacked united human kingdom of Primehold. That day Justice became Vengeance.
Our hero was commander of the elite king's guards in Primehold. He failed to protect his king, the capital and his people. Vengeance destroyed his homeland. The hero couldn't take this shame and burnt his violet cloak of elite guard and a mark of commander. He started his journey to find solvation...
How to play?
You can try demo version of  "The Darkest Hour". Here is the link for setup.exe on GameJolt:  https://gamejolt.com/games/TDH/333401
There is a problem may accure on windows 8 and earlier (and extremely rare on windows 10). if you can't run the game and get errors (such as absense of msvcp140.dll or error 0xc000007b) you should download Visual C++ 2015 redistributable. If the problem was not solved by downloading Visual C++ 2015 redistributable send an email on ChaosGaming@yandex.ru and we will help you.
What We Need & What You Get
Our stretch goals:

$14k - complete the game with 6 locations and village.
$20k - we will add alchemy
$25k - we will add blacksmithing
$35k - customization
$50k - 2 additional locations
$70k - much more craft and recipes

Our Perks:

5$ - Donor. We will send you personal thanks on your email.
10$ - Buyer. You will get the final version of the game for free (when it will be completed it will coast 15$)
22$ - Great Buyer. You will get the final version of the game for free and 3 weeks before official release (even earlier than bloggers).
36$ - Helper. Your name will be in "Authors" (in game menu) in section "Special thanks".
40$ - Helper +. You will get digital sketches of all our characters and posters. You will also get 2500x2000 digital versions of our posters. One of the sketches of our current poster looks like this:



60$ - Helper Deluxe. You will get .pdf book with extended stories of all the characters with images.
225$ - Developer. Your name in game! One of the characters will have your name. At least its a little bit changed version. You will not know how we used your name until you see the game, but don't worry it won't be difficult to find.
475$ - Developer +. Create a room! You will be able to create a room for 1 of locations. But 1 small condition - nothing obscene or rude.
650$ - Professional. Your name will be among professional developers in section "Level designers".

If you donate for 10$+ you will get all perks granted for smaller donations. For example, if you donate 36$ you get not only perk for "Developer beginner" you will also get the game for free 3 weeks earlier and personal thanks on your email.
When you get perks?
Some of them (like personal thanks) you will get within 24 hours, another (like creating room) - after successful ending of the campaign. But perks like final version of the game or your name in game will be available when we complete the game. We think it takes from us about 5 - 6 month to finish "The Darkest Hour". But If we reach highest goals (like $50k - $70k) it might require much time. But don't worry the game will be ready no longer then the beginning of 2019.
About us
"The Darkest Hour" is being developed by Russian company LLC "Chaos Gaming". Here our current developers:
Head programmer & game director: Alexei Lazarev.
Designers: Nadezhda Nikolaeva and Konstantin Vlasov.
Sound designers: Nikita Kudakov and Grigory Danilov.
Composer: Grigory Danilov.
Thanks to you help, our team will become bigger and we will work faster for you! :)

Risks & Challenges
Fist of all we want to say, that we use fixed goal. So, if we don't reach the goal, all your money will be returned.
We are having a playable DEMO of the game and a great team that becomes bigger. So, after successful crowdfunding campaign, we will finish "The Darkest Hour" shortly (for about 5  - 6 month).
We have already finished the game engine, so we only need to draw remaining locations, characters and a few special effects. Our team will complete this tasks easily!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, you still can help:

Please, tell about us your friends.
You can make some noise about us in social networks.
Subscribe our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/chaosgaming.official/

Subscribe our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpNemRRp8L4uQj...

join our twitter: https://twitter.com/LLC_ChaosGaming

join our facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LLC.ChaosGaming/

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you have any questions send us an email to ChaosGaming@yandex.ruThanks for help! :)

story:
Short Summary

Our vision of a game we want to create.

This game allows a player to plunge into the colorful and mysterious underwater world of microorganisms. Your character is a microbe that fights for food and survives in the unfriendly world of the same greedy and even aggressively minded microbes. "Eat or be eaten" - this is the main principle which rules everything and everyone here.

One of the main features of this world is the colorful diversity of its inhabitants. Thanks to the extremely flexible editor of the character it is possible to change the body shape, color, and texture.   

The microbe has the basic shape and the parts that have passive and active effects, which add greatly to the underwater battles variety and action. The world is filled with living organisms that are guided by artificial intelligence. Be ready to have a large number of obstacles on your way: the food is hard to hunt down and the predatory bosses do not give any opportunity to relax even for the strongest players.

Completed:

  • Editor;
  • spell system;
  • bot’s AI;
  • body parts system;
  • food system;
  • obstacles system (different static and active objects at the map);.
  • leveling system;
 

 In plans:

  • Multiplayer with different modes;
  • single game modes ;
  • character’s upgrade in talantstree;
  • giant bosses;
  • quests system;
  • store;
  • monetization through body parts and other bonuses selling in a store;
  • add more content (body parts, food, types of obstacles and other things);
  • deep optimization.

Picture 1 - Game modes

 

Picture 2 - Talents tree

We want to create a lot of real and fantastic microbes with unique mechanics, some parts of them you will be able to implement for your microbe!

Giant bosses will fill this world, we already create some of them:

And this is just a small amount of our ideas! We want to create a lot off spells witch are binded to body parts, it can evolve into full MMO with different modes.

What We Need & What You Get

We are small team with limited resources but we want to do all what we can.
In our plans are realize this features:

  • Multiplayer with different modes;
  • single game modes ;
  • character’s upgrade in talents tree;
  • giant bosses;
  • quests system;
  • store;
  • monetization through body parts and other bonuses selling in a store;
  • add more content (body parts, food, types of obstacles and other things);
  • deep optimization.

   Best variant for us is to collect 12, 000 $ and around 6 month for development to complete all tasks that stands at us.

Alpha version of a game for android is available there.
 

Risks & Challenges

     We are just people and we need to eat and sleep too,  so  development features can take some more time than we expect. Some of us are still students, we handle that but it may some influence on project.
     And last one challenge for us is our team size. We have only 3 people in team: 1 game designer, 1 designer/animator, 1 developer. We haven't people to replace, but we are sure that we can handle it!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you  cant  help us with fund maybe you know some publisher or friends that can help us in some another way, please contact us rexground@gmail.com .

Let's bring "World of Microbes" to reality together!

Short Summary

Growing up in the 1980's I saw home gaming come to life. I still have a passion to play retro games from this era, and now have the skills to remake games that I fondly remember.

I feel this is a good project for me because:

  • I've written ten books on  computer game programming
  • Have a passion for retro styles
  • It will cool to know that you're enjoying playing my creations

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Support Me & Get:

  • All 50 games as a ZIP download
  • Also available on CD

Risks & Challenges

Over the past few years I've made over 250 game projects, and written several books on process of making games. I feel I have the skill required to make this project happen.

What Games Are Being Remade?

Tank Trax – Space Invaders
Sokoban – Jeepers Creepers
Rock, Paper, Scissors – Frogger
Blitz – Missile Command
Asteroids – Boulder Dash
Horrace Goes Skiing – Pitfall
MicroMachines – River Raid
Centipede – Operation Wolf
Tron – Snake
Paperboy – Brick
Commando – DuckHunt
Daley Thompson Decathlon – Pong
Jet Pack – Death Chase
Bomber Man – Bubble Bobble
Pengo – Krazy Golf
Xevious – Ghost ‘n’ Goblins
Air & Sea – Rainbow Island
Chuckie Egg – Chopper Command
Combat – ET
Grand Prix – Joust
Stampede – Kaboom!
Cosmic Ark – Hangman
Sea – Quest Outlaw
Barnstorming – Moon Patrol
Fishing Derby – Commando Raid

What Will Funds Be Used For?

Funds will be used for purchasing license to make Nintendo Switch Games, Artwork, Music and a lot of Coffee to keep me focused.

story:
Welcome to The Orion Project!  The Ultimate Space Adventure and Combat Video Game for PC.  This is a massive project created by a global, remote and independent team known as Trek Industries.

We will let you explore the stars with your friends - the way they were meant to be explored.  Because let's get real - who wants to explore Space alone??


( YOUR FUTURE EXPLAINED )


Orion will allow you to PLAY YOUR WAY.  Do what you want, when you want and where you want. 

Players will be able to explore a variety of Regions on Orion, other Planets, Moons, Orbital Bases and even the Galaxy itself. (/0:33)  All of which will be connected to one another in an upcoming Open Galaxy Module.

Players will be able to descend to the Surface in many ways including: Drop Pods, Drop Ships, Space Ships and even advanced forms of transportation including Beaming.

***Orion is the only game to ever feature three perspectives, allowing Players to fully customize their experience.  You can change the camera at any moment and watch it switch in real-time.***

Orion will feature a variety of Cooperative and Competitive gameplay experiences.  There are already multiple Cooperative modes available and they each feature the incredible over-the-top, hyper adrenaline action we've become known for.

Orion brings together the best combination of enemies in the form of Dinosaurs and Robots.  There are already nearly 15 types of enemies in the game with that number expected to at least triple.

Go to war with the best machine Pistols, Combat Shotguns, Machine Guns, Sniper Rifles and even more explosive weaponry such as Grenade Launchers, Flame Throwers, Rocket Launchers - with even more are still to come.

All of this amazing gameplay takes place in gorgeous locations.  We have many regions in the game including: Ancient Ruins, Jungles, Plains, Deserts, Rocklands, Swamps, Forests, Tundras and many m ore regions, Planets, Moons still to come.  All of this will be connected into a massive open world experience.

That is all just the tip of the iceberg!  Once the Foundation is in place we will start going up and let you explore the stars with your friends - the way they were meant to be explored.  

Because let's get real - who wants to explore Space alone??

Welcome to Orion.  See you in Space!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm George Keel! I've been a game dev for about 6 years now, and have helped in small projects with friends. This is a game I wanna work on to convert my creativity into something useful. I want more people to realize what Autism actually is, and I want to put my experiences into something others can see. I was diagnosed at age 10, and it's been a journey, one that I want to make into an interactive game!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the good stuff:

  • The funding is going into hardware, such as the headsets, and the assets and licenses and Steam Greenlight fees needed to actually make this real!
  • Some perks to helping - You get immediate access to the game, and possibly some merch!
  • If I don't reach my goal, I'm still going to try to develop the game, but I just don't know if I can without the funding.

The Impact

 I feel making this game will help bring a spotlight in the gaming community to Autism and some other mental health issues.

Risks & Challenges

This will be my first VR game! I have played around with the tools a bunch and I feel I am skilled enough to make a full fledged game for both the HTC Vive and Oculus Rift. I will eventually get involved with a team to help, but right now it is solo.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE! If you can't donate, spread the word about the project! It'll make a big difference whether it falls short or passes the bar!

story:
Short Summary

Queenship's team represents a variety of skills and backgrounds, including video game composition, concept art, narrative writing, game engines, and a variety of other skills essential to successful game development. We are intent on making a positive impact in the area of mental health and making the discussion of mental health, illness, and disorders more public, more accessible, and more widely accepted. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is what your funding will be paying for:

-research and consultation with mental health professionals
-work hours
-copyright filings + other legal paperwork
-marketing and research

What you get: check out our perks section! Additionally, the satisfaction of knowing you've helped a community-minded studio get off the ground. 

The Impact

Our first game, Open Spaces, is a visual novel about anxiety and agoraphobia. We are concurrently working on a mobile app, Return to Self, that we hope will help users manage anxiety and panic disorders and attacks. On our concept roster are House of Echoes, a game about hallucinations, and Gravewood, an RPG about depression. 

Our goal is to produce gamified tools that may assist sufferers in understanding their symptoms better - and help their families, friends, and communities offer them the support they need more effectively.

In addition, the positive impact we think that the development of Queenship will have on other female game developers cannot be overstated. Our aim is to produce amazing games and encourage other people underrepresented in game development to do the same. 

Risks & Challenges

The clear and present risk is that we won't be able to bring our games as effectively to market as we'd like - a challenge every game studio faces. But with your help, we can work to more adequately showcase and market our games and help lots and lots of people. 

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, following us on social media, sharing our campaign, and encouraging others to do any and all of the above will help us a ton!
