story:
It started only as rumors.. Priests made their augurys and all the signs were there. Druids talked to the animals, big and small, and consulted the spirits of the nature and land. Finally the most powerful wizards of the land gathered and summoned all their powers to crack open the curtain of time and saw what the future held. And it was all true. It is coming.. MECGE, Most Epic Card Game Ever and they all had to get a copy and start the Fight for Egion!


What is MECGE?

 

MECGE is a new card game which combines the best parts of a traditional tabletop RPG and a trading card game. You can earn experience and gain levels just as in traditional RPG with the simplicity of a card game. And the best part is that you don`t even need a Dungeon Master to plan and host the gaming sessions. All the events and encounters can be drawn randomly with the cards. So just have few friends over, get the cards and start playing. All the skills and items gained in the previous games are still yours and you can start playing from where you left off. Basic rules are so simple that anyone with some gaming experience learns them very fast. However, different cards bring new features and variety to the gameplay, so that every gaming session will be different and unique experience.

 

What does it include?

 

The game will consist of four decks of cards; creatures, treasure, spells and random. The overall number of cards will be around 200. The exact number depends on the selected printing facility and how many cards will be in one set. There will also be a game board, rulebook and some simple counters to keep track of the hit points and the mana points.

 

How is it played?

 

Anyone who has played RPG knows that it takes quite a lot of planning from the person who is running the game aka Dungeon Master. In MECGE the cards act as a DM in a way that encounters and treasures are drawn randomly from the decks. Players have their characters recorded in a character sheet and fighting the creatures takes place on a game board which is a simple battlemap. So basically the fighting is done just like in traditional RPG`s. You can even use your own miniatures if you have some with a suitable base size for the board. Other players throw the dice for the monsters, so in that way it is more brutal than traditional RPG where DM can give you some slack throwing dice behind the screen. And when you defeat monsters you get to draw treasure cards and gain items which will make you character stronger. You get also experience points and when you get enough of them, your character will rise in levels just as in any other RPG. There are also wizard and priest spells which can be cast to aid in combat.


 

 


Random deck has three kinds of cards; locations, special and skills. Special cards are random events which affect the player and gameplay, some good and some bad. Players can also get skills to make their character better. Locations are a very important part of the game. They are placed on the map of the game world and there are some rules in which order they can be owned. Also it`s not possible to own locations which are not connected by some way, either being adjacent in the map or connected by a portal for example. Locations also give you income, gold and mana points. Most cards have also a somekind discard value, so you can also sacrifice some card to get a temporary boost in battle.

 

By owning locations players can climb the social ladder in the kingdom of Egion. Every player starts as a peasant, but when he/she owns enough locations and becomes a noble he/she can challenge the King. Becoming the King is the ultimate goal toward which the players strive for. Players have to help eachother to fight the creatures and become stronger, but at the same time they have to watch out that the other players don`t become too strong and maybe throw some curve balls their way. After all, there can be only one King!  



 

The game setting is traditional fantasy. Typical character classes fighters, wizards etc. and spells and items are all there. It is hard to be very original and MECGE does not even try to be. Quite the opposite, the game is meant to have that traditional "feeling" and anyone who has played these kinds of games should learn it pretty easily. So basically it is suitable as an entry level game for people just getting to know RPG and it is also very good for not-so-serious gaming sessions where you can spend the evening with friends and maybe have few beverages while playing.  

 

The pictures look nice. Who is the artist?


So far there are pictures from over 60 different artists and there will still be even more. They range from hobbyists to professional artists. Some of them are already renowned and some are still making a name for themselves. They are all very talented and many of them have already worked in the gaming industry. Featured pictures show now their user names in deviantart (www.deviantart.com), but depending on individual wishes their real names may be on the printed cards.


Some cards are in landscape orintation to better show off the beautiful artwork.

What is the campaign goal?


The goal of the campaign is to get the funding needed to arrange the printing of the game. If the goal is reached it will still take few months to finalize the game. The printing of the game would be done after that. Estimated time of delivery is Q4/2014.

This is Fixed Funding, meaning that if the goal is not reached the contributions are refunded. Most printing companies have a minumum print run, so the goal has to be reached in order to make that minimum quantity for printing the game.


 

Are there any plans for future development?


If the funding is successfull a new company will be started to continue the development at a more professional level.

Do you think that some of the main stream game companies flood the games with new sourcebooks and expansions all the time and you just can`t afford to keep up even if you wanted to. The plan with MECGE is not do that. It is just not possible for a small game company. And also we believe that the game will have to stay interesting with just the basic sets and rules without having to push out new stuff all the time. This does not mean that the game will not be developed at all. We do plan to make new cards and expansions but at a pace which will not cause you to spend all your money. And we plan also to listen to the players and learn in which direction they would like to game to be developed. In our vision every new addition to the game should be something to look forward to and spend the night in queue like the new "Lord of the Rings" -movies or iPhones.

Are the cards collectible some might ask, yes and no. Being the first edition and a very small print run there isn`t a possibility to customize the decks, so every copy of the game has got the same cards. That customization comes with increased cost and it is only reasonable with long printing runs and we try to make the game as affordable as possible. In the same time being a very small print all the cards will be collectable if the game becomes successful. Think if you would own cards from the very first printing of some very successful card game. And if there would be longer printing runs later then there would also be cards which are not as common as others.

 

How can I help?

 

Just simply by backing the campaign. If you can`t afford to do it, another way of helping is to spread the word and the funding link: in Facebook, Twitter, gaming and fantasy forums and everywhere else.

Also, if you are interested in the game, please back the campaign rather sooner than later. In crowdfunding people only tend to back campaigns which look like are going to succeed. So in the early stages of the campaign it is hard to get those first backers and people not backing the campaign just because there aren`t many backers before them is a kind of a self fulfilling prophecy.

 

Will be there any new perks and strech goals?


Yes, definately! This is just to start the campaign and it will go on for 60 days. The possible perks are having your own RPG character being made immortal by making it a card or getting signed prints of the pictures or something like that..

Possible stretch goals are making some new booster packs or game modules and introducing new kingdoms and lands with some new creatures and items.

It will be possible to change the selected perk later, so please do not wait until the last minute waiting for some new and better perks and strecth goals..
story_txt:
It started only as rumors.. Priests made their
augurys and all the signs were there. Druids talked to the animals, big and
small, and consulted the spirits of the nature and land. Finally the most
powerful wizards of the land gathered and summoned all their powers to crack
open the curtain of time and saw what the future held. And it was all true. It
is coming.. MECGE, Most Epic Card Game Ever and they all had to get a copy and
start the Fight for Egion!What is MECGE? MECGE is a
new card game which combines the best parts of a traditional tabletop RPG and a
trading card game. You can earn experience and gain levels just as in
traditional RPG with the simplicity of a card game. And the best part is that
you don`t even need a Dungeon Master to plan and host the gaming sessions. All the
events and encounters can be drawn randomly with the cards. So just have few
friends over, get the cards and start playing. All the skills and items gained
in the previous games are still yours and you can start playing from where you
left off. Basic rules are so simple that anyone with some gaming experience
learns them very fast. However, different cards bring new features and variety
to the gameplay, so that every gaming session will be different and unique
experience. What does it include? The game will consist of four decks of cards; creatures, treasure, spells and random. The overall number of cards will be around 200. The exact number depends on the selected printing facility and how many cards will be in one set. There will also be a game board, rulebook and some simple counters to keep track of the hit points and the mana points. How is it played? Anyone who has played RPG knows that it takes quite a lot of planning from the person who is running the game aka Dungeon Master. In MECGE the cards act as a DM in a way that encounters and treasures are drawn randomly from the decks. Players have their characters recorded in a character sheet and fighting the creatures takes place on a game board which is a simple battlemap. So basically the fighting is done just like in traditional RPG`s. You can even use your own miniatures if you have some with a suitable base size for the board. Other players throw the dice for the monsters, so in that way it is more brutal than traditional RPG where DM can give you some slack throwing dice behind the screen. And when you defeat monsters you get to draw treasure cards and gain items which will make you character stronger. You get also experience points and when you get enough of them, your character will rise in levels just as in any other RPG. There are also wizard and priest spells which can be cast to aid in combat.  Random deck has three kinds of cards; locations, special and skills. Special cards are random events which affect the player and gameplay, some good and some bad. Players can also get skills to make their character better. Locations are a very important part of the game. They are placed on the map of the game world and there are some rules in which order they can be owned. Also it`s not possible to own locations which are not connected by some way, either being adjacent in the map or connected by a portal for example. Locations also give you income, gold and mana points. Most cards have also a somekind discard value, so you can also sacrifice some card to get a temporary boost in battle. By owning locations players can climb the social ladder in the kingdom of Egion. Every player starts as a peasant, but when he/she owns enough locations and becomes a noble he/she can challenge the King. Becoming the King is the ultimate goal toward which the players strive for. Players have to help eachother to fight the creatures and become stronger, but at the same time they have to watch out that the other players don`t become too strong and maybe throw some curve balls their way. After all, there can be only one King!   The game setting is traditional fantasy. Typical character classes fighters, wizards etc. and spells and items are all there. It is hard to be very original and MECGE does not even try to be. Quite the opposite, the game is meant to have that traditional "feeling" and anyone who has played these kinds of games should learn it pretty easily. So basically it is suitable as an entry level game for people just getting to know RPG and it is also very good for not-so-serious gaming sessions where you can spend the evening with friends and maybe have few beverages while playing.    The pictures look nice. Who is the artist?So far there are pictures from over 60 different artists and there will still be even more. They range from hobbyists to professional artists. Some of them are already renowned and some are still making a name for themselves. They are all very talented and many of them have already worked in the gaming industry. Featured pictures show now their user names in deviantart (www.deviantart.com), but depending on individual wishes their real names may be on the printed cards. Some cards are in landscape orintation to better show off the beautiful artwork.What is the campaign goal?The goal of the campaign is to get the funding needed to 
arrange the printing of the game. If the goal is reached it will still take few months to finalize the game. The printing of
 the game would be done after that. Estimated time of delivery is Q4/2014.This is Fixed Funding, meaning that if the goal is not reached the contributions are refunded. Most printing companies have a minumum print run, so the goal has to be reached in order to make that minimum quantity for printing the game. Are there any plans for future development?If the funding is successfull a new company will be started to continue the development at a more professional level.Do you
think that some of the main stream game companies flood the games with new
sourcebooks and expansions all the time and you just can`t afford to keep up
even if you wanted to. The plan with MECGE is not do that. It is just not possible for a small
game company. And also we believe that the game will have to stay interesting
with just the basic sets and rules without having to push out new stuff all the
time. This does not mean that the game will not be developed at all. We do plan

new addition to the game should be something to look forward to and spend the

Are the

And if there would be longer printing runs later then there would also be cards

story:
Hi, there. We are a team from Japan and our team is made up with 4 students. We are now developing an iOS game mixed with puzzle and sweet romance.

Game Concept

3 Stars, Highest Scores, additional bonus...
Explosive Effect, Exciting Action, Exaggerated Sounds...
Aren't you feeling tired sometimes and just want to slow down your pace?

We don't want to reinvent the wheel.
We don't want to make a game for the replacement of Angry Birds or Temple Run.
We just want to provide a game with healing power and bring back your sweet memory.
We hope you will relax yourself and get some real fun when playing.

Game Overview


*Screenshot from the prototype. It will not be the final image.

This is a game about encounter. The characters are elementary school students. As most of the teens in puppy love, they feel hesitate and very nervous. But if only there's a way to shorten their distance, they may have a happy ending at last, don't they?

Game Features

Puzzles mixed in a sweet story.


*Screenshot from the prototype. It will not be the final image.

In order to help our characters to encounter with another one, we need to solve the puzzles and use various mechanisms wisely.

Sometimes we need to keep calm and keep a distance in order to achieve our goals.

It is very important to keep cooperation in mind because most of the stages can not be cleared without another one's help.

Interesting mechanisms


*Screenshot from the prototype. It will not be the final image.

Blockers that only block the boy or the girl

Colored switch buttons with interlocked doors

Fast moving walkways

Loitering ghosts

And a lot more...

Various situations


*Screenshot from the prototype. It will not be the final image.

In rainy days, umbrellas will be necessities.

Our characters will sing for their encounter.

Why We Need Your Support

Now we just finished our playable prototype. 25% of the levels are designed, and the theme music is also completed. We are working hard to finish our game. But now we are facing some difficulties on the improvement of graphics. Our game is developed with Unity and Maya. In order to improve our 3D models and make better shadow effect, the pro version and some addons of the software are needed. It will be very kind of you to help us buy them. One dollar will be very helpful.

Contact Us

Please feel free to contact with us. We are very glad to answer your questions and listen to your advice.
Even if you are not willing to give us perks, it doesn't matter! We will still thank you for viewing this page and supporting us.
It will be very appreciated to like our facebook page.

Email : throbofencounters@outlook.com
Facebook Page : www.facebook.com/throbofencounters

story:
• About Us

We're a team of students in New Zealand from many different backgrounds, this is our first game together! 

  • What is Off Da Railz?

It is a 3D game inspired by Snake where you play as a Train that has reached enlightenment and left the rails. Your purpose is to roam the world, looking for lonely lost carriages to join your flock. But you are not the only train out there, and they will all try to take from you what you own!

The game plays much like a multiplayer arena, except that you 'fight' by ramming headfirst into another train's carriages in order to break his chain, and claim them for yourself!

This game's prototype was designed by 7 people over the course of 8 weeks, and we are quite pleased with how well our original concept of '3D Snake' turned out! We've decided we'd really like this game to reach it's full potential!

  • We Need Your Help!

As it stands, our game has:

  • Functional networking - Clients see jittering, but doesn't affect gameplay.
  • 2 train powerups - Shotgun and Haste
  • One arena map
  • One game mode - Carriage-tycoon.
  • One really wacky and amazing train.

We had a lot else planned that did not make it into the game in time, and the game in it's current form can't be called complete. We'd like to add at least the following features to the game :

  • More game modes! - such as 'Brawl' and 'Depot', our own spin on KotH and CTF
  • More trains! - different trains with unique stats and skills.
  • More powerups! - and tweaking existing ones. Shotgun isn't very exciting in it's current form.
  • Fixing up networking! - to make multiplayer as good an experience as possible!
  • Polish.

 

What We Need, Why We Need It

In short, we need $98850 to make this happen :

Development Cost

3000 Project Management
2500 Integration
4500 Physics
5000 Game Design Iteration
7500 Game Programming
2500 UI
5000 Level Design
6000 Networking Multiplayer
10000 Testing and Bugfixing
41850 in total

Contracting Budget

$10000 3D Models
$6000 2D Art
$10000 Animation
$8000 Audio
$8000 Voice Acting
$5000 Legal Fees
42000 in total

Licensing Fees

1000 Source Control/Project Management
2000 Unity3D PRO for one person
5000 1st party licensing
7000 Indiegogo, Steam, Payment Processing
15000 In total

 

In summary :

As students looking for our first jobs in the Games industry, we would really like to keep working on this game, but we have to face the facts. Some among us can barely get by on what we have, and cannot afford to volunteer time into this game beyond what we already have. 

If you like what you see here and want to see this game happen, please make a pledge and spread word of what we did here!

 

 Stretch Goals

And what if we overshoot the goal?

$20 - each member of the team gets a Beer!

$1150 - Developer Commentary

$11150 - More Trains, Levels, Mechanics

$21150 - Modding Tools

$41150 - Custom Engine - We'll rewrite the game from the ground up, freeing the game from Unity's limitations. The improved control we have over the game enables more advanced player modding features.

$61150 - Community Designed DLC - we work with our fans to create a free expansion pack for the game!

 Our Goal

We really wanted to prove that games that shirk the mainstream formulas of combat could make it in today's competitive games market, and with your help, we can!

Want to help, but can't pledge?

Spread word about us and what we are doing! We are still working on this and will continue to add pictures and videos moving forward!

story:
Panic-ko is a survival horror game created with RPG maker that tells the story of a girl named Kaori with a fragile heart condition. She has been locked up her whole life in a small room in order to keep her safe and healthy from her unusual illness. But one day, she gets out and finds herself in a dark and dangerous place. Driven by curiosity, Kaori explores her surroundings, unveiling the mystery behind the horrible events that happened in the place where she has been imprisoned.

This game is inspired by titles like “Yume Nikki”, “Fragile Dreams” and “Fatal Frame. You will need to go through many challenges, facing puzzles, persecutions and paranoia, always with the omnipresent presence of the heart illness of Kaori that can kill you at any moment.

“What is the fear that makes you feel tiny and vulnerable?”

Interesting, eh? Isnt it?  Eh? Eeeeeeeehhhhhh??????????

Well, I have good news. You can download the demo of the first chapter right here! Give it a try, you will not regret it! (or maybe yes, lol)


Please forgive the translation mistakes  in the game (we are spaniards, lol). Also, if you find any bugs, let us know so we can fix it as soon as possible! Thank you for your patience!
 


Hi, my name is Seta Nagato. I am the main developer of Panic-ko. I am a university student from Madrid, Spain. Panic-ko is my first project with professional intentions, and I have been working on it for about one year and a half.

I have big expectations with this project. I really hope I can convey the dreamlike feeling of fear and beauty trough this game directly to the player.                                       

Creating a videogame professionally needs a lot of money. Because I’m a college student, let’s say that money is not a very common thing to see inside my wallet. But I really want to finish this game and bring it to the world! But because this is a solo project, I cannot make progress as much as I wish without the necessary funding.

But with your help, I can make Panic-ko a game worth to play.

"What are we doing with the money? Well, obviously we will use it to create blue meth. Yep, that’s right, blue meth, the good stuff, 93% pure. Say my name, you know who am I. You’re goddamn right. I’m the danger, and the one who knocks. So give me your money, I need it, for real, I have cancer *cough* *cough*."

Alright, Breaking Bad jokes apart. Most of the funding will go into creating a unique and original OST. We will hire a professional composer, Bruno Travis, who will create the music for Panic-ko. The OST in a videogame is a very important piece in order to create a good atmosphere, so that’s why we will invest approximately 65% (aprox. 2000€) of the funding into the OST. 

And the 35% left of the funding will go directly to hire graphic designers to create more enemies, design maps and illustrations for the game. With this, we can create a more rich and interesting environment for Panic-ko.                   

           


For the kind hearted ones that are going to help us to make this project possible we have many cool rewards for you! You can get the complete game, exclusive skins for Kaori, a downloadable version of the OST, a beautiful print of the art work, exclusive T-shirts, your own sprite that will appear in the game and even the opportunity to have your own small mission or chapter inside the game! Awesome!  Check all of the rewards here on the right side!


Note: these are still provisional designs, so they might have some changes in their final designs (always for the better, so don't worry!)


Getting more money than our initial goal is so difficult to imagine, that we don’t have any stretch goals…

Ok, but let's imagine for a moment, that we get more money than we expected. Here are some of our stretch goals.

If we accomplish these stretch goals, we will update new ones to make this project even greater! 

Thank you for reading until here! We are very grateful for any help that you can give us! You can help us by spreading the word and telling all your friends about this project

Or you can even draw fan arts or upload your gameplays of the demo and send it to us! Any kind of feedback of the game will be accepted with a deep gratitude.

Thank you again, and we hope you enjoy Panic-ko.                 

         

                                 Panic-ko tumblr

hearted ones that are going to help us to make this project possible we have
many cool rewards for you! You can get the complete game, exclusive skins for
Kaori, a downloadable version of the OST, a beautiful print of the art work, exclusive
T-shirts, your own sprite that will appear in the game and even the opportunity
to have your own small mission or chapter inside the game! Awesome!  Check all of the rewards here on the right side!
Note: these are still provisional designs, so they might have some changes in their final designs (always for the better, so don't worry!)



Getting more
money than our initial goal is so difficult to imagine, that we don’t have any
stretch goals…
Ok, but let's imagine for a moment, that we get more money than we expected. Here are some of
our stretch goals.

If we accomplish these stretch goals, we will update new ones to make this project even greater! 

Thank you for reading until here! We are very grateful for any help that you can give us! You can help us by spreading the word and telling all your friends about this project
Or you can even
draw fan arts or upload your gameplays of the demo and send it to us! Any kind
of feedback of the game will be accepted with a deep gratitude. 
Thank you again,
and we hope you enjoy Panic-ko.                  
         


                                 Panic-ko tumblr

story:
Our story

Hi, my name is Edwin and I'm a graduated college student majored in natural sciences. While playing some cool games one day in my phone I came out with the great idea of developing a game that rewarded knowledge and learning. I quickly contacted some friends to help me out develop this awesome game and the idea of Quizbit came to life. 

This trivia game offers you the chance to challenge yourself to an amazing quiz game experience or if you wish, you can win real prizes! like Gift Cards, TVs, laptops, game consoles, iPads, and more! 

With cool quiz categories like Psychology, History, Logos, Chemistry, Sports, TV shows, and Fashion, QuizBit fits everyone!

To play for prizes, all you have to do is get in a tournaments, as you advance by winning more rounds, you can compete for bigger and bigger prizes!

                             

   

We need you!

So why do we need funding?

  • This project is somewhat costly, we contacted some professional app developers and the source code is going to cost ~$5,000 
  • In addition, graphic designs, editing and server development will quickly increase that cost up to ~$10,000
  • We will  also need around 2 months of funding prior to launching the app for the prizes that YOU! are going to get. 
  • We estimated this initial fund to be about $20,0000 but are determined to make this happen with the money we get from this campaign.
So what are you going to get ? The edge to win:
  • We came up with the big idea of offering you the option to buy multipliers. What are multipliers? They are an awesome perk that regular players will have to earn by playing LONG hours. 
  • This will give you an edge to get more points to win every single tournament. Here is how it works.
________________________________________________________________________
Multiplier 1:    1/2x pts                    
No multiplier                   1500                   Multiplier 1:                      1575                         
Multiplier 2:    1x pts

No multiplier:                  1500                   Multiplier 2:                      1650           

Multiplier 3:    2x pts

No multiplier:                  1500                   Multiplier 3:                      1800        

Multiplier 4:    3x pts

No multiplier:                  1500                   Multiplier 4:                      1950        .

Multiplier 5:    4x pts

No multiplier:                  1500                   Multiplier 5:                      2100        

Multiplier 6:    5x pts

No multiplier:                  1500                   Multiplier 6:                      2250        

_________________________________________________________________________


This is the first project that we are going to develop and we hope to start right after we finish this campaign. With your help we are going to make this game the MOST POPULAR GAME in the app store.
By rewarding players when they win this game will promote learning, knowledge and challenge. Users will also have the opportunity to contribute questions so that it never gets boring!

Challenges

  • The main challenge is going to be support the app for the first two months but we believe that after we finish this campaign, we will have the minimum required funds to be able to run it.
  • If we don't meet our funding we will STILL try to develop the app and hopefully find another way to go ahead fulfill our dream.
  • We have to make this app a truly smooth and upscale app.
  • Developing for several platforms including iOS, Android, Windows, PC and more.
  • This campaign is going to be key, in the development of this app and only through contributors like you, this is going to be possible.

How can I Help ?

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
So what are you waiting for ?

Endorse Quizbit Today!

The main challenge is going to be support the app for the first two months but we believe that after we finish this campaign, we will have the minimum required funds to be able to run it.
If we don't meet our funding we will STILL try to develop the app and hopefully find another way to go ahead fulfill our dream.
We have to make this app a truly smooth and upscale app.
Developing for several platforms including iOS, Android, Windows, PC and more.
This campaign is going to be key, in the development of this app and only through contributors like you, this is going to be possible.




How can I Help ?


 If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! 

So what are you waiting for ?

Endorse Quizbit Today!

story:
Gabrielle's day was already bad enough. Her day-off has been cancelled, the city is under siege of a serial killer and the authorities are unable to catch the culprit. However, an earthquake strikes the city and a horde of monsters appear in the city in large numbers. Outnumbered, the monsters overtake the city, turning it into a living hell. 

Now, Gabrielle must partner up with the mysterious Vincent and other survivors to discover the cause of the city's downfall and survive long enough to bring help to the city. 

But is it already too late? 

TWO SIDES OF THE STORY

The game is divided between "Side A" Gabrielle's scenario and "Side B" Vincent's scenario. To reach the true end of the story, you must play the two scenarios. Each character with have unique situations to experience. 

DEATH AWAITS YOU!

As you read through the story, you'll be presented with a choice to make. Every choice is a life and death situation for the characters. Each wrong choice will result in a terrible death, so choose wisely. 

So far, the game uses royalty free music composed by Myuu and Eric Matyas. As there is more funding for the project, a custom OST will be added to the reward bonuses. 

Here are some of the characters you'll encounter in the game.

The game will have special event scenes featuring professional-grade artwork that can be unlocked as the story progresses.

UPDATED DEMO COMING SOON. 

These are the rewards based on your pledge. Choose the one you like.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
WHAT IS DORO!
Doro is a 2d online fighting based game. Doro is a plat former type game with a unique art style, and various features 

WHAT CAN WE DO IN DORO

                               


once the player creates an account, they start with the default player. you can fight other players. rank up and unlock new characters in which you can use to fight, There will also be Missions for those who wish to do more than just PvP. Doro has a Regular Death Match mode in which it is every player for themselves. Fight other players and come out on top, receive points To rank up as well as coins and azure, which you can use to unlock new playable characters ,maps and more

WHO IS DORO BY

Team Perious an independent Game development group that was formed in 2013, The Idea of Doro.

WHEN CAN WE PLAY DORO

                                               

The Release Date of Doro is September 27 however if it is completed before that it will be released.

WHAT ARE YOUR PLANS FOR DORO

right now priority is finishing Doro and getting it out to public, once this is done, Doro will originally be for Windows But In the future it will be Available for the Android Platform.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Currently need 500 Euros to contract a skilled coder for this project

    All Contributors  will get special in game privileges as well as some concept art

  • If we cannot reach the goal, the project will have to be postponed till the funds can be gathered,  or till a replacement coder with the proper qualifications can be found within our means.

Impact

  • If you have ever liked simple games , fighting games, 2d games, this is a project to support .

  • Team Perious has created other online games in the past "Stick Legends Online Which got over 120 downloads the first 3 days of beta testing.

  • Your contribution will play an important role to the features and gaming experience.

Risks & Challenges

Doro may not be available for the IOS system the first year'
due to TP currently only having Artist as active staff, there may be heavy reliance on the contracted coder
If the project is not completely funded, there will be a full refund, we do thank you for all the support

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cant help Financially , please help us and spread the word so your friends have the opportunity to.  

    make sure you tune in for updates.

story:
Recent additions

  • Added sample spreads of the book
  • Added a guide to pay with Ideal near the bottom
  • Added a video link from Eindhovens Dagblad under Gallery

日本語の概要

2kB of Fun

76年〜85年における携帯ビデオゲームの素晴らしい世界

マルタイン・コッホ著

１９７６年から１９８５年の初期の携帯ゲーム機で、これほど贅沢な種類のケースデザインを誰もみたことがありませんでした。これらの携帯ゲーム機がもつ本質をこれまで美しくシンプルに出したコンピューターゲームはありませんでした。２ＫＢメモリーでこれほどまでの楽しみを提供できた例はなかったのです。

クラシック携帯ゲームの絶頂期から３０年が経ちました。１９８３年はアミダー、アストロサンダー7、バーガータイム、ディグダグ、ミズパックマン、キューバート、スーパーコブラ、ザクソンのようなゲームにとって最高の年でした。

オランダの建築家、マルタィン・コッホは２００に及ぶ優れた携帯ゲームを購入し、撮影、解体したのちに技術分析をし、研究後、今まで誰もみたことがない、素晴らしいカタログのような本にしました。

2 kB of Fun

I am Martijn Koch, architect from the Netherlands with a passion for photography and product design. In 2009 I visited a vintage clothing shop in Osaka Japan with my girlfriend and while waiting I spotted the most awesome toy in a vintage toy cabinet: Epoch Astro Thunder 7. The guy behind the counter put in 4 C batteries and turned it on. I was smashed by the experience this toy from 1983 delivered. I immediately bought it.

One year later, I was building 26 Retro Space arcade cabinets for Dutch Game Garden's Indigo Showcase in Utrecht, an incubator for the Dutch indie gaming industry. Next up was a job to redesign an old bank building to house 40 small gaming firms. To give the floors their own identity, I bought a couple of bright coloured handhelds from the early eighties and photographed them. They ended up being too retro for the interior, but they asked for a nice treatment! I was missing a true celebration of these magnificent toys from 1976-1985.

The book I'm making is called 2kB of Fun, a combination of the joy these games offered and the magnificent feat that their designers managed to create arcade-like game play in 2kB of memory.

A classic printed book is still the best way to document this fantastic era of gaming toys. Print allows images with tons of details to be consumed at ease. "Retina" tablet displays allow better image reproduction than before, but not on par with print, and definitely not when it comes to the vector drawings included. We want to use BASF Novaspace F 2010 inks to make reproduction of the fantastic colours as nice as possible.

Dutch art book print and publishing firm Lecturis will be partnering to make the experience as good as possible, it is 10 minutes on the bicycle away! We don't want to save a few bucks on off-shoring and have less hands-on opportunities to fine tune the printing process to offer the best.

Everybody that supports the book, can choose to get it with a supporters-only special edition cover and an autograph on the inside! If you plan to sell it in the future, everybody can see directly you were a backer! Please state in your backing message if you want a plain version.

Special backer edition cover

The games

I started collecting. Thanks to informative websites by Rik Morgan and Jaro Gielens, I was able to buy the absolute best games. I tried to collect entirely dedicated to the goal of the best documentation of the toys, with no interest in value and rarity, which led to weird situations like me desoldering a display on a 200€ Gakken Dig Dug (it still works!).

The selection is based on these criteria:

  • Well known games: the ones everybody who played just one remembers
  • The most beautiful case designs
  • Excellent manufacturing quality
  • Exceptional technology
  • Great displays and sound
  • Awesome game experience. Which game pulls the most about the 2kB of ROM the microcontroller offered.

The games were coming in and started to drive our reception lady nuts. My selection contains around 200 games and some related objects that are needed to place the story in its context. You will see exactly what calculator inspired Gunpei Yokoi on that bullet train ride to come up with the first Game&Watch Nintendo Ball, and I will take it apart.

Why I need your help

I'm very good in the research, collecting tons of data, in making the best product photo's of these games, and in making awesome drawings to learn more about these toys, but there is more needed to get a book absolutely perfect. That's where you need to help me.

I need 15000€ to get the book press ready. This money is used for the following:

  • Rewriting of my 500 pages of rough text to perfect English
  • Translation of a summary for every game to Japanese
  • The actual layout of all 276 pages so I can focus on the best content
  • Professional lithography of the images to Novaspace CMYK
  • Making proofs and samples

If I collect more than 15000€, I have some more ideas:

  • If Japanese or French interest is high, we are going to put the text on a separate black plate, so the big Handheld loving nations Japan and France can enjoy the full experience in their native language. I expect a lot of interest from France as it was the second handheld loving nation back in the day. Guess their bullet trains, nuclear power plants and Minitel pre-internet made them very greedy for Japanese toys. Please comment if you have interest in a native language.
  • I really want to crack the games code. If more money is collected, I have the intention to strip the most important microcontrollers, read their ROM's and learn about their magnificent compact code. We might even be able to make some true emulators. If you have tech gear to make this possible and want to cooperate, please let me know.

The most important reason to support the project is to help all the information escape my studio into the world the best way possible! That's why I do a fixed funding campaign. It is all or nothing! I am always after the best quality in my work.

What do I already have?

At the moment I have the following rough material

A database with all technical details. Accurate production dates, microcontrollers used, displays used, sprite counts, sizes, and much more. 500kB of SQL!

  • 200 high quality professionally made product photographs of all the games
  • 1000 guts pictures I made when opening every single game. Where possible, I did not want to destroy games, but I made an exception for Auto Race, the first one from 1976!
  • 60 FullHD game play video's made from decased games so no scratched plastic spoils the picture, with a distortion free macro lens on a DSLR for the best IQ.
  • 10 cutaway vector drawings, each open and closed, for the most interesting games when it comes to technology used inside
  • 20 electronic schemes that show exactly how these games worked, with detailed explanation of the technology
  • technical details of all the components used, how to interpret production numbers on chips and displays and much more nerdy stuff, and how everything relates to the original arcade games when applicable.

The Photo's

Early 2011 I started photographing them. After some research to photography technology I found the best way to photograph these games. Due to their relative small size and 3-dimensional character, the shape limits the amount of detail you can photograph, no matter you use a phone or a system camera! Diffraction limits collide with depth of field. Using a tilt-shift lens on a full frame camera turned out to deliver the best quality and flexibility.

I wanted the photographs to be as clean as possible. The objects should look like they are new, taken out of their original eighties themed surroundings. This way they make you wonder even more: did I live in that era? I must have missed something!

I try to capture the total 3D shape in one shot, using a mirror bottom to reveal nice details in the complex plastic molds.

The next step is the digital cleaning and repair. Working with small objects means you see every spot of dust and every scratch. Only few games were mint boxed, so this means a lot of work to clean up the images. I guess 1000 hours of Photoshop stamping are in the project already. I don't use "advanced" modern pixel polish filters as they destroy the details.

Risks

I'm very good at making close deadlines, like I showed by creating 26 arcade cabinets in a month back in 2010, and doing the same for a 20 cab run in 2 weeks this year just in time for the Game Developer Conference, but I also want my products to be perfect. The goal is December 2013, but it might become early 2014. It would feel very bad to have you guys need to put vouchers under the Christmas tree.

Shipping

Shipping a 1.7kg book in a good way does not come cheap. That is why you need to add shipping costs to your perk amount. Because the book is as big as possibly fits a 2kg "envelope", the shipping is kept to a minimum. From the Netherlands, the postal service works with 3 regions:

  • Pick up (at launch party): free
  • Netherlands: 4€
  • Europe: 10€ (Albania, Andorra, Austria, Azores, Balearic Islands, Belarus, Belgium, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Canary Islands, Channel Islands, Czech Republic, Croatia, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faeroe Islands, Finland, France, Gibraltar, Greece, Greenland, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Madeira, Malta, Moldavia, Monaco, Montenegro, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, San Marino, Serbia, Slovenia, Slovak, Spain, Sweden, Swiss, Turkey, Ukraine, United Kingdom, Vatican)
  • Rest of the world: 14€

Q*bert and Burger Time fans get their stuff without extra shipment costs, and pay for one book.

How to pay with iDeal

  • Open a Paypal account, but skip payment information (linking bank account or Credit Card).
  • Open your email, relog from the link in there. Paypal is now active. You will be asked to link CC or bank again, but click "rekeningoverzicht" or "account overview" down left and skip it.
  • Go to Money2 and transfer your perk money with iDeal to your new Paypal account. It takes a few seconds upon reception.
  • Your Paypal account is filled with the perk money. Use your Paypal username and password on Indiegogo to pay.
  • In case of a refund, the money will be booked back to the Paypal account. You can either add your bank account to get the money back, pay Money2 5€ to do it for you, or just spend it on thousands of webshops. You can use the Money2Paypal option also for many other online shopping options.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other things you can do to help:

  • Like my Facebook project page.
  • Tell your friends about it and check if there are fans
  • Share the Indiegogo campaign on social media
  • Create blog or forum posts about my project
  • If you worked on a classic handheld game, at a handheld game firm, sold games in a toy store, or anything else worth being noticed, contact me to see if we can add cool information to the book.

Disclaimer:

  • In the book, only natural person names will be mentioned as supporter. No nicknames or company names.
  • We have the right to refuse any weblinks from supporters that choose the Puck Monster or DK JR perk we do not want to be associated with, like medicine, adult or gambling sites.
story_txt:
Recent additions


Added sample spreads of the book
Added a guide to pay with Ideal near the bottom
Added a video link from Eindhovens Dagblad under Gallery

日本語の概要
2kB of Fun
76年〜85年における携帯ビデオゲームの素晴らしい世界
マルタイン・コッホ著
１９７６年から１９８５年の初期の携帯ゲーム機で、これほど贅沢な種類のケースデザインを誰もみたことがありませんでした。これらの携帯ゲーム機がもつ本質をこれまで美しくシンプルに出したコンピューターゲームはありませんでした。２ＫＢメモリーでこれほどまでの楽しみを提供できた例はなかったのです。
クラシック携帯ゲームの絶頂期から３０年が経ちました。１９８３年はアミダー、アストロサンダー7、バーガータイム、ディグダグ、ミズパックマン、キューバート、スーパーコブラ、ザクソンのようなゲームにとって最高の年でした。
オランダの建築家、マルタィン・コッホは２００に及ぶ優れた携帯ゲームを購入し、撮影、解体したのちに技術分析をし、研究後、今まで誰もみたことがない、素晴らしいカタログのような本にしました。
2 kB of Fun
I am Martijn Koch, architect from the Netherlands with a passion for photography and product design. In 2009 I visited a vintage clothing shop in Osaka Japan with my girlfriend and while waiting I spotted the most awesome toy in a vintage toy cabinet: Epoch Astro Thunder 7. The guy behind the counter put in 4 C batteries and turned it on. I was smashed by the experience this toy from 1983 delivered. I immediately bought it.
One year later, I was building 26 Retro Space arcade cabinets for Dutch Game Garden's Indigo Showcase in Utrecht, an incubator for the Dutch indie gaming industry. Next up was a job to redesign an old bank building to house 40 small gaming firms. To give the floors their own identity, I bought a couple of bright coloured handhelds from the early eighties and photographed them. They ended up being too retro for the interior, but they asked for a nice treatment! I was missing a true celebration of these magnificent toys from 1976-1985.


The book I'm making is called 2kB of Fun, a combination of the joy these games offered and the magnificent feat that their designers managed to create arcade-like game play in 2kB of memory.
A classic printed book is still the best way to document this fantastic era of gaming toys. Print allows images with tons of details to be consumed at ease. "Retina" tablet displays allow better image reproduction than before, but not on par with print, and definitely not when it comes to the vector drawings included. We want to use BASF Novaspace F 2010 inks to make reproduction of the fantastic colours as nice as possible.
Dutch art book print and publishing firm Lecturis will be partnering to make the experience as good as possible, it is 10 minutes on the bicycle away! We don't want to save a few bucks on off-shoring and have less hands-on opportunities to fine tune the printing process to offer the best.

Everybody that supports the book, can choose to get it with a supporters-only special edition cover and an autograph on the inside! If you plan to sell it in the future, everybody can see directly you were a backer! Please state in your backing message if you want a plain version.

Special backer edition cover
The games
I started collecting. Thanks to informative websites by Rik Morgan and Jaro Gielens, I was able to buy the absolute best games. I tried to collect entirely dedicated to the goal of the best documentation of the toys, with no interest in value and rarity, which led to weird situations like me desoldering a display on a 200€ Gakken Dig Dug (it still works!).
The selection is based on these criteria:

Well known games: the ones everybody who played just one remembers
The most beautiful case designs
Excellent manufacturing quality
Exceptional technology
Great displays and sound
Awesome game experience. Which game pulls the most about the 2kB of ROM the microcontroller offered.

The games were coming in and started to drive our reception lady nuts. My selection contains around 200 games and some related objects that are needed to place the story in its context. You will see exactly what calculator inspired Gunpei Yokoi on that bullet train ride to come up with the first Game&Watch Nintendo Ball, and I will take it apart.
Why I need your help
I'm very good in the research, collecting tons of data, in making the best product photo's of these games, and in making awesome drawings to learn more about these toys, but there is more needed to get a book absolutely perfect. That's where you need to help me.
I need 15000€ to get the book press ready. This money is used for the following:

Rewriting of my 500 pages of rough text to perfect English
Translation of a summary for every game to Japanese
The actual layout of all 276 pages so I can focus on the best content
Professional lithography of the images to Novaspace CMYK
Making proofs and samples

If I collect more than 15000€, I have some more ideas:

If Japanese or French interest is high, we are going to put the text on a separate black plate, so the big Handheld loving nations Japan and France can enjoy the full experience in their native language. I expect a lot of interest from France as it was the second handheld loving nation back in the day. Guess their bullet trains, nuclear power plants and Minitel pre-internet made them very greedy for Japanese toys. Please comment if you have interest in a native language.
I really want to crack the games code. If more money is collected, I have the intention to strip the most important microcontrollers, read their ROM's and learn about their magnificent compact code. We might even be able to make some true emulators. If you have tech gear to make this possible and want to cooperate, please let me know.

The most important reason to support the project is to help all the information escape my studio into the world the best way possible! That's why I do a fixed funding campaign. It is all or nothing! I am always after the best quality in my work.
What do I already have?

At the moment I have the following rough material
A database with all technical details. Accurate production dates, microcontrollers used, displays used, sprite counts, sizes, and much more. 500kB of SQL!

200 high quality professionally made product photographs of all the games
1000 guts pictures I made when opening every single game. Where possible, I did not want to destroy games, but I made an exception for Auto Race, the first one from 1976!
60 FullHD game play video's made from decased games so no scratched plastic spoils the picture, with a distortion free macro lens on a DSLR for the best IQ.
10 cutaway vector drawings, each open and closed, for the most interesting games when it comes to technology used inside
20 electronic schemes that show exactly how these games worked, with detailed explanation of the technology
technical details of all the components used, how to interpret production numbers on chips and displays and much more nerdy stuff, and how everything relates to the original arcade games when applicable.

The Photo's

Early 2011 I started photographing them. After some research to photography technology I found the best way to photograph these games. Due to their relative small size and 3-dimensional character, the shape limits the amount of detail you can photograph, no matter you use a phone or a system camera! Diffraction limits collide with depth of field. Using a tilt-shift lens on a full frame camera turned out to deliver the best quality and flexibility.
I wanted the photographs to be as clean as possible. The objects should look like they are new, taken out of their original eighties themed surroundings. This way they make you wonder even more: did I live in that era? I must have missed something!
I try to capture the total 3D shape in one shot, using a mirror bottom to reveal nice details in the complex plastic molds.
The next step is the digital cleaning and repair. Working with small objects means you see every spot of dust and every scratch. Only few games were mint boxed, so this means a lot of work to clean up the images. I guess 1000 hours of Photoshop stamping are in the project already. I don't use "advanced" modern pixel polish filters as they destroy the details.

Risks
I'm very good at making close deadlines, like I showed by creating 26 arcade cabinets in a month back in 2010, and doing the same for a 20 cab run in 2 weeks this year just in time for the Game Developer Conference, but I also want my products to be perfect. The goal is December 2013, but it might become early 2014. It would feel very bad to have you guys need to put vouchers under the Christmas tree.
Shipping
Shipping a 1.7kg book in a good way does not come cheap. That is why you need to add shipping costs to your perk amount. Because the book is as big as possibly fits a 2kg "envelope", the shipping is kept to a minimum. From the Netherlands, the postal service works with 3 regions:

Pick up (at launch party): free
Netherlands: 4€
Europe: 10€ (Albania, Andorra, Austria, Azores, Balearic Islands, Belarus, Belgium, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Canary Islands, Channel Islands, Czech Republic, Croatia, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faeroe Islands, Finland, France, Gibraltar, Greece, Greenland, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Madeira, Malta, Moldavia, Monaco, Montenegro, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, San Marino, Serbia, Slovenia, Slovak, Spain, Sweden, Swiss, Turkey, Ukraine, United Kingdom, Vatican)
Rest of the world: 14€
Q*bert and Burger Time fans get their stuff without extra shipment costs, and pay for one book.
How to pay with iDeal

Open a Paypal account, but skip payment information (linking bank account or Credit Card).
Open your email, relog from the link in there. Paypal is now active. You will be asked to link CC or bank again, but click "rekeningoverzicht" or "account overview" down left and skip it.
Go to Money2 and transfer your perk money with iDeal to your new Paypal account. It takes a few seconds upon reception.
Your Paypal account is filled with the perk money. Use your Paypal username and password on Indiegogo to pay.
In case of a refund, the money will be booked back to the Paypal account. You can either add your bank account to get the money back, pay Money2 5€ to do it for you, or just spend it on thousands of webshops. You can use the Money2Paypal option also for many other online shopping options.

Other Ways You Can Help
Other things you can do to help:

Like my Facebook project page.
Tell your friends about it and check if there are fans
Share the Indiegogo campaign on social media
Create blog or forum posts about my project
If you worked on a classic handheld game, at a handheld game firm, sold games in a toy store, or anything else worth being noticed, contact me to see if we can add cool information to the book.

Disclaimer:

In the book, only natural person names will be mentioned as supporter. No nicknames or company names.
We have the right to refuse any weblinks from supporters that choose the Puck Monster or DK JR perk we do not want to be associated with, like medicine, adult or gambling sites.

story:
Cliquez ici pour la version française.

Oro Space is a massively multiplayer online role-playing game inspired by the fusion of Action RPG and Space sim game styles. Introducing a third person action system combined to a real time driving experience, it primary aims to deliver a freedom of movement that is basically specific to Space simulation titles.

Oro Space features the advantages of both types of games therefore we are proud to present you the fruits of a long development. We really hope you will enjoy this new kind of game. 

Act as one of the 5 playable races rookie of the spatial academy available in the game.
Choose the proper skills for a first craft and improve them.
Play in a vast universe consisted of hundreds of sectors connected by spatial portals.
Unveil the mysteries of the universe, from the unpredictable spatial parameters to the fragments of the Forgotten Story.
Join a corporation, made of rebels or pirates and take part in their ascents or in their falls.

Drive your spacecraft and recruit your crew in the course of your travel.
Explore the numerous spatial stations and the planets of the galaxy.
Lead your commando squad selected among your crew members or join the unit of another player.
Accumulate wealth, form your own squad, buy an apartment, a station or who knows… maybe your own area.

Enter a world hanging in the balance where corporations and the Council of the races struggle for power.
Choose your side from 5 playable species of the Oro Space universe; pick out a Sprite, a Dwarf, a Human, an Elf or an Orc. Each race has their own unique strengths and skills, from a technology, a spaceship design or territorial strategy perspective.
Be carried away by a fascinating story that allows you to enjoy the features of the game at your own pace.
Join one of the 60 corporations and discover its unique story and objectives.
Complete missions for your corporation and get promoted as long as you achieve them.

Build your reputation and develop your affinities with various squads to unlock new areas, equipment and missions, whether this regards the races representatives, the guilds, the rebels or the pirates.
Think differently and join a group of pirates or a rebel squad to make the world better or to serve your own best interests.

Meet and recruit other players or NPCs to complete your crew and your commando squad.
Pay attention to the personality traits of your character, observe their loyalty to you and act accordingly.
Talk among your crew to reckon the relationships and strengthen their loyalty to you, or pay them a bribe!
Take advantage of your crew member’s contacts to discover new quests.
Both, your reputation and the one of your crew to the various squads will unlock new options during the quests.
Whether you are chatting in your spaceship or just shopping in spatial station you will take action in a world where anything could happen.

Anticipate the future by collecting step by step the fragments of the Forgotten Story and use lessons of the past to build a better future.
Enjoy 6 different types of mini games along with their numerous variations.
Unlock new dialogue options thanks to your skills improvement.
Play with all your friends whether they are under a Windows, Mac or a Linux system through a unique multiplatform system.

Pick up one of the 65 available spaceships among the 13 existing classes.
Select a spaceship based on its design, its equipment and take advantage of the racial bonuses:

  • The Sprites have a speed bonus.
  • The Dwarfs have an armor bonus.
  • The Humans have a handling bonus.
  • The Elves have a shield bonus.
  • The Orcs have an offensive power bonus.

From the 10 meters basic Reconnaissance spacecraft to the immense 3 kilometers heavy carrier, drive your spaceship in real time alongside to the thousands of other players.
Transport resources or persons as a courier, a taxi or a trader.
Mine the asteroid resources and use them in your production plants.
Escort spaceships, patrol in areas or protect stations from external threats.
Destroy the spaceships attacking you or come alongside to them to seize them.

Buy, roll out and manage your space station in the area of your choice.
Stock up your station on resources in order to resell its products.
Take advantage of the local economy and the price differential to make profits.
Scan asteroids to discover new sources of supply.
Find out about the resources, stations and surprises scattering across the course of the areas exploration.

Train your squad and form alliances to reach your goals.
Take possession of an area, personalize it and make your mark in the universe.

Select your commando squad among your crew members by assigning one of the 6 available roles to every single team-mate.

  • Tank,
  • Demolition,
  • Soldier,
  • Medic,
  • Engineer,
  • Hacker

Assign a specific armor to the roles and special skills of each of your team mates.
Fight troops of enemies alongside your commando squad on the disinfestation missions.
Take action in an advanced strategic system which allows you to control your commando squad and to use their special skills or to give them visual instructions.
Face gangs or armed troops, from the station modules or from land based buildings.
Use your commando squad to avoid a boarding or to take control of an opposite spaceship in a full spatial battle.
Take advantage of total immersion thanks to a system which reduces your mobility as and when you take damages.
Neutralize your opponents by inflecting them incapacitating wounds thanks to the zone of damages system.
Improve your character and your team mates with the skill improvement and the points releasing to distribute in the special skills tree.

Complete your missions by facing a boss with a tremendous action.
Discover mini-games in line with your special skills.
Push your luck by playing a commando squad only consisted of real players and take advantage of your friend’s experience. 

Personalize your spaceship by improving its equipment, or simply by adding your blazon on the hull.
Modify the internal layout of your spacecraft with the spaceship editor and create a custom version by choosing where to place each room, corridor and equipment.
Buy a generic station and add modules to upgrade its features, such as a residential compartment, a factory or a warehouse.
Customize the residential modules by assigning shopping districts and housing areas and impose then a building standard.

Seize areas and impose taxes and settlements to the station owners, manage the protection of the sector, setup automatic booster to optimize the commercial traffic.
Wear your armband or personalize your armor by adding your blazon.



Click here for english version.



Oro Space est un jeu de rôle massivement multijoueur né de la fusion d’un jeu d’action-RPG et d’une simulation spatiale. Il propose un système axé sur de l’action à la troisième personne intégrant du pilotage en temps réel et offrant une liberté d’action propre aux simulations spatiales.

Nous sommes fiers de vous présenter ce projet, fruit d’une longue réflexion dans le but de concilier les avantages de nos deux types de jeux préférés.
Nous espérons que ce nouveau genre saura vous séduire. 

Incarnez un cadet de l’académie spatiale issu d’une des 5 races connues qui coexistent dans Oro Space.
Choisissez les compétences correspondantes à un premier métier et développez les.
Évoluez dans un vaste univers composé d’une centaine de secteurs reliés par des portails spatiaux.
Dévoilez les mystères de l’univers, des imprévisibles anomalies spatiales aux fragments de l’Histoire Oubliée.
Rejoignez une corporation, un groupe de rebelles ou de pirates et participez à leur ascension ou à leur chute.

Pilotez votre vaisseau et recrutez votre équipage au grè de vos rencontres.
Explorez les nombreuses stations spatiales et planètes de la galaxie.
Menez au combat votre commando sélectionné parmi vos membres d’équipage ou rejoignez un commando existant.
Accumulez des richesses, créez votre propre groupe, achetez un appartement, une station et qui sait... votre propre secteur.

Entrez dans un monde à l’équilibre précaire où les corporations et le Conseil des races s'opposent.
Sélectionnez l’une des 5 races jouables de l’univers : un Lutin, un Nain, un Humain, un Elfe ou un Orque.
Découvrez les spécificités de chaque espèce, qu’il s’agisse du design de station et vaisseaux, d’attributs physiques, de préférence technologique ou de l’organisation de leurs secteurs principaux.
Laissez-vous guider par une histoire enivrante vous permettant de découvrir les possibilités du jeu.
Rejoignez l’une des 60 corporations et découvrez l'histoire et les objectifs qui la caractérisent.
Effectuez des missions pour cette corporation et montez en grade au fur et à mesure de vos réussites.

Développez votre réputation auprès des différentes factions pour débloquer l’accès à des secteurs, missions, équipements...
Pensez différemment et rejoignez un groupe de pirates ou une faction rebelle pour changer le monde en bien ou pour vos propres intérêts.

Rencontrez et recrutez des joueurs ou PNJ pour compléter votre équipage et votre commando.
Découvrez que l’ensemble des personnages du jeu disposent de traits de caractère uniques qui forgent leur identité.
Observez l'évolution de la loyauté de vos équipiers selon vos actions.
Discutez avec votre équipage pour découvrir leurs affinités et renforcez leur loyauté à votre égard, ou... payez-les!
Profitez des contacts de vos membres d’équipage pour obtenir de nouvelles quêtes.
Constatez que votre réputation et celle de votre équipage envers les différentes factions débloquent de nouvelles quêtes.
Évoluez dans un monde où tout peut arriver : que vous soyez en pleine discussion dans votre vaisseau ou simplement en train de faire du shopping dans une station spatiale.

Anticipez le futur en débloquant progressivement des fragments de l’Histoire Oubliée et, utilisez les leçons du passé pour changer le futur.
Appréciez les 6 types de mini jeux différents ainsi que leurs nombreuses variations.
Accédez à de nouvelles options de dialogue à mesure que vous gagnez en compétence.
Retrouvez tous vos amis qu’ils soient sous Windows, Mac ou Linux grâce au support multiplateformes.

Choisissez un des 65 vaisseaux disponibles dans l’une des 13 classes existantes.
Sélectionnez un vaisseau pour son design, ses équipements et profitez des bonus raciaux :

  • Les Lutins ont un bonus de vitesse
  • Les Nains ont un bonus d’armure
  • Les Humains ont un bonus en maniabilité
  • Les Elfes ont un bonus en bouclier
  • Les Orques ont un bonus de puissance offensive

Pilotez votre vaisseau en temps réel aux cotés de milliers d’autres joueurs; du simple vaisseau de reconnaissance de 10m à l’immense Transporteur lourd de 3km.
Transportez des ressources ou personnes en tant que coursier, taxis ou marchand.
Exploitez des astéroïdes pour en extraire des ressources et utilisez celles-ci dans vos usines de production ou revendez les.
Escortez des vaisseaux, patrouillez dans des secteurs ou protégez des stations des menaces extérieures.
Détruisez les vaisseaux qui vous attaquent ou abordez-les pour vous en emparer.

Achetez, déployez et gérez votre station spatiale dans le secteur de votre choix.
Approvisionnez votre station en ressource afin de pouvoir revendre ses produits.
Utilisez l’économie locale et les différences de tarif à votre avantage pour générer des bénéfices.
Scannez les astéroïdes pour découvrir de nouvelles sources d’approvisionnement.
A mesure que vous explorer les secteurs, découvrez les ressources, stations et surprises qui s’y cachent.

Formez votre groupe et forgez des alliances pour atteindre vos objectifs.
Prenez un secteur, personnalisez-le et laissez votre marque dans l’univers.

Sélectionnez votre commando parmi vos membres d’équipage et affectez-leurs un des 6 rôles existants :

  • Tank,
  • Démolition,
  • Soldat,
  • Médecin,
  • Ingénieur,
  • Hacker.

Assignez une armure adaptée aux rôles et aux capacités spéciales de chacun de vos équipiers.
Combattez des hordes d’ennemis au côté de votre commando dans les missions de désinfestation.
Découvrez un système stratégique évolué qui vous permet de contrôler votre commando et d’utiliser ses capacités spéciales ou de lui donner des consignes visuelles.
Affrontez des gangs ou des milices armées, que ce soit dans des modules de station ou sur des bâtiments terrestres.
Utilisez votre commando pour repousser un abordage ou … pour prendre le contrôle d’un vaisseau adverse en pleine bataille spatiale.
Profitez d’une plus grande immersion grâce à un système qui réduit votre mobilité au fur et à mesure que vous encaissez des dégâts.
Neutralisez vos adversaires en leur infligeant des blessures incapacitantes grâce au système de dégâts de zone.
Améliorez votre personnage et vos équipiers via l’évolution des compétences et le déblocage de points à répartir dans l’arbre des capacités spéciales.

Finissez vos missions en affrontant un boss dans des actions spectaculaires.
Découvrez des mini-jeux adaptés à l’utilisation de vos capacités spéciales.
Profitez de l’expérience de vos amis en jouant avec un commando composé uniquement de joueurs.

Personnalisez votre vaisseau en améliorant son équipement, ou simplement en ajoutant votre blason sur la coque.
Modifiez l’agencement interne de votre vaisseaux via l’éditeur et créez votre version personnalisée en choisissant où placer chaque pièce, couloir et équipement.
Achetez une station de base et ajoutez des modules pour étendre ses fonctionnalités, qu’il s’agisse de module résidentiel, d’usine ou de simple entrepôt.
Personnalisez les modules résidentiels en assignant des zones commerciales ainsi que des zones d’habitations puis imposez le standing des bâtiments.

Emparez-vous de secteurs et imposez vos taxes et zones d’installations aux possesseurs de station, gérez la protection du secteur, installez des booster automatiques pour densifier le trafic commercial et optimiser vos revenus.
Ajoutez votre brassard de faction ou personnalisez votre armure en y ajoutant votre blason.
