He actually hates everything, and trusts no one but his rifle. Claims that he never misses. Disregarding thefact that he constantly complains about everything, he is  always a desired member of the team, in case you want to survive.Class: sniperSkills: enhanced aimWeapon of choice: sniper rifle KoarraA Quii that was born on Earth, in the town called Alice Springs. Her father left them before she was even born and her mother perished in anti-Quii riots, that is still a usual thing in major cities. Koarra was adopted by local scientist known as Professor. He taught her all that he knew about Quii and their technology and told her about hoards that Quii made before the war. After professor died Koarra continued to search for alien treasures.Class: ScientistSkills: hackingWeapon of choice: alien blaster   More the 50 years have passed since the Quii mothership crash landed on Earth, completely destroying the environment, spreading radioactive pollution and alien DNA all over the planet. Now the Outback is crawling with radioactive mutants, alien creatures and even crossbreeds of terrestrial and alien DNA. You can also expect violent gangsters, that have no respect for the human life and squads of mutated humans.

 MOUNT MARYIt used to be small town by the road, but suffered heavy damage during the war. Expect packs of Atuu and ubiquitous radbits. NEW ANTHILL OF THE ROCKY OUTBACK:Mighty mads made tunnels in the rocks, some radbit’s holes were also reported here. ROCKY OUTBACKTypical landscape of the Outback, expect packs of radbits and probably some mads. OASISThis place might look like a piece of heaven comparing to the rest of the Outback. But trust us, this is very deceiving. Among other dangers here you can meet hundreds of cockatoos. Scavenger-cockatoos, beautiful and deadly. Kids like to come here to collect feathers. There are many blinded kids in a nearby town. ABANDONED HOUSEThis house is so damaged that we can only guess, what was its purpose before. This might look like a nice place for a rest. What bad can happen? THE BRIDGEThis Bridge is very important strategic point between territories of Dingo Gang and Mutants of the Balance. Sound’s like a lot of troubles, right? You wouldn’t go there, mate, would you?  Crazy Radbits Squad — is a union of wisdom of experienced Team Lead (11 years in Gamedev) and enthusiasm of young newbies. For some of us this is the first serious game project, but with help and support from Polygon and with wise guidance of our team lead we are more than ready to fulfill our goals. We visit additional courses, workshops, conferences, showcases and hackathons to gain experience and collect feedback. We fall asleep and we wake up with the name of Pinkpunk on our lips, we are incredibly determined to make a game that we all will be proud of, including you. “I always loved games, since my childhood. Fallout is one of the first games, which I hung out for hours. Then I dreamed to create 3D cartoons. I am a developer and I have been making games for 11 years, 5 years of which in Unity. All this time, one way or another I worked on game design. And by the chance, I got into my first game development company and I realised that it was my mission”“I have been working on games for 1,5 years. Most of all I like the genre of post-apocalypse, because it allows you to create an interesting and alternative world. We can review and even rewrite the history of places, things and peoples. We can tell people really cool stories. I associate myself with Koarra. She is independent, sarcastic and she can survive in “the world of men”“Since my childhood I’ve loved video games, collected consoles and games for them. So, I decided to realise my childhood dream in adulthood — to develop games and be a part of this industry. I’m crazy about Australia and hardcore, so my favourite hero is Pinkpunk”“My favourite fighter is an alien assassin, who isn’t in the game yet. He will be a really cool character, so I would like to play for him. I always dreamed to create virtual worlds. I looked for new opportunities and improved my skills. And now I just do what I really like — I create levels of the game for Outback”“Before joining this project I mainly worked on hard surface models and environment models. So, it’s my first project where I work on characters. I love it, because I can prove myself, there is much more creativity than in hard surfaces. Especially I like monsters. As for me, I would like to play for Koarra, she is the only woman character in our setting! Glory to female power!”“Our characters don’t have any prototypes — all ideas come to my mind. I have been creating concept for games only for 1,5 years, however I love games since my childhood. It can be said that I’m a fan of my job. And, of course, my favourite character is brutal and harsh Pinkpunk”“I’m working on arts, UI-prototypes and a few characters’ concepts. I also create comics for the game. I like hardcore of Outback, post apocalypse and realistic graphics. And it so amazing that I would like to travel to Australia and cross the desert by myself” Outback Defender came to life as a project at Polygon Game Lab. Polygon is an educational centre for gamedev and CG in Minsk, Belarus. It is a wonderful place where experienced professionals share their knowledge and skills with aspiring artists and developers. Polygon Game Lab is a place where creators can meet, form teams and initiate projects, best projects receive mentorship and support to reach a particular milestone. Outback defender happens to be the first project of PGL to reach its goal.Within the last six months we have proven to be a wonderful team. Now we are Crazy Radbits Squad - a young studio, that is willing to write our name in history of gamedev with blood, sweat and tears.We are raising money on Indiegogo to deliver the first chapter of the game. It will have up to 10 levels, with all our ideas implemented. With your help we will create assets we can use to expand the game, adding more chapters on a regular basis. We hope to achieve this within 3 months after the end of the campaign. The funds will be used to support our team for the 3 months period. Polygon is providing us with office space and hardware, and as graduates of PGL we were presented with licenses for all necessary software.

story:
About

Mountain bike (MTB) is a technically challenging and dynamic sport. Unlike cycling disciplines, where endurance, strength and a few tactics ensure successful riding, MTB requires serious controlling skills, good reaction speed, quick trail reading and trajectory selection skills. All this makes the MTB an ideal subject for creating a simulation computer game. But if you try to look for such simulators, you will not find any. There are several games dedicated to MTB, but they are very far from what the real MTB is in terms of physics, control, and the structure of the tracks.

The aim of this project is to create a simulation game that implements a physically accurate (to the extent that it affects our perception) modeling of the rider-bike-environment system. The environment will be represented by three bike parks with various MTB trails of different type and difficulty. You will be able to ride at least five different bikes on challenging terrain and tune them.

The game will attract all those who are passionate about mountain biking, as they will enjoy playing when they can’t go outside to the mountains. The simulator will allow you to engage in your favorite activity in winter, in the rain or during the injury rehabilitation period. For those ones who follow the rule “no dig no ride” this project provides a unique chance! Pledging from 25 euros you will get not only the game but also the trail editor, where you can verify all your ideas in virtual environment before you bring them to the real trails! For those players who like racing games the MTB Game offers a completely new kind of virtual racing experience.

The project description is structured according to the following plan:

  • Demo version
  • Content editors
  • Gameplay
  • Physics and control
  • Graphics
  • Sound
  • Virtual reality
  • Basic and stretch goals
  • Perks
  • Where will the money go?
  • Why IndieGoGo?
  • Risks
  • About me

Demo version

I have developed MTB simulator for a while as a free time solo project. The result is the first working prototype - MTB Game Demo, running on Windows OS. The demo version presents the MTB school, which includes nine learning trails, providing training in passing flat corners, berms, bumps, riding bridges, jumping drops and kickers.

The demo version can be downloaded from the game website. This version presents a simplified mathematical bike-rider model, which has several limitations. The video below shows the fragments of riding along the MTB school trails (from easy to difficult):

The automatic balance control system is the only automatic assistant in the demo version. It controls the muscles of the rider’s arms to turn the handlebar at the required speed in the direction of the fall. This is not enough to fully control the bike (see the Physics and Control Section), but since the MTB school’s trails have a relatively simple terrain, it is possible to go through all of them if you have a joystick. The video below reveals some details of installation, controls, gameplay and settings in the demo version:

In addition to the simulator mode, a mode with arcade physics is included in the demo version of the game, which greatly simplifies control and allows you to pass school lessons without a joystick:

 

Content editors

To make possible content creation for the game I have developed several auxiliary programs for internal use. The main two are the Bike Editor and the Map Editor.

The Bike Editor allows you to assemble a bike from various parts, define the connections of these parts, and determine their physical parameters. Also, you can check whether the parts of the bike interact correctly with each other:

The Map Editor is a program for creating bike parks. It allows you to lay tracks. For tracks, you can edit the width, slope, profile, add holes, bumps and dirt kickers. In addition to tracks, the editor allows you to spread stones, trees and roots on the map. Roots can also be generated automatically. Wooden bridges of various shapes and sizes can also be built using the editor:

The work on The Map Editor is not finished and I am going to add the following functions:

  1. Placement of arbitrary objects defined by 3D models.
  2. Automatic generation of brake bumps, ruts and protruding faces of stones.
  3. Setting the typical MTB dirt constructions parametrically, rather than manipulating the points of the trail manually.

Gameplay

1. Basic Game Modes

Basic game modes are modes that will be implemented even in case of minimum amount of raised funds.

1.1. School mode. Demo version shows an example of this mode. The player will consistently go through nine lessons, honing important skills in overcoming a certain type of obstacles. The school mode is an obligatory stage on the way to the following modes. At the start, the player does not have his own bike: a learning bike that is most suitable for the lesson objectives will be provided. According to the results of each lesson, the player will get an A, B or C mark, depending on the tasks completed. At the end, a certificate and an in-game cash reward are issued. The player can spend this reward on his first bike to ride in the following modes.

1.2. Mission Mode is the main game mode. It consists of passing tracks in bike parks. Three different bike parks will be implemented with ten tracks of different complexity (green, blue, black, double black, pro) in each. As a result of passing each track, the player will receive a bronze, silver or gold medal and the in-game cash reward. The time of passing each track will be saved in the online table of records, so it will be possible to compete with people around the world. The in-game cash reward can be used to buy new bikes or upgrade existing ones.

1.3. Free Play Mode After all the missions of one park are completed with bronze, silver or gold medals, the park becomes available for free playing. The player will be able to place his bike anywhere in the park (both on the track and off-track) using the locator map. In addition to the missions’ routes, the parks will contain connection roads joining tracks into a single network, as well as certain challenging zones. Such zones can be pump tracks, dirt lines or a series of drops of different sizes.

2. Additional Modes

If the project funding exceeds the established minimum (see Section “Basic and Stretch Goals”), additional modes will be implemented:

2.1. The Replay Video View Mode. This mode allows you to view the results of races completed and saved earlier. When viewing races, it will be possible to change the cameras and control them in an arbitrary manner; a stationary tracking camera will also be available.

2.2. Enduro Mode. This mode presents a passage of three/four downhill stages linked by connection roads in free play bike parks. In this mode, the players will compete for the total time of all downhill stages. The time will be entered in online record tables.

2.3. Contactless Multiplayer. In this mode, you can compete with other people on the tracks. In this case, rivals will be visible, but contacts with them will not be processed.

3. Bikes

The game will provide an opportunity to select and upgrade bikes for the in-game money received as a result of passing the school and missions. The number of bikes that will be available in the game is not determined. The minimum number of bikes is five, one for each discipline of MTB: downhill, enduro, trail, cross-country, street/dirt.

The following bike parts will be replaceable: fork, rear shock, tires, spring in the fork, spring in the rear shock absorber. New parts will also be available for in-game money.

The bike can be tuned. The number of settings will depend on the installed fork and rear shock absorber. The general list of things to be adjusted: the pressure in the air chamber, low and high-speed compression and rebound in the fork and rear shock absorber, tire pressure.

4. Riders

Right now there is only one rider in the game. There is no time to implement function of a rider customization with different clothes or protection gear during the project. But if the project budget will allow to delegate part of the responsibilities to other people, then some customization will be available. One of the possible rewards for backers is creating their own design of a rider.

Physics and Control

The environment and simplified bike-rider mathematical models are ready and debugged in the demo version of the game. They allow you to implement all the settings of the suspension and bicycle tires. This simplified bike-rider mathematical model does not contain all required degrees of freedom, so it will be amplified to full bike-rider mathematical model by adding missing degrees of freedom.

Following videos show some physical aspects of the simulator. Here you can see how suspension settings affect the behavior of a bike:

The next video demonstrates the influence of aerodynamics on bike behavior:

Work on control is the most important and time-consuming part of this project. The complexity of the implementation of control is the main reason for the lack of MTB simulators up to the present. The fact is that to control the bike you need to control a couple dozen bones of the rider with more than five dozen muscles. If you compare this with a car simulator that is controlled by a steering wheel, three pedals and a gear shift knob, the difference becomes obvious. In a car, the driver’s movement through the cabin can be neglected, but on a bike every movement is important, every degree of freedom of the skeleton (except, perhaps, for individual fingers and facial muscles) affects control. Another problem is that the bike does not have static stability, so even to go straight you need a coordinated work of many muscles. That is why in order to create a bicycle simulator, it is necessary to develop a layer of artificial neural networks that allow the player’s high-level commands to be translated into the work of the rider's muscles.

In the demo version, this layer is represented by a system of maintaining balance in motion, which is the necessary minimum for controlling a bike. The following video is about the work of this system:

The system of maintaining balance in motion is not enough for reliable control of the bike. During the project, at least two more automatic systems will be developed - a weight distribution system and a rough terrain processing system.

The weight distribution system will automatically distribute the rider's weight between the grips and the pedals by controlling the tension of the muscles and shifting the rider’s body. This will increase the stability of the bike when cornering, increase the accuracy of holding the required angle of inclination and allow the rider to keep his balance at low and zero speeds.

The rough terrain processing system will be responsible for the relaxation and tension of the muscles in order to compensate for the rapid impacts of the terrain. If slow impacts such as hitting a kicker or pumping a smooth bump can be processed directly by the player, then processing of rough and rapid impacts should fall on the shoulders of the automatic system. This will improve the stability of the bike on the tracks with many holes, roots, stones and brake bumps. Accordingly, it will be possible to add more obstacles of this kind to the tracks. In the demo version, the rough terrain is almost absent since such a terrain cannot yet be processed by the rider.

Graphics

At the current stage of the project the graphics is not the most important component, and the quantity and quality of improvements in this direction will be determined by the remaining time for the project. However, there are several things that I plan to do:

1. Grass display will be enhanced. In the MTB Game Demo, each blade of grass is represented by a separate geometry, which causes a few performance and aliasing issues. It is possible instead to display grass with textured geometry blocks, and the size of the blocks will vary depending on the distance to the observer. It will solve performance and aliasing problems. Using textures of different grass types will also increase the visual diversity.

2. The visual appearance of trails will be improved. In the MTB Game Demo, trails are represented by regular tiled textures, which often create noticeable repetitive patterns. To avoid this, mixing different types of textures for the center and edges of the trails, as well as textures that add additional random details, could be used.

3. Forest textures will be added to represent far forests: that will improve the background quality.

4. Each bike park in the game will contain its own unique set of tree types, roots, rocks and trail surfaces.

5. There will be a general optimization of the rendering process, which will ensure the highest possible performance. This is especially important for the implementation of a virtual reality mode.

Images below shows what graphics exists at the current moment:

Sound

The sound system in the game supports all the necessary types of sounds that bike can produce. At the moment there are no sound files representing the set of sounds. In the MTB Game Demo, all the variety of sounds is represented by a few simple sounds recorded on a smartphone at home. I am going to purchase the necessary recording equipment to record high quality real bike sounds.

Virtual Reality

Mountain bike simulator is an application where virtual reality fits perfectly. This applies both to a more complete perception of the tracks with their surface in stereo mode, and to the control that can be implemented with the help of virtual reality controllers very similar to the actual control of the bike. The diagram shows how to control a bike using VR controllers:

If there are no VR controllers, the standard joystick controls can be used. The demo version of MTB Game Demo does not support virtual reality, but to get an idea of how the game will look like in this mode, video tracks in VR 180 3D format were rendered.

Video fragments from the external camera (00:00-04:22 - simulator mode, 04:22-08:17 - arcade mode):

Download with larger bitrate

Video fragments from the helmet camera (00:00-05:37 - simulator mode, 05:37-09:20 - arcade mode):

Download with larger bitrate

Basic and Stretch Goals

This section contains the main project implementation tasks described earlier. The implementation of certain tasks depends on the funding. Each task has an approximate intensity estimate in man-hours (mh). The date by which the scheduled tasks will be completed - September 1, 2020

Perks

“Visible object” - by choosing this perk you add one object to the maximum number of objects that can be simultaneously seen by the player. The more objects seen in the frame, the more detailed and interesting the scene will be. By this perk, you will help the developer and raise the bar for scenes quality.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Thank you letter” - You receive by email a decorated personalized letter about your pledging with thanks signed by the developer.

Delivery date: September 1, 2019

“Nameplate” – In the game, a sign with your name will be attached to a tree. Information on how to find this sign will be sent to your email address.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Game” - Steam key for MTB Game.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Bike editor” - instructions and a set of tools needed to create and add your own bikes to the game. Free distribution of instructions and tools for creating bikes is not planned in the near future, so pledging is the only way to get them.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Map editor” - editor for creating your own bike parks and instructions to it. Free distribution of the bike park editor is not planned in the near future, so pledging is the only way to get it.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Name in credits” - your name will appear in the list of thanks in the Credits menu in the game.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“The sign” - your text or image on the sign near one of the tracks of parks, size up to 0.5 meters on the long side.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“The banner” - your text or image on the banner up to 1 meter high, stretched for 3-5 meters along the track.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Big feature banner” - your banner with text or image up to 3 meters on the long side, placed on a big jump, drop or landing.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Course name” - you can come up with a name for the track. The number of rewards is limited to the 30.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Investor status” - your name in the investors list in Credits menu in game.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Bike color scheme” - You can create your own color scheme and labels for one of the game bikes. The number of rewards is limited to 5.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Your bike in game” - the reward can be interesting to those who produce their own bikes or want to do it. You can add to the game the bike that you developed yourself. There may be certain restrictions that will be negotiated with the developer individually. The maximum number of rewards is limited to 16.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

“Become a rider” - you or a character you create can be one of the riders available to choose from in the game. The maximum number of rewards is limited to 6.

Delivery date: September 1, 2020

What will the Money Go?

Money is necessary for the author to focus exclusively on this project, and not on finding other sources of income. Some money will pay for the necessary equipment to create high-quality content. It will also help to cover the cost of software and some 3D assets that I do not have time to do myself.

If the project will reach its minimum funding goal of 32000 EUR, the expenditure chart will look like this:

Equipment required:

  • Digital camera to capture textures.
  • Audio recording equipment to capture sounds for the game.
  • A set of control devices to test and set them up within the game.
  • A PC or laptop with AMD CPU and GPU to test and optimize the game for this hardware.

If funding exceeds 42000 EUR, additional funds will be spent on a VR headset, VR controllers and a MacBook to debug and optimize the Mac OS version of the game.

Further additional funding will allow to hire professional 3D artists to create and texture models for the game. The author's time freed in this case will be used to develop additional modes and game details described in section “Basic and Stretch Goals”.

Why IndieGoGo?

MTB Game project now is at the point when the first finish line is visible, but it is still not as close as I want it to be. A lot of work has been done, and more needs to be done. Careful analysis shows that I need 14 months of full time work to complete the project. Unfortunately, I cannot work on this project full time, as I need to cover my living expenses. Working 1-2 hours a day instead of desirable 8-10 slows down the process. Successful IndieGoGo campaign will help me to discard all other concerns and focus exclusively on the project. It will be a great motivation to work harder and release a high quality unique game if the IndieGoGo shows that there are lots of people interested in the project! It is always exciting to know that something you do is important to many other people. I strongly hope that IndieGoGo campaign will attract people willing to create their own bikes and trails to extend game experience. IndieGoGo is also a way for you to say what you expect from the game, share your ideas about the game, help me to make this project better.

Risks

Most of the necessary tools, and most of the game code is ready for the moment. As a result, the work on the project mainly includes routine operations of programming the interface and mechanics of modes, as well as the creation of a small number of 3D models.

This work is trivial, predictable and contains almost no risks. The most difficult and unpredictable part of the project is creating of automatic assistance systems to control the bike. A sufficiently large amount of time has been allocated for this task; nevertheless, it cannot be guaranteed that the desired result will be achieved. But even if problems arise with certain points of automatic assistants, the game will be released on time and the control will improve in updates.

Another task that is difficult to predict in time is porting the game to Mac OS and Linux operating systems. Even though when working exclusively cross-platform libraries are used, and the project code itself is also a cross-platform, there may be certain problems related to the peculiarity of functioning of various operating systems. As a rule, such problems are easily fixed, but it’s almost impossible to predict them in advance.

About me

My name is Kamaev Aleksandr. In 2012 I received a master degree and in 2014 a PhD degree in Computer Science (Institute for System Dynamics and Control Theory of Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Irkutsk, Russia). I have been working on the computer vision systems of autonomous underwater vehicles and also generated virtual underwater environments for testing and debugging the computer vision algorithms.

I discovered mountain biking about five years ago and since then it became my passion. MTB fulfills my need for adventure and allows me to feel more connected to nature and the world around me.

I always wanted to combine two of my favorite activities: creating software systems and mountain biking to make a mountain bike simulator.

Presently, I live in Munich, Germany, and I continue to develop the MTB simulator, but I don’t have enough funds to accomplish my work. That’s why I’m asking for your support. Please help me to bring you the first MTB simulator!

BikesThe game will provide an opportunity to select and upgrade bikes for the in-game money received as a result of passing the school and missions. The number of bikes that will be available in the game is not determined. The minimum number of bikes is five, one for each discipline of MTB: downhill, enduro, trail, cross-country, street/dirt.The following bike parts will be replaceable: fork, rear shock, tires, spring in the fork, spring in the rear shock absorber. New parts will also be available for in-game money.The bike can be tuned. The number of settings will depend on the installed fork and rear shock absorber. The general list of things to be adjusted: the pressure in the air chamber, low and high-speed compression and rebound in the fork and rear shock absorber, tire pressure.4. RidersRight now there is only one rider in the game. There is no time to implement function of a rider customization with different clothes or protection gear during the project. But if the project budget will allow to delegate part of the responsibilities to other people, then some customization will be available. One of the possible rewards for backers is creating their own design of a rider.Physics and ControlThe environment and simplified bike-rider mathematical models are ready and debugged in the demo version of the game. They allow you to implement all the settings of the suspension and bicycle tires. This simplified bike-rider mathematical model does not contain all required degrees of freedom, so it will be amplified to full bike-rider mathematical model by adding missing degrees of freedom.Following videos show some physical aspects of the simulator. Here you can see how suspension settings affect the behavior of a bike:The next video demonstrates the influence of aerodynamics on bike behavior:Work on control is the most important and time-consuming part of this project. The complexity of the implementation of control is the main reason for the lack of MTB simulators up to the present. The fact is that to control the bike you need to control a couple dozen bones of the rider with more than five dozen muscles. If you compare this with a car simulator that is controlled by a steering wheel, three pedals and a gear shift knob, the difference becomes obvious. In a car, the driver’s movement through the cabin can be neglected, but on a bike every movement is important, every degree of freedom of the skeleton (except, perhaps, for individual fingers and facial muscles) affects control. Another problem is that the bike does not have static stability, so even to go straight you need a coordinated work of many muscles. That is why in order to create a bicycle simulator, it is necessary to develop a layer of artificial neural networks that allow the player’s high-level commands to be translated into the work of the rider's muscles.In the demo version, this layer is represented by a system of maintaining balance in motion, which is the necessary minimum for controlling a bike. The following video is about the work of this system:The system of maintaining balance in motion is not enough for reliable control of the bike. During the project, at least two more automatic systems will be developed - a weight distribution system and a rough terrain processing system.The weight distribution system will automatically distribute the rider's weight between the grips and the pedals by controlling the tension of the muscles and shifting the rider’s body. This will increase the stability of the bike when cornering, increase the accuracy of holding the required angle of inclination and allow the rider to keep his balance at low and zero speeds.The rough terrain processing system will be responsible for the relaxation and tension of the muscles in order to compensate for the rapid impacts of the terrain. If slow impacts such as hitting a kicker or pumping a smooth bump can be processed directly by the player, then processing of rough and rapid impacts should fall on the shoulders of the automatic system. This will improve the stability of the bike on the tracks with many holes, roots, stones and brake bumps. Accordingly, it will be possible to add more obstacles of this kind to the tracks. In the demo version, the rough terrain is almost absent since such a terrain cannot yet be processed by the rider.GraphicsAt the current stage of the project the graphics is not the most important component, and the quantity and quality of improvements in this direction will be determined by the remaining time for the project. However, there are several things that I plan to do:1. Grass display will be enhanced. In the MTB Game Demo, each blade of grass is represented by a separate geometry, which causes a few performance and aliasing issues. It is possible instead to display grass with textured geometry blocks, and the size of the blocks will vary depending on the distance to the observer. It will solve performance and aliasing problems. Using textures of different grass types will also increase the visual diversity.2. The visual appearance of trails will be improved. In the MTB Game Demo, trails are represented by regular tiled textures, which often create noticeable repetitive patterns. To avoid this, mixing different types of textures for the center and edges of the trails, as well as textures that add additional random details, could be used.3. Forest textures will be added to represent far forests: that will improve the background quality.4. Each bike park in the game will contain its own unique set of tree types, roots, rocks and trail surfaces.5. There will be a general optimization of the rendering process, which will ensure the highest possible performance. This is especially important for the implementation of a virtual reality mode.Images below shows what graphics exists at the current moment:SoundThe sound system in the game supports all the necessary types of sounds that bike can produce. At the moment there are no sound files representing the set of sounds. In the MTB Game Demo, all the variety of sounds is represented by a few simple sounds recorded on a smartphone at home. I am going to purchase the necessary recording equipment to record high quality real bike sounds.Virtual RealityMountain bike simulator is an application where virtual reality fits perfectly. This applies both to a more complete perception of the tracks with their surface in stereo mode, and to the control that can be implemented with the help of virtual reality controllers very similar to the actual control of the bike. The diagram shows how to control a bike using VR controllers:If there are no VR controllers, the standard joystick controls can be used. The demo version of MTB Game Demo does not support virtual reality, but to get an idea of how the game will look like in this mode, video tracks in VR 180 3D format were rendered.Video fragments from the external camera (00:00-04:22 - simulator mode, 04:22-08:17 - arcade mode):Download with larger bitrateVideo fragments from the helmet camera (00:00-05:37 - simulator mode, 05:37-09:20 - arcade mode):Download with larger bitrateBasic and Stretch GoalsThis section contains the main project implementation tasks described earlier. The implementation of certain tasks depends on the funding. Each task has an approximate intensity estimate in man-hours (mh). The date by which the scheduled tasks will be completed - September 1, 2020Perks“Visible object” - by choosing this perk you add one object to the maximum number of objects that can be simultaneously seen by the player. The more objects seen in the frame, the more detailed and interesting the scene will be. By this perk, you will help the developer and raise the bar for scenes quality.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Thank you letter” - You receive by email a decorated personalized letter about your pledging with thanks signed by the developer.Delivery date: September 1, 2019“Nameplate” – In the game, a sign with your name will be attached to a tree. Information on how to find this sign will be sent to your email address.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Game” - Steam key for MTB Game.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Bike editor” - instructions and a set of tools needed to create and add your own bikes to the game. Free distribution of instructions and tools for creating bikes is not planned in the near future, so pledging is the only way to get them.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Map editor” - editor for creating your own bike parks and instructions to it. Free distribution of the bike park editor is not planned in the near future, so pledging is the only way to get it.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Name in credits” - your name will appear in the list of thanks in the Credits menu in the game.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“The sign” - your text or image on the sign near one of the tracks of parks, size up to 0.5 meters on the long side.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“The banner” - your text or image on the banner up to 1 meter high, stretched for 3-5 meters along the track.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Big feature banner” - your banner with text or image up to 3 meters on the long side, placed on a big jump, drop or landing.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Course name” - you can come up with a name for the track. The number of rewards is limited to the 30.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Investor status” - your name in the investors list in Credits menu in game.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Bike color scheme” - You can create your own color scheme and labels for one of the game bikes. The number of rewards is limited to 5.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Your bike in game” - the reward can be interesting to those who produce their own bikes or want to do it. You can add to the game the bike that you developed yourself. There may be certain restrictions that will be negotiated with the developer individually. The maximum number of rewards is limited to 16.Delivery date: September 1, 2020“Become a rider” - you or a character you create can be one of the riders available to choose from in the game. The maximum number of rewards is limited to 6.Delivery date: September 1, 2020What will the Money Go?Money is necessary for the author to focus exclusively on this project, and not on finding other sources of income. Some money will pay for the necessary equipment to create high-quality content. It will also help to cover the cost of software and some 3D assets that I do not have time to do myself.If the project will reach its minimum funding goal of 32000 EUR, the expenditure chart will look like this:Equipment required:
Digital camera to capture textures.
Audio recording equipment to capture sounds for the game.
A set of control devices to test and set them up within the game.
A PC or laptop with AMD CPU and GPU to test and optimize the game for this hardware.
If funding exceeds 42000 EUR, additional funds will be spent on a VR headset, VR controllers and a MacBook to debug and optimize the Mac OS version of the game.Further additional funding will allow to hire professional 3D artists to create and texture models for the game. The author's time freed in this case will be used to develop additional modes and game details described in section “Basic and Stretch Goals”.Why IndieGoGo?MTB Game project now is at the point when the first finish line is visible, but it is still not as close as I want it to be. A lot of work has been done, and more needs to be done. Careful analysis shows that I need 14 months of full time work to complete the project. Unfortunately, I cannot work on this project full time, as I need to cover my living expenses. Working 1-2 hours a day instead of desirable 8-10 slows down the process. Successful IndieGoGo campaign will help me to discard all other concerns and focus exclusively on the project. It will be a great motivation to work harder and release a high quality unique game if the IndieGoGo shows that there are lots of people interested in the project! It is always exciting to know that something you do is important to many other people. I strongly hope that IndieGoGo campaign will attract people willing to create their own bikes and trails to extend game experience. IndieGoGo is also a way for you to say what you expect from the game, share your ideas about the game, help me to make this project better.RisksMost of the necessary tools, and most of the game code is ready for the moment. As a result, the work on the project mainly includes routine operations of programming the interface and mechanics of modes, as well as the creation of a small number of 3D models.This work is trivial, predictable and contains almost no risks. The most difficult and unpredictable part of the project is creating of automatic assistance systems to control the bike. A sufficiently large amount of time has been allocated for this task; nevertheless, it cannot be guaranteed that the desired result will be achieved. But even if problems arise with certain points of automatic assistants, the game will be released on time and the control will improve in updates.Another task that is difficult to predict in time is porting the game to Mac OS and Linux operating systems. Even though when working exclusively cross-platform libraries are used, and the project code itself is also a cross-platform, there may be certain problems related to the peculiarity of functioning of various operating systems. As a rule, such problems are easily fixed, but it’s almost impossible to predict them in advance.About meMy name is Kamaev Aleksandr. In 2012 I received a master degree and in 2014 a PhD degree in Computer Science (Institute for System Dynamics and Control Theory of Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Irkutsk, Russia). I have been working on the computer vision systems of autonomous underwater vehicles and also generated virtual underwater environments for testing and debugging the computer vision algorithms.I discovered mountain biking about five years ago and since then it became my passion. MTB fulfills my need for adventure and allows me to feel more connected to nature and the world around me.I always wanted to combine two of my favorite activities: creating software systems and mountain biking to make a mountain bike simulator.Presently, I live in Munich, Germany, and I continue to develop the MTB simulator, but I don’t have enough funds to accomplish my work. That’s why I’m asking for your support. Please help me to bring you the first MTB simulator!

story:
Alpha Turbo Games is a small company with big goals. Inspired by tales of the Paranormal, the Supernatural and the Unexplained, we want to bring you a fine selection of original board games that will explore the myths and legends of mankind. Are you in?
  We bring a great deal to the game table. Fun, adventure, plenty of laughs and some very interesting perks. How would you like to be the first to capture a live Sasquatch?

story:
VS Zombies, The Card Game

By Dragon Scale Design

Dragon Scale Design proudly presents VS Zombies, where players can either fight in the apocalypse as humans, or as zombies! Fast paced card game with simple mechanics to learn, but difficult to master. In the game players fight against other players and their groups of humans or zombies, stealing their loot points and taking over the city. The one with the most points and city locations takes over the city! 

* Graphics presented in these pictures may vary in the final product.

Game overview

In the game, players pick either a group of humans or group of zombies to play with, and uses the deck that each side has. The goal of the game is to gain loot points from looting the city, and killing other characters. One with the most points at the end of the game wins.
Event cards:


The game uses 5 decks: 
  1. Events deck for locations and surprise effects 
  2. Humans deck for human players to draw new characters
  3. Zombies deck for zombie players to draw new characters
  4. Items deck for human players to use
  5. Ill Fortune for zombie players to use.
Human and Zombie cards:


Both Items and Ill Fortune decks have 3 different types of cards:
  • Offensive cards
  • Defensive cards
  • Effect cards.
Humans use all kinds of item cards, from offensive cards like shotgun and scissors, to defensive cards like riot shields and bar stools. Sometimes effect cards like smoke grenade might save your group. Item deck is balanced between all sorts of cards to give you some tactical 
Zombies on the other hand use cinematic effects, from zombies being Angry, On Fire, Mutated and so on. Zombie players have mostly effect cards, meaning that zombie players can make the game go awfully funky and strange, with cards like Divine Intervention, Kill of the Week, Out of Ammo and Unstoppable force.

Items and Ill Fortune cards:


You will receive in the box:

  • Rulebook
  • Quick rules sheets
  • 25 Zombie cards
  • 25 Human cards
  • 50 Items cards
  • 50 Ill Fortune cards
  • 50 Event cards
  • 6 Custom engraved attack/defend dice and 2 regular dice made of compressed resin.
  • Approximately 50 Health and 50 loot tokens.

You can download the English prototype rulebook from here. Version of the prototype will be updated during the campaign, so for now it is a text-only version.
Finnish version of the prototype rulebook is available here. Illustrated version is coming soon!

Our main goal is 11,000 euros, which goes into funding the production costs of the game. With the minimum amount funded, we can work decent hours with the game, and deliver it approximately May 2015. Delivery may vary with the production time. You will also get the game cheaper now than from retail later!

As this is our first project, it is very important to us to make the project successful. But due to our very limited time and resources, we can only do so much. That is why we need your help to fund VS Zombies, and bring it to everyone to enjoy! We enjoy playing games, and we enjoy making games, and the best thing is to see everyone enjoy games we make.

*Update!* We have contacted a graphic illustrator to work with us, and part of the funds goes into making game look better. With this exciting new development, we can't wait to see how awesome the game will look like!

Please note, that due to Finnish Law, we cannot receive any funds without giving anything back, so please choose a perk.

We won't have many stretch goals, because all the game parts are in it already. We won't take anything out to add it later on. But with additional funds we can invest a lot more time working with the game, and make it better for you.



All additional funds after 20,000 euros will go into making VS Zombies a better quality game, and anything more we manage to create within the timelimit will be added into the game. 


    Risks & Challenges

    The greatest risk we have making this game into reality is not getting funded. It can be prevented by you funding this campaign. But there are also other risks that you might also want to know:

    • We have very limited resources ourselves to work on this game full time. Our main game designer Pekka is also creating all 3d based graphics by himself, so it takes time to complete all graphics. If the game gets funded, all additional funds helps us to work more on the game. If the first stretch goal is reached, we can work full-time on this game.
    • We are negotiating with different companies about manufacturing the game, and we are not going to settle for quality we would not like as gamers ourselves. We got very good recommendations from other Finnish game producers, so we are following their advice.
    • Another risk we see, is not getting a lot of attention. Like previously mentioned about our limited resources, we cannot afford any advertising. We are trying to spread the word here in Finland by going from place to place, promoting our game wherever we can. But we would appreciate it a lot, if anyone viewing this campaign would share it in social media, tell a friend and spread the word.

    About Dragon Scale Design

    DSD is a small company located in Nummela, Finland. It is run by one man(for now) with large support group of friends and family. DSD does 3d modeling, 3d animation, game design and all sorts of other gaming related stuff. Founded 1st of January 2014, DSD aims to create fun games for everyone, with emphasis on card- and boardgames.

We have very limited resources ourselves to work on this game full time. Our main game designer Pekka is also creating all 3d based graphics by himself, so it takes time to complete all graphics. We are trying to spread the word here in Finland by going from place to place, promoting our game wherever we can. But we would appreciate it a lot, if anyone viewing this campaign would share it in social media, tell a friend and spread the word.

About Dragon Scale Design

DSD is a small company located in Nummela, Finland. It is run by one man(for now) with large support group of friends and family. DSD does 3d modeling, 3d animation, game design and all sorts of other gaming related stuff. Founded 1st of January 2014, DSD aims to create fun games for everyone, with emphasis on card- and boardgames.

story: This is a draft campaign.
story_txt: This is a draft campaign.

story:
In the Beginning...

MTG Cardsmith started as a simple way to make custom Magic cards online. Since 2011, it has steadily grown; featuring 5 different card generators, member accounts, forums and custom card favorites. Our small team working nights and weekends on the site can only accomplish so much, and the community deserves much more. We're seeking pledges to help us get a design that matches the growing size and community of the site and assist in funding the development of new, exciting features.


What We Need & Why

We're seeking $9,000 in funds to split across the following three major areas:

  • Find a designer to assist with a new site design and style guide, to build a responsive layout that will play nice on mobile devices, and give MTG Cardsmith a more professional look. This will require the majority of the funds.
  • Finish development on Custom Sets per account, no more multiple accounts necessary to organize your cards. Funds will be used to pay for more development hours so we can launch this feature quickly. If funded, expected delivery: Summer 2015.
  • Purchase an upgraded web server and additional hosting. This will allow us to focus our energy on the areas above, and allow for greater system stability for all members and guests.


Rewards For Backers

All backers will receive a unique MTG Cardsmith profile campaign badge, showing that you supported us from the (new) start!
Features Unbound
Along with the launch of the new design, we will be revealing new premium account features. As a backer, you will be the first group of members to experience these powerful new tools in your membership. Our launch list includes the following:
  • Clean Browsing (no ads!)
  • Custom Set Icon for use on your cards (upload and stored)
  • Card limit increased to 2000 custom cards
Whims of the Fates
Also, select rewards will give you the chance to determine a bit of our fate, by letting you choose what set icon gets added, or a featured card you really want others to see (or choose a friend's!).

Inner Calm, Outer Strength
At the $60 (early-bird) and above pledge, backers will receive a Limited Edition MTG Cardsmith playmat*, designed by talented artist, Chase Velarde.

Final playmat will also feature the MTG Cardsmith logo.

(*Expected delivery by Fall 2015. Additional International shipping charges will apply to addresses outside the US.)

The Greathearted
Pledge tiers above $100 get additional duration for premium features, early-access preview of the new design, and some amazing off-the-wall perks and opportunities.

Your Impact

With your donation, we are one step closer in delivering the absolute best online MTG card generator available. A new design will greatly improve the site's standing in the Magic community and be reflected within each member's account. Our ultimate goal is to have the site be completely self-sustaining financially, and if we can make improvements in the areas above, we are well on our way. Personally, this has been the result of hundreds of hours of work. I love what the site and the community have become - and I want to see it continue to flourish.


Risks & Challenges

Unfunded: If we are unable to raise the total goal, this campaign will have failed, and we will not receive any proceeds. In that case, we will do our best to continue bootstrapping the project. Ultimately this means slower turn around on new features, cutting out some of the more challenging features, and a much longer time-span on delivering a new site design.

Funded: Now the real work begins! Our first priority is going to be wrapping up and releasing Custom Sets for all members.

Simultaneously, we need to find a designer and begin scoping the new design. Risks involve finding the right person/team in the correct amount of time, and hiring someone who will follow through on the work. Then we need to take all of those assets and re-wrap the site's existing code and card-generators with the new face. We are estimating this process to take months, but hope to have everything ready to launch (including new features) by the end of 2015 / early 2016. Challenges will be finding the time to do so, and may involve hiring additional help to hit each milestone.

Shipping the playmats comes with its own set of risks, including production time, final artwork, and shipping costs. We've done the best we can to prepare for these things ahead of time, but realize there are other factors out of our control.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to pledging any amount, you can really help us spread the word about the campaign, to find as many backers as possible. Use the sharing tools to send this campaign to other magic players or card creators you know - help get the word out on Twitter, Facebook, and Reddit. 

Thank you for your support, we could never have made it this far without our growing community of Magic players and custom card makers. We look forward to delivering the next tier of custom card generators!


Disclaimer: MTG Cardsmith is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Magic: The Gathering™ or Wizards of the Coast. Magic: the Gathering is trademark and copyright Wizards of the Coast, Inc., a subsidiary of Hasbro, Inc. All rights reserved.

We are estimating this process to take months, but hope to have everything ready to launch (including new features) by the end of 2015 / early 2016. Challenges will be finding the time to do so, and may involve hiring additional help to hit each milestone. 
Shipping the playmats comes with its own set of risks, including production time, final artwork, and shipping costs. We've done the best we can to prepare for these things ahead of time, but realize there are other factors out of our control.

    Other Ways You Can Help In addition to pledging any amount, you can really help us spread the word about the campaign, to find as many backers as possible. Use the sharing tools to send this campaign to other magic players or card creators you know - help get the word out on Twitter, Facebook, and Reddit. 
Thank you for your support, we could never have made it this far without our growing community of Magic players and custom card makers. We look forward to delivering the next tier of custom card generators!

Disclaimer: MTG Cardsmith is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Magic: The 
Gathering™ or Wizards of the Coast. Magic: the Gathering is trademark 
and copyright Wizards of the Coast, Inc., a subsidiary of Hasbro, Inc. 
All rights reserved.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Are you a maker? then DIY

Artificial Life USB 

  • Speed control
  • Manually step through generations
  • Tour & Plane Modes
  • USB Powered
  • Pause/Resume
  • Compact size

Controls

  • Encoder Push: Puse/Resume evolution
  • Encoder Rotate:
    • Speed Control (when running)
    • Step one generation (when paused)
  • Reset button: Generate new random Universe 

Controls shown here.

What's left to do?

We started the campaign because we need enough money for the first production run of Artificial Life USB. If we don't do a big enough production run the devices would be way too expensive. All the design is done, we just need some testing of the final boards before going into production.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our project please spread the word about Artificial Life USB. An open source hardware project by MontoyaLabs.

Thanks for helping us meet our goal.

 

Shipping

All perks include international shipping. All perks are shipped from Mexico. Here are the estimated delivery times:

North America: 10-25 Days

Rest of the world: 15-30 Days

If you need FAST shipping please add $30 for North America and $45 for the rest of the world.

story:
The Problem

It is impossible to game on a touchscreen device without taking your eyes off the action to check finger position. There is no physical reference on the smooth flat surface. All it takes is a split second of distraction to get the following results:

  • Thousands of racers die in flaming crashes by the hour!
  • Countless zombie infestations overrun the world daily!
  • Untold number of warriors lost on the battle field minute by minute!
  • An ever increasing number of gamers are going hoarse from screaming: Nooooooo!

The Solution: The Contact Patch

  • The variety of the shapes and sizes allows you to customize the layout for any and every game you own.
  • There are a total of sixteen Contact Patches in each box. More than enough for even the most complex controls.
  • Largest Circle has a nib in the middle to act as center for joystick games.
  • Transparent design allows you to enjoy the visuals of the game without interfering with the view.
  • Contact Patches have a natural tackiness that allows it to stay in position over the buttons you want to use. If you want to you can play upside down!
  • Easy to clean, just hold under running water, let air-dry.
  • Small size and handy pouch means you can take your Contact Patches with you anywhere.

The Perks

As our way of thanking you for your support we offer the following perks.

  • $5 Signed Thank You Card We appreciate any support we might find.
  • $10 Production Contact Patch (CP) Before the rest of the world gets their Contact Patch you will get yours, and for $10 of retail.
  • $20 Founding Funder Edition CP You will recieve a special edition CP with special packaging and unique tint.
  • $25 Founding Funder & Production CP Get one of each! Keep the Founding Funder under wraps and play with the production version. Limited to the first one thousand funder.
  • $50 First 100 Founding Funder & Production CP Finally, a chance to be in the top one hundred! Hot off the presses! You will get one of the very first one hundred Contact Patches produced.

story:
Mindwarrior Games Ltd. is a Finnish company designing, developing and publishing action packed board games. Our goal is to create easy-to-get-into and fun-to-play games for the youth and young adults.

Our motto "Everybody Dice!" is also our mission statement - the games we make are the games we play and believe anybody and everybody can too.

Until 2011, we have released four games in just two years, including the highly acclaimed Odin’s Table (Game of the year finalist in Finland and Sweden).

 

We as game enthusiasts find it exciting to get people involved in the game producing process from the start and to offer something unique for the gamers around the world!

We offer 6 Perks, which give you the possibility to be seen as part of the great game becoming true. You will also get your hands on the few copies of the Limited Edition of the game, which of only around 1000 copies will be made, mainly for our supporters here and few sample copies for potential publishers and distributors around the world, not to forget the marketing.

The Limited Edition will be visually different than the future production version, so it will certainly be unique and small batch, a true collectors item and never will it be printed again after this batch.

The funding we are looking is used entirely to design, develope, produce and distribute the first limited edition of the game and taking it to exhibitions in the end of 2012. The biggest cost is the actual production of the board game, which will eat around two thirds of the budget.

We are releasing the game with very busy schedule and it will be presented at Essen Spiel'12 still this year.


 

Year 1815 AD. -Maine, New England

The village of Cape Grimson has turned into a battleground for ancient vampire houses and savage clans of werewolves. Stench of blood fills the night when the children of the darkness prepare their teeth for the taste of the enemy.

­Now, it`s your time to become the lord of the damned and conquer the night once and for all.

Bad Moon is fast-paced card drafting / strategy game about the war between Vampires, werewolves and other sinister creatures of the night. Players collect victory points by guiding the factions in the war and balancing the battles by secretly playing different factions during the game. It's not always the strong factions that prevail, it's all about intrigue and planning the future of the war.


Bad Moon Limited edition is going to be a rare collectors item. The box will be different from the future production version, including the unique Bad Moon poster and other unique content that you cannot find from anywhere else.

 

 


The game is played in a cycle of 4 moon phases, which represents one month. There are 5 moon phases in the game, so each new moon cycle starts with a different moon phase than the previous.
 
Moon phases determine possible movements in the map for different locations. Players play one of their hand cards in order to conduct actions on the map. At the start of each new month new hand cards are drafted giving the players a chance to interfere with the opponents plans.

Location cards that are played determine which factions from the depicted areas are moved. Active moon phases indicate the routes where the possible moves are made depending on the moon phase currently active.

Early prototype under testing - Acridites (blue faction) going strong in south, even though there are some witch hunters active as well. Bottom player having House Circato active during the current month - right side has the Werewolf clan Vargulf active for scoring.

 



  • Rule book
  • Game board - size 480mm x 560mm
  • 110 Game cards
  • 120 game tokens:
    • Faction tokens
    • Witch hunter tokens
    • Victory tokens
  • Limited edition poster

 

Bloodline Stone is going to be one full page in the rule book, and it will be printed out in all future print runs as well. Your name exists on our rule book as long as the game exists. The top three positions are reserved for the Bloodline Keeper contributors, and the bottom seven for Pack Leaders.

 

 

Help us share the information!

You can help without money as well:

 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Bad Moon!
  • Join our facebook fanpage at www.facebook.com/BadMoonGame
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo sharing tools and our facebook fanpage!

We appreciate your help creating this awesome game, and we definitely hope you love playing it (the lucky ones who get the actual Limited Edition copy).

We appreciate your help creating this awesome game, and we definitely hope you love playing it (the lucky ones who get the actual Limited Edition copy).

story:
About Subtera

Subtera is the ambitious fufillment of our dreams: to create a multiplayer RPG where you, the player, matters. As gamers and developers with tens of years combined and a dissatisfaction with the current gaming state, we tried to create something ambitious and interesting at the same time. 

We're a small team of indie developers from Brazil with four years of company specializing on game development (with three titles released on android/ios)  and with several years of expertise developing other not-that-cool-kind-of stuff behind us and the will to create the game of our dreams, here we are on our indiegogo!

Since we're targeting hardcore games and do want to create a great atmosphere, with real challenges, and with a deep connection with the community. We think that a crowdfunding is the best, if not the only possible way to make this come true.


The endless world



The world is old, the world is broken. Many gods have risen, ruled an fallen. The last era is nigh, and the remnants of what can be called a civilization now struggle to live on a immense and deadly world. Welcome to subtera.


Subtera is a MMO/RPG game with sandbox elements that tries to diverge from the commercial, mainstream counterparts of it’s genre by creating a unique way that players interact with the world and how he sees it’s character progress inside it. The world is huge and vast, almost impenetrable, filled with new and ancient magic, old civilizations, dungeons, gods, good and evil beings and much, much more, buried deep down under the planet.


Being hardcore gamers ourselves with years of playing baggage, we’re trying to achieve something that would make us addicted - and we think we’re on the right track!


Gameplay


Subtera aims to be a different kind of MMO/RPG by modifying some if the core concepts seen nowadays in this genre:


Fast character creation and upgrading


The player does not need to spend months farming experience or grinding on the same mob forever. By leveraging the battles on less but much more powerful and deadly enemies the player is able to upgrade it’s perks with hours or days of play-through. Imagine a world where you are able to lose everything with a single mistake but in counterpart a character is able to achieve it’s full power in less time. We want to players to be engaged on the act of playing, not the act of doing repetitive tasks. This means that there is no experience bar; you’ll improve by doing the task you like more, and in counterpart will lose the skills you don’t use so much, without countless hours of grind or macroing.


No economy, less npcs

Well, this one is a bit ambitious but we want the game to be dynamic as it’s world. Do you want to buy a sword? Go to the forger guild and as a forger to do so! The forger does not have the required materials to forge the sword? Open a guild quest so adventurers can look for them! Found a dungeon while excavating for materials? Open a quest to let players know about it, and partner with them to (try to) clean it. Cleaned a dungeon? Call for all guilds to excavate and explore all the lore attached with all of them. The possibilities are infinite.


Having no economy means that items will be the currency in the game, and we’re going to provide a way to know what a item is being traded for, so people won't be scammed. We’re going to provide ways to  create valuable items like coins, so if the world end’s up with a currency, it will be developed by it and not just imposed upon.

"Building a furnace. Differently than normal crafting games the 3D format of the blocks will determine the resulting construction"

Death


Death is a valuable commodity on subtera.

In a deadly world, death is inevitable, and interacting with it has to be unique, meaning that we have implemented a system that will be both interesting to new players and engaging for hardcore players. When you create a character, you have to create a testament binding: a god, guild and some quests will enable you to opt on what will happen when you die: do you want to lose your character stats but remain with your equipment? Bind your soul to Lord Debarthas, deity of possession. Want to risk everything and try a new character with completely random stats and equipment upon dying? Bind to Clev, the god of forbidden deeds, and try your luck. Each contract will give good and bad perks to your character, creating a unique environment and giving the sense of consequence to the player. The higher the contract is, the bigger is the power up and harsh is the payment. You chose!



Crafting and construction


We love sandbox games, and love what you can achieve by changing the world around you and tailoring it to resemble you, truly leaving a mark on it. We’re trying to create a sandbox game that’s at the same time beautiful and engaging. So differently from common sandbox games the process of construction/destruction is a bit slower than normal to ensure that people won’t break stuff freely and we don’t want to add magic stuff to prevent people from doing it. Note that enemies will be able to destroy the environment so prepare yourself for epic raids!


Intelligent AI


That’s one thing that bothers most of us: it seems that for the vast part of a MMO the mobs are there… to be killed. This is hurtful to the gameplay as the only motivation is to the player is:


A - kill thousands of enemies of X

B - Look for a new, stronger enemy and repeat


We want to break this never-ending chain of boringness by greatly improving the enemy AI. Expect that mobs work together for a goal, based on it’s preferences: expand the dungeon, loot cities and guilds, protect their environment and bosses. If a enemy has a pack behaviour, ALL enemies will turn against you (and will not attack one after the other, of course).



Non classification


We hate the idea of forcing a player to follow a specific path, hardening the choices as he/she progresses, so we’re removing the class system and leaving only the mastery tree: if you use a lot a set of items and do a lot of activities, you’ll be more effective on it, and thus creating your path on the way you desire. Of course improving a set of skills will set a drawback on another set of skills, so we wont have overpowered users.



Weapons and magic


As everything on subtera, the creating of weapons will be customizable. We’re going to develop an interface to the crafter that will enable the ability to customize, improve, paint and create new and unique items. This will enable a class of players/creators, which will have their creations valued on the entire game, instead of countless pre-factored weapons and infinite drops. We’re also planning to create a blender plugin to effectively enable the creation of new models by players and designers, thus creating brands for each player.



History


The world



Over the cycles the world had diverse names: Etreria on the far north in the peace era, Larth by the underlings after the greatest magic catastrophe, “The Minruir” by the great race of nomads, and many others only mentioned on bard tales; nowadays no one seems to bother in naming it, so scarce and depleted the civilization remnants are, being often called “The Land” for the upper parts of it and “Underland” for it’s depths.


Races


The slaves


There is evidence of the human race since almost the beginning of time, and since the beginning of time their main purpose was as labor force. No matter which race was dominant, humans were there to provide them with all sorts of tasks, be on the depths of the lava mines or fighting on wars just for it’s captives amusement. Since the last cataclysm which vanished the dominant races at approximately 100 cycles before most of them are free, roaming in small nomad groups, using their ability to adapt to almost all kinds of environments, situations and having excellent forging, crafting and weapon skills.


It’s rumored that a small gathering of humans is starting a new city  just below the surface on the far east...




Gears


The gears - the jocose name for the tall, human shaped mechanoids built in when the great race was thriving do not define their grandioseness; built to work with magic as it’s fuel, the Heighir are strong, robust and almost unbreakable. Once bound to a master and used as war machine, they’re now free, and having an infinite magic attunement capacity on it’s own they are starting to regroup on the ruins where their masters once ruled. Their power cores are extremely valuable as a magic source, but finding one, or destroying a gear to recover one is a task indented for the most fierce and talented ones. Many of the magic adepts try to get patronized by one gear, learning everything they can on the arcane ways. Usually a gear does not engage in battle, as it’s probably the end of a large portion of the world if they do.


The craven


Little is known about the craven’s origin. Some say that they were the by product of the ungodly experiments of Ir Malzam, the most famous dark manipulator of all times; some say that they are beings expelled by the most deep parts of the world, acting like growing tumors. The fact is, the cravens are beings of pure darkness, feeding from any living being that has the misfortune of crossing their path. Usually a craven does not kill it’s prey, messing with their emotions and even altering reality to extract the most of it’s fear. Once the victim is crazy, depleted of every possible emotion the craven then kills it and “borrows” what was most frigging, effectively becoming more dreadful and strong with each victim.


Just remember: where is darkness, there are cravens lurking on it. NEVER go outside on the dark. Ever.



Gods / Deities


Little is known about exactly what is a god or a deity on this feeble world. Some eras the mightiest champions were fabled as deities (and some even acted as one), some races worshiped the nature and their gods were the earth and the water and the animals, and some replied them, and yet some civilizations took the nature gods and bent they under magic and corruption.


Deity

Some players, upon doing great deeds or achievements will be rewarded with a god blessing. This blessing, which will work for the character lifetime will grant a serie of bonuses and enable quests for the player and for other players that follow the god/are passing by. This will increase the quest dynamism and will offer great rewards for the most challenging quests.

What  we have now


We have functional prototype with the terrain engine, network and basic features working. 


Why We Need Your Help

We are a small company. But our goal with this project is to make the game of our lives, not only as developers but also as players. Unfortunately to compete with the big games in the market is impossible without money, we need to hire artists and developers for the project be completed in acceptable time with high quality. We want to be part of something big.

To accomplish this objective we have to dedicate our entire time to the project and contract many people we need money. Unfortunately we have a life.


Costs:

Our costs will be divided like this:

Developers: 20%

This amount is for our infantry. 

These guys makes the things happens, but they need to be well feed to keep fighting.

Designers (20%)

This amount is for our constructors. 

They will build our world. We need to provide the  resources these fellows  needs to make our world beautiful and growing.

Support (10%)

This amount is for our archers.

These guys will defend our castles from attacks, will help you to solve your problems and correct any weakness we got.

Marketing 10%

This amount is for our carries.

 We need the people know us to our kingdom have power. To keep the thing running we need at least 1000 active players .

Taxes (20%)

This amount is to our enemies. 

This is a great enemy in our land. They sabotage make we  spend much more money than we should.

Indiegogo (10%)

This amount is to our allies. 

Indiegogo is fighting our war and deserves share the glory.

Server/Maintenance (10%)

This amount is to maintain our castles

To maintain our war machine we need to pay for our supplies.

Risks & Challenges

Let's be frank - a mmo costs money. A LOT of money. We struggled to define a reasonable yet non frightening goal so we could at least have the chance to create something that is worth for the backer and can evolve on something stable for us to keep on the development and continuation of the game.

The Team

Besides working on the prototype for the latest 8 months, we're toying with games/consulting for quite some time (four years and counting), and released three games for Android and iOS using in house technologies like an open-source C++ 2D game engine (based on the famous libgdx engine) which runs the same game on all platforms  (and linux too!).
You can find more of us on our website
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share, share and share.
  • Haven't you shared yet?
  • Be our publisher =)

And that's all there is to it.
