10.000€ Crearemos un nuevo modulo LEGENDARIO, "El Río" / We will create a new LEGENDARY module, "The River".
15.000€ ¿?¿?¿?
 

FUTUROS LANZAMIENTOS / FUTURE
RELEASES


Ya tenemos pensado ampliar el tablero. En función de la
aceptación del producto entre los aficionados hemos pensado posibles
ampliaciones para el tablero.
We already have plans to expand the board. Depending
on the product acceptance by the fans.
Conjunto de 3
tableros que unidos formen una sección de río con sus correspondientes puentes,
embarcaderos, etc. Set of three boards that together form a
river section with corresponding bridges, piers, etc.
Nuestra propia
gama de edificios para completar el tablero . Our
own range of buildings to complete the board.
Toda una serie de
nuevos tableros modulares que formen un Dungeon completo.  De tal manera que con los 2 tableros podrás
representar la ciudad y todos los pasadizos y cámaras secretas del subterráneo.
A whole new series of modular panels that form a
complete Dungeon. So that the 2 boards can represent the city and all of the secret passages and underground chambers.

Esto va a ser legen... espera... dario / It will be legen... wait for it... dary

Para cualquier duda escribir al siguiente email. For any questions you can write to the following email
Email: victor@legendarybattlegrounds.com

story:
CAMPAIGN ENDS - NOW WHAT?


As Erevos IndieGoGo campaign is about to end, we want to thank all those of you who contributed, or supported it any other way!

We did not reach our funding goal, but nevertheless still intend to develop Erevos, although at a somewhat slower rate and with a couple of tweaks. Before we reveal our contingency plans though, we want to hear your comments, as well as get some feedback to fix some parts that might have not been very well received. So, within the next few days, we will be sending a questionnaire to all of you whose email address we have access to (this includes all IndieGoGo contributors, Erevos forum registered members and all other people who have received emails or PMs from us in other platforms – if you are not in any of these lists and want to share your feedback, contact us at erevoscs@gmail.com). As soon as we get your feedback, we will post updates regarding the next stage in the development of Erevos

Thanks again for all the support!

Yannis Psychogiopoulos

Erevos co-creator



EREVOS IN 60'' (TL:DR)

• Erevos offers the opportunity to play ‘Rhapsodies’: short personalized adventures written by professional adventure authors specifically for 1 adventuring party, tailored to the needs of the players (theme preferences, characters backgrounds and goals, players likes and dislikes etc)!

• Erevos is a truly living campaign setting, in the sense that the world evolves according to players' will and actions. There are no significant NPCs making decisions or major random events dictating the future!

• Erevos leaves great room for creativity: by registering in the community, you can upload your custom creations (orders, faiths and so on) and see them become official if the community approves them!

• Erevos is a world of political influence: you can determine some part of the world's history by participating in local political councils or even create a kingdom of your own!

• Erevos acknowledges your character's accomplished tasks: every registered character has a personal online profile page where he can upload his adventures and socialize, much like a social networking platform. The most significant events are recorded in the Online History Timeline becoming part of Erevos official history!

• All in all, Erevos aims to provide a free, dynamic setting to everyone interested in running a home game and a high quality personalized service to all subscribers by maintaining personal contact and tailoring the gaming experience to each player’s needs. Personalized service is offered to players with ‘Growing’ characters who have several privileges compared to regular ones among which:

          - Receiving Rhapsodies through their subscription

          - Participation in Conclaves of Authority, regional councils that                                   determine local politics (through Erevos forum)

          - Access to Kingdom-making (design in all aspects of their settlement                  which may grow into a metropolis)

         

Erevos is a living world in a medieval fantasy setting with many sandbox game elements. It supplements the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. By participating in Erevos, you enter a community of users that is responsible in all ways for the evolution of the world. Although Erevos community might be large, only a finite number of players will have a GROWING character. Players that control them have special privileges, the most important of which is that they get to promote their character’s story by uncovering a plot written especially for their character. From the moment he creates a growing character, a player is in direct contact with us to lead this story wherever he likes. He does not follow predetermined, linear plotlines as he would in most generic adventures. This epic tale is told in rhapsodies. Rhapsodies are short adventures written by professional Pathfinder adventure authors (the team includes among others Ron Lundeen, freelance author for Paizo Publishing and designer and publisher behind Run Amok Games - to view Ron's Pathfinder writing credits click here, Sean Holland, freelance adventure author - click here to visit Sean's blog or here to view his complete resume that includes his writing credits) especially for a minimum of 4 specific characters. They are tailored to players’ needs as well as characters’ backgrounds, roleplaying motivations and anything else that might be important to each player as indicated by him. Every rhapsody we give out is 100% unique, designed only for a specific adventuring party and each subsequent one is designed having in mind the feedback that the players provided us upon the previous rhapsody’s completion. We are designing rhapsodies based on your character’s choices as well as your preferences as a player, while we try to build a plot worth discovering for your character. 

Players with growing characters are thus in complete control of the action in the world, as all major events are the results of their adventuring as played in rhapsodies and described by their direct feedback. There are no NPCs handled by the creators to determine and run major events. All important decisions regarding the setting are decided through either direct characters’ actions or the community (ie custom players’ creations such as religions or orders that have the approval of the community or major random events decided via established polls etc). Even though the setting provides world lore with a rich background that will be uncovered gradually through rhapsodies and world lore entries in the official website (world lore also includes several distinctive traits i.e. most elves live in the desert and most dwarves around mountain peaks), it will all depend on the community's approval and in time it might evolve into an entirely different world (although its history will remain the same). Although the exact number of players that will have growing characters will be finalized during product development, a good rough first estimation might be around 1,000 characters that will be selected on a 1st come – 1st served basis. Right now, all pledge levels of $60 or more GUARANTEE a growing character. 

Erevos is not only about character advancement through adventuring though. It is also an environment of political influence, intrigue and power. Characters can build their own cities, participate in local or regional councils (:called Conclaves of Authority) and increase in power and authority to rule kingdoms or even create their own ones. It is a world where anyone might plot against your character or be your character’s most faithful ally, as everyone you interact with is a player character! All players will have a personal online page where they can update the evolution of their character, thus becoming part of Erevos’ history. We will be going through your feedback and select the most important events of your character’s adventuring career to update the world’s history regularly. Erevos' history will be online, available for everyone to see and will include all important accomplishments any character might have made thus granting him reputation which will also have in-game benefits. The world will be growing along with your characters and its evolution will depend on players’ choices. You may stop the infamous villain of the Shimmering Spine, enter the oldest dragon’s lair all kingdoms have ever seen, explore the mostly feared negative energy lands beneath the Souls River or travel beyond the Sea of Hope. It’s your choice. Whatever you choose though, Erevos’ history will have your character’s name carved on it. 

Read on or visit our website to find out more or our forum to ask us a direct question!


Theogonia city map by Herwin Wielink


The Sun's Tear island by Juan Carlos Barquet



There are three main reasons why you should subscribe to Erevos.

Firstly, Erevos will give you the chance to play adventures, designed by professionals ONLY for you and the rest of your party. Every adventure created in Erevos is only sold once, to one adventuring party and it is tailored to meet the players’ needs, according to their guidelines and feedback. By subscribing to Erevos, you have the opportunity of having a team of professional, successful adventure authors write adventures solely for you, based on your character’s background, role playing motivations and anything else you feel is important. 

Secondly, Erevos is a truly living world, in the sense that all important events in the evolution of the world are dictated by the players. By subscribing, you become part of the community and can affect the world directly: there are no important NPCs taking action, there are no random events so significant that your character must only sit back and watch. You are the one making these big decisions along with the rest of the subscribers, in several ways: You can give your character an administrative position (such as in the local Conclave of Authority or by creating your own kingdom) and discuss in our forums (or decide by yourself in the case of your own kingdom) the politics of the region you represent; you can bring in the world your own custom creations (such as religions, orders etc) that become official if the community approves them; you can vote in our established polls that determine minor random events (this option is available to all registered users of Erevos even if they have not subscribed); finally you can take the initiative to lead your character’s story (through the feedback you will be giving us before receiving your adventures) towards a dangerous task of great significance for the world. Erevos is yours to shape however you see fit. 

Thirdly, Erevos is a dynamic environment that evolves along with your character’s accomplished feats. By subscribing, you gain access to a personal online profile page for your character. This page will be yours to update as often as you like with anything that relates to your character (adventures description, journal entries, important events in a character’s life etc). Everyone will be able to view your profile page. We will be following all characters, selecting the most significant events in their adventuring careers to update the world’s history regularly. Your character’s most significant feats of strength will be recorded for everyone to know. In Erevos, every action a character takes has consequences. Every adventure has consequences. Killing a mighty villain or a band of raiders means no more trouble for many other adventuring parties. Aiding the villain on the other hand will make their lives tougher. Choosing between ensuring the safety of your followers and going on a suicide mission to save your daughter will affect many other characters’ lives and might even determine the world’s future. And this decision will be recorded for the rest of the world to know. 

EREVOS world map by Anne Mohr (Schattenherz)


Nessima Desert by Juan Carlos Barquet


So, you want to know how this might work in practice? Here are the steps you will take if you want to participate fully in Erevos: 

1. User Registration 

By registering, you enter the online community of Erevos which means you gain access to several benefits (which are free of charge) among which having a say as to how the world will evolve! 

2. Characters Creation 

You can create some characters, based on the Pathfinder roleplaying game rules for character creation. This can include background, role playing motivations, mannerisms and anything else you feel is important to highlight your character. Each character will have his own online profile page, where you can upload the evolution of his adventures. Other users will be able to view your page and leave comments, which will make your character’s page interactive. 

3. Character Subscription 

By subscribing, you can make one of your characters become ‘growing’ and start advancing in levels. An additional character can turn ‘growing’ for every additional subscription you get. The character advances at predetermined intervals (1 level per 3 weeks). You can change your ‘growing’ character at any time although this might affect slightly your gameplay. Subscriptions will be open until the maximum number of Player Characters is reached (the cap has not been finalized yet, nevertheless a good, rough first estimation might be around 1,000 - all pledge levels of $50 or more GUARANTEE for now a growing character). 

4. Adventuring Party Formation 

After you subscribe, you get to choose your adventuring party. This might be an online party that uses an online communication platform or our forums (or any other forum that you like), or it could be a live party playing wherever and whenever you feel like it. Adventuring parties should have at least 4 playing characters and a Game Master. The Game Master does not have to be a subscriber in Erevos (although he might). By all means, joining an adventuring party does not mean you will have to spend all your gaming sessions in it (although you could, if you wanted to), just like an adventurer would not have to travel with a group of people he did not get along with if he did not want to. There will always be other adventuring parties that you can join. These will be most likely online though, unless it happens that there are other Erevos subscribers in your neighborhood. 

 5. Adventuring Party info upload 

After your party is complete, we receive all info that relates to it. This includes character backgrounds, adventuring career goals, role playing motivations, players’ preferences and anything else you feel appropriate. You may also create an online page of your party where you can describe explicitly all of the party’s future adventures. 

6. Rhapsodies Delivery 

Based on the info you have provided, we create short adventures called 'Rhapsodies' especially for your adventuring party. Rhapsodies are tailored to meet your preferences and include story elements that can help you uncover a sub-plot for your character, apart from the main plot that relates to the whole party. We will try to provide at least 1 such rhapsody per month to each adventuring party for free (this is part of your subscription), although the exact number of rhapsody deliveries will depend on the results of b-playtest. Each rhapsody is designed to advance your character about one and a half level. You can purchase additional rhapsodies at our online shop. Although these extra rhapsodies can move your character’s and adventuring party’s stories forward, they do not allow however your character to advance in levels at a higher pace in the official world (all characters advance at the predetermined pace regardless of the number of rhapsodies they have completed). 

7. Feedback 

Upon rhapsody completion, you provide us with feedback on the results of your gaming sessions, any important decision the party (or a specific character) made, major events that occurred and anything else you think is important. Apart from this feedback, you can upload any piece of info you like (as detailed as you want to) to your character’s or adventuring party’s online profile page. If you want to see an example of steps 5, 6 and 7 (adventuring parties info, rhapsodies written for specific characters and feedback after the session), click here.

8. Erevos official history update 

We collect feedback from all playing adventuring parties and update Erevos world history respectively. New rhapsodies are designed having this information in mind. Every single action you take might affect the adventures of hundred of other players. After a while, we will have gathered enough info to publish a book on the evolution of the world. This campaign guide will be the official Erevos history and it will be full of references to all players that participated and accomplished major or minor tasks in it! 

Visit our website to find out more or our forum to ask us a direct question!

You can find us in Facebook and Twitter too!

Bonecrest city by Juan Carlos Barquet


Theogonia city by Juan Carlos Barquet


At the minimum funding level, you will essentially be funding the development of Erevos campaign setting and its first couple of months of operation. This includes the web site where all world lore material will be freely available and which will offer personal profile pages for every user (similar to social networking websites), the writing and editing of the world lore, a few maps and illustrators that will accompany it, b-playtest and the first couple of months of adventure writing after product launch. We believe so much in the revolutionary approach of Erevos and want so eagerly to see it launching that we are willing to work on its development without any payment and providing all running costs ourselves if we reach only our minimum funding goal. We have decided that we will use Indiegogo funds to cover running costs only if we exceed significantly the minimum funding goal. In that case, extra funds will be distributed partially between extra features and running costs (:see Stretch Goals for more info on extra features). The following chart shows explicitly what your money is going towards at the minimum funding level.

We also wanted to make sure that all those of you who share our vision and want to see Erevos happen, are rewarded. This is why we set all pledge levels that offer a subscription at a discounted rate compared to the one after the setting is developed. The subscriptions for Erevos after development is completed will be $25 for a 1-month period, $60 for a 3-month period and $200 for a 13-month period*. Check out our backers rewards for more information on subscriptions and discounts!

*b-playtest results might affect these figures slightly.


$75,000

The first extra feature we will develop if we overcome our minimum funding goal will be a dress-up application that will be available for everyone through Erevos website. All common races and most weapons and armors will be available so that every user will be able to view and customize his character.

$85,000

If we reach this level, we will make sure every area in Erevos has a regional map. Cities and other settlements developed by players during product development (:see high end pledge level rewards) will be included in these maps.

$95,000

At this level, we will install an extra feature in Erevos website that will allow 3-dimensional movement among historical events (fully zoomed out, all Erevos history will be shown with most significant historic events, but the more the user zooms in, the more it will focus on smaller periods of history and less significant events which might include players' involvement).

$105,000

At this level, we will invest more in the artwork department. More illustrations for important geographical sites, more weapons and armors for the dress-up application etc.


+$10 Contribute a fantasy name of your own favored characters - settlements or anything else you like. This will be given to a setting character or locale within the next year

+$20 Contribute an NPC to the setting. You provide with all details (name, race, class, personality etc) and we find a suitable spot for him!

+$60 Black & White Character sketch in action stance (see an example here)

+$60 Black & White Character sketch (cartoon style - see an example here)

+$100 Full Color comic strip on your character  (see an example here)

+$120 Full Color Character illustration in action stance

+$200 Full Color Landscape illustration (average quality - see an example here)

+$400 Full Color Landscape Illustration (high quality - see an example here)


THE PROJECT

Erevos began as a way for our role playing group to add story elements to published adventures. Being dedicated role playing gamers for almost 20 years, we have followed a large variety of role playing options to settle down to the concept of Erevos. We have tried different settings, but kept coming back to medieval fantasy; we have tried different system rules, but there was always something missing when compared to d20 system; we have tried playing with other role playing groups and adding other people to our group (in fact although 7 people are the core of our group, more than 30 have played at least 1 campaign with us during these years and they have all contributed, each in a distinctive way, to the conclusive result thus we can not thank them enough), but always missed the awesome, all-night long sessions that we had with our closest friends when we were teenagers. As we were growing towards our 30s, we already knew clearly our likes and dislikes: the d20 system had improved the game a lot, as it offered a very detailed base of rules to solve most difficult situations that would appear in a gaming session, but also had expanded the role playing market significantly and this offered a huge variety of options regarding adventures, feats, spells etc. There were so many resources! On the other hand, we felt all these rulebooks had taken something away from the game. Before the d20 system, every adventure had a unique feeling. The feeling was not unique anymore. After long hours of talks among us, thoughts on the subject and participation in forum discussions, we concluded that it was the lack of improvisation that had taken away this feeling of uniqueness. At first, we considered creating a new rules system from scratch, which would leave a lot of room for improvisation. This plan was very quickly abandoned. We were so used to running through the rulebooks when we had a conflict as to how a matter should be resolved that we were practically addicted to it. This process had officially become part of the fun. And then we decided to direct the GM towards personalizing the written adventure we had bought to meet our characters’ goals and our needs as players! The results were better than expected. The feeling was back on! Every character had a goal that the others did not know about, or a secret mission he had to accomplish as a sub-plot. I am pretty sure several players have more or less attempted this and know what I am talking about. We were finishing campaigns in totally unpredictable for the adventure author ways. And then we faced another problem. The campaign setting we were used to playing, which we had grown to love deeply, was evolving by its creators and it seriously contradicted the stories we had played. We felt we had given so much energy and creativity into creating great characters and stories and then in one moment the campaign setting directors were taking it all away (well, obviously we could not really blame a setting creator that he did not consult us before evolving the story). Being in our early 30s some years later, we were still anticipating the day when a campaign setting creator would say: “My world is yours, players! Mess with it as you like.” This is how Erevos came into life. We decided that we have waited for too long. We wanted to have a campaign setting that has rich world lore (in fact, Erevos is the result of a decade of role playing action of our role playing group – many, many adventures brought together and as such it has great background depth which we plan on revealing gradually through adventures and major plotlines but which will still rely on the community’s approval), but also the highest possible degree of players’ involvement. We wanted to offer personalized adventures (‘Rhapsodies’), but better and richer than the ones we had played: designed directly by professional adventure authors. We wanted to keep the great structure d20 adventures have, but bring sandbox game elements to them (which is why we design your next rhapsody, after you provide us with feedback on the last one you played). We strongly believe Erevos is the next step towards a living, interactive world that offers creative players infinite options. It is what role playing games should be all about. Before we conclude, we would like to thank everyone that contributed to bringing our passion to life, but mainly: Tassos ‘Saras’ Kallianiotis, Panayotis ‘Billaras’ Karalis, Aristidis ‘Arukos’ Kiriakidis, Yannis ‘Kikias’ Kikiantonis and Stavros ‘Dallas’ Dalakas.

US

Although many people have contributed in distinctive ways to complete Erevos planning and Indiegogo campaign launch, there are two people who have put endless hours and disturbed consistently their wives by not being able to focus on anything else than Erevos the last few months: Yannis -johstas- Psychogiopoulos and Nikos -madnick- Mantasas.

Yannis finished his studies in finance in 2004 and got a job at a consultancy. A few years later (2008), he completed his MSc in Management at London School of Economics and immediately got back to his previous employment. Ever since then though, he dreamed of the day when he would run a project he most passionately cared about. When the consultancy he worked for decided to let all employees go due to the Greek economic crisis a few months ago, Yannis saw an opportunity rather than a threat: He decided to develop Erevos. As a role-playing gamer, Yannis is very fond of complex characters and rich stories, ever since 1997 when he was first introduced to rpgs. He mostly likes role-playing situations that provide his characters with significant conflict of values. If you would like to talk to Yannis directly, visit his profile page in Facebook and send him a private message.

Nikos studied engineering in Guildford (UK) and has changed a couple of jobs during the last ten years, that included a Store Manager position at the Greek multinational Germanos, an Account Manager position at a company distributing systems and services for geographical tracking and a Recycling Inspector for TuV Austria Hellas. He started playing rpgs consistently at high school (1995). He is a passionate collector of old-school rpg books, is a rules-lawyer and likes action-packed adventures (both in rpgs and movies). If you would like to talk to Nikos directly, visit his profile page in Facebook and send him a private message.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Our main concern from day 1 was whether we would be able to provide with personalized service to every player that gets involved. We aim to have personal contact with every player, get to know his likes and dislikes. Given the relatively small size our company, we feel we do not have the resources to guarantee the top quality service we aim to offer to a very large amount of players. This is why we decided to offer growing characters (which is the core of our personalized service) to a limited number of players. The exact number has not been determined yet and will depend on several factors among which demand, the results of the b-playtest and generally how product development goes etc, but a good first estimation might be around 1,000. 

Apart from that, in order to give sandbox elements to the game, we decided to get feedback from the players after each rhapsody they complete and design their next rhapsody based on this feedback. We fear this might be very tough to handle without proper regulation. We therefore plan on setting up feedback template forms that will facilitate conclusions reaching but also allow space for personal comments.

Another issue is the cost of writing an adventure (even a short one in a compact form - to view an example of play including a sample rhapsody click here) at a player by player level. To address this, we estimated the total adventure authors costs for a large volume of rhapsodies and decided it was not financially feasible to have them write for less than 4 people. This is why we decided that a minimum of 4 growing characters are required to form an adventuring party. 

Last but not least, to guarantee the highest product quality possible, we have already made preliminary agreements with several professionals well known at a global level within their area of expertise (adventure authors, fantasy writers, illustrators, map designer etc) and plan to contact many more!

THE ARTISTS

We are in constant search to add highly skilled artists in our artistic team. The team so far includes:

• Mr Herwin Wielink (:Theogonia city map - you can see a gallery of Herwin's previous works at his personal web site, some samples include Draconspire Tharstelding world map, Ankhor Deeps dungeon map etc), 

• Miss Anne Mohr (:Erevos world map - you can see a gallery of Anne's previous works at her deviantArt profile page, some samples include Alvarania map, Demera city map etc), 

• Mr Juan Carlos Barquet (:Sun's Tear illustration, but also Theogonia, Bonecrest and Nessima desert illustrations - you can see a gallery of Juan Carlos' previous works at his deviantArt profile page, some samples include the Winter Cottage illustration, the Sect etc) and

• the Greeks George Melissaropoulos (Erevos art-director and cartoons expert), Kostas Foutsidis (:Lukom, Rolland and Zess sketches but also battles sketches) and Fotis Aradas.

We are designing rhapsodies based on your character’s choices as well as your preferences as a player, while we try to build a plot worth discovering for your character. Players with growing characters are thus in complete control of the action in the world, as all major events are the results of their adventuring as played in rhapsodies and described by their direct feedback. There are no NPCs handled by the creators to determine and run major events. All important decisions regarding the setting are decided through either direct characters’ actions or the community (ie custom players’ creations such as religions or orders that have the approval of the community or major random events decided via established polls etc). Even though the setting provides world lore with a rich background that will be uncovered gradually through rhapsodies and world lore entries in the official website (world lore also includes several distinctive traits i.e. most elves live in the desert and most dwarves around mountain peaks), it will all depend on the community's approval and in time it might evolve into an entirely different world (although its history will remain the same). Although the exact number of players that will have growing characters will be finalized during product development, a good rough first estimation might be around 1,000 characters that will be selected on a 1st come – 1st served basis. Right now, all pledge levels of $60 or more GUARANTEE a growing character. Erevos is not only about character advancement through adventuring though. It is also an environment of political influence, intrigue and power. Characters can build their own cities, participate in local or regional councils (:called Conclaves of Authority) and increase in power and authority to rule kingdoms or even create their own ones. It is a world where anyone might plot against your character or be your character’s most faithful ally, as everyone you interact with is a player character! All players will have a personal online page where they can update the evolution of their character, thus becoming part of Erevos’ history. We will be going through your feedback and select the most important events of your character’s adventuring career to update the world’s history regularly. Erevos' history will be online, available for everyone to see and will include all important accomplishments any character might have made thus granting him reputation which will also have in-game benefits. The world will be growing along with your characters and its evolution will depend on players’ choices. You may stop the infamous villain of the Shimmering Spine, enter the oldest dragon’s lair all kingdoms have ever seen, explore the mostly feared negative energy lands beneath the Souls River or travel beyond the Sea of Hope. It’s your choice. Whatever you choose though, Erevos’ history will have your character’s name carved on it. Read on or visit our website to find out more or our forum to ask us a direct question!Theogonia city map by Herwin WielinkThe Sun's Tear island by Juan Carlos BarquetThere are three main reasons why you should subscribe to Erevos.Firstly, Erevos will give you the chance to play adventures, designed by professionals ONLY for you and the rest of your party. Every adventure created in Erevos is only sold once, to one adventuring party and it is tailored to meet the players’ needs, according to their guidelines and feedback. By subscribing to Erevos, you have the opportunity of having a team of professional, successful adventure authors write adventures solely for you, based on your character’s background, role playing motivations and anything else you feel is important. Secondly, Erevos is a truly living world, in the sense that all important events in the evolution of the world are dictated by the players. By subscribing, you become part of the community and can affect the world directly: there are no important NPCs taking action, there are no random events so significant that your character must only sit back and watch. You are the one making these big decisions along with the rest of the subscribers, in several ways: You can give your character an administrative position (such as in the local Conclave of Authority or by creating your own kingdom) and discuss in our forums (or decide by yourself in the case of your own kingdom) the politics of the region you represent; you can bring in the world your own custom creations (such as religions, orders etc) that become official if the community approves them; you can vote in our established polls that determine minor random events (this option is available to all registered users of Erevos even if they have not subscribed); finally you can take the initiative to lead your character’s story (through the feedback you will be giving us before receiving your adventures) towards a dangerous task of great significance for the world. Erevos is yours to shape however you see fit. Thirdly, Erevos is a dynamic environment that evolves along with your character’s accomplished feats. By subscribing, you gain access to a personal online profile page for your character. This page will be yours to update as often as you like with anything that relates to your character (adventures description, journal entries, important events in a character’s life etc). Everyone will be able to view your profile page. We will be following all characters, selecting the most significant events in their adventuring careers to update the world’s history regularly. Your character’s most significant feats of strength will be recorded for everyone to know. In Erevos, every action a character takes has consequences. Every adventure has consequences. Killing a mighty villain or a band of raiders means no more trouble for many other adventuring parties. Aiding the villain on the other hand will make their lives tougher. Choosing between ensuring the safety of your followers and going on a suicide mission to save your daughter will affect many other characters’ lives and might even determine the world’s future. And this decision will be recorded for the rest of the world to know. EREVOS world map by Anne Mohr (Schattenherz)Nessima Desert by Juan Carlos BarquetSo, you want to know how this might work in practice? Here are the steps you will take if you want to participate fully in Erevos: 1.	User Registration By registering, you enter the online community of Erevos which means you gain access to several benefits (which are free of charge) among which having a say as to how the world will evolve! 2.	Characters Creation You can create some characters, based on the Pathfinder roleplaying game rules for character creation. This can include background, role playing motivations, mannerisms and anything else you feel is important to highlight your character. Each character will have his own online profile page, where you can upload the evolution of his adventures. Other users will be able to view your page and leave comments, which will make your character’s page interactive. 3.	Character Subscription By subscribing, you can make one of your characters become ‘growing’ and start advancing in levels. An additional character can turn ‘growing’ for every additional subscription you get. The character advances at predetermined intervals (1 level per 3 weeks). You can change your ‘growing’ character at any time although this might affect slightly your gameplay. Subscriptions will be open until the maximum number of Player Characters is reached (the cap has not been finalized yet, nevertheless a good, rough first estimation might be around 1,000 - all pledge levels of $50 or more GUARANTEE for now a growing character). 4.	Adventuring Party Formation After you subscribe, you get to choose your adventuring party. This might be an online party that uses an online communication platform or our forums (or any other forum that you like), or it could be a live party playing wherever and whenever you feel like it. Adventuring parties should have at least 4 playing characters and a Game Master. The Game Master does not have to be a subscriber in Erevos (although he might). By all means, joining an adventuring party does not mean you will have to spend all your gaming sessions in it (although you could, if you wanted to), just like an adventurer would not have to travel with a group of people he did not get along with if he did not want to. There will always be other adventuring parties that you can join. These will be most likely online though, unless it happens that there are other Erevos subscribers in your neighborhood.  5.	Adventuring Party info upload After your party is complete, we receive all info that relates to it. This includes character backgrounds, adventuring career goals, role playing motivations, players’ preferences and anything else you feel appropriate. You may also create an online page of your party where you can describe explicitly all of the party’s future adventures. 6.	Rhapsodies Delivery Based on the info you have provided, we create short adventures called 'Rhapsodies' especially for your adventuring party. Rhapsodies are tailored to meet your preferences and include story elements that can help you uncover a sub-plot for your character, apart from the main plot that relates to the whole party. We will try to provide at least 1 such rhapsody per month to each adventuring party for free (this is part of your subscription), although the exact number of rhapsody deliveries will depend on the results of b-playtest. Each rhapsody is designed to advance your character about one and a half level. You can purchase additional rhapsodies at our online shop. Although these extra rhapsodies can move your character’s and adventuring party’s stories forward, they do not allow however your character to advance in levels at a higher pace in the official world (all characters advance at the predetermined pace regardless of the number of rhapsodies they have completed). 7.	Feedback Upon rhapsody completion, you provide us with feedback on the results of your gaming sessions, any important decision the party (or a specific character) made, major events that occurred and anything else you think is important. Apart from this feedback, you can upload any piece of info you like (as detailed as you want to) to your character’s or adventuring party’s online profile page. If you want to see an example of steps 5, 6 and 7 (adventuring parties info, rhapsodies written for specific characters and feedback after the session), click here.8.	Erevos official history update We collect feedback from all playing adventuring parties and update Erevos world history respectively. New rhapsodies are designed having this information in mind. Every single action you take might affect the adventures of hundred of other players. After a while, we will have gathered enough info to publish a book on the evolution of the world. This campaign guide will be the official Erevos history and it will be full of references to all players that participated and accomplished major or minor tasks in it! Visit our website to find out more or our forum to ask us a direct question!You can find us in Facebook and Twitter too!Bonecrest city by Juan Carlos BarquetTheogonia city by Juan Carlos BarquetAt the minimum funding level, you will essentially be funding the development of Erevos campaign setting and its first couple of months of operation. This includes the web site where all world lore material will be freely available and which will offer personal profile pages for every user (similar to social networking websites), the writing and editing of the world lore, a few maps and illustrators that will accompany it, b-playtest and the first couple of months of adventure writing after product launch. We believe so much in the revolutionary approach of Erevos and want so eagerly to see it launching that we are willing to work on its development without any payment and providing all running costs ourselves if we reach only our minimum funding goal. We have decided that we will use Indiegogo funds to cover running costs only if we exceed significantly the minimum funding goal. In that case, extra funds will be distributed partially between extra features and running costs (:see Stretch Goals for more info on extra features). The following chart shows explicitly what your money is going towards at the minimum funding level.We also wanted to make sure that all those of you who share our vision and want to see Erevos happen, are rewarded. This is why we set all pledge levels that offer a subscription at a discounted rate compared to the one after the setting is developed. The subscriptions for Erevos after development is completed will be $25 for a 1-month period, $60 for a 3-month period and $200 for a 13-month period*. Check out our backers rewards for more information on subscriptions and discounts!*b-playtest results might affect these figures slightly.$75,000The first extra feature we will develop if we overcome our minimum funding goal will be a dress-up application that will be available for everyone through Erevos website. All common races and most weapons and armors will be available so that every user will be able to view and customize his character.$85,000If we reach this level, we will make sure every area in Erevos has a regional map. Cities and other settlements developed by players during product development (:see high end pledge level rewards) will be included in these maps.$95,000At this level, we will install an extra feature in Erevos website that will allow 3-dimensional movement among historical events (fully zoomed out, all Erevos history will be shown with most significant historic events, but the more the user zooms in, the more it will focus on smaller periods of history and less significant events which might include players' involvement).$105,000At this level, we will invest more in the artwork department. More illustrations for important geographical sites, more weapons and armors for the dress-up application etc.+$10 Contribute a fantasy name of your own favored characters - settlements or anything else you like. This will be given to a setting character or locale within the next year+$20 Contribute an NPC to the setting. You provide with all details (name, race, class, personality etc) and we find a suitable spot for him!+$60 Black & White Character sketch in action stance (see an example here)+$60 Black & White Character sketch (cartoon style - see an example here)+$100 Full Color comic strip on your character  (see an example here)+$120 Full Color Character illustration in action stance+$200 Full Color Landscape illustration (average quality - see an example here)+$400 Full Color Landscape Illustration (high quality - see an example here)THE PROJECTErevos began as a way for our role playing group to add story elements to published adventures. Being dedicated role playing gamers for almost 20 years, we have followed a large variety of role playing options to settle down to the concept of Erevos. We have tried different settings, but kept coming back to medieval fantasy; we have tried different system rules, but there was always something missing when compared to d20 system; we have tried playing with other role playing groups and adding other people to our group (in fact although 7 people are the core of our group, more than 30 have played at least 1 campaign with us during these years and they have all contributed, each in a distinctive way, to the conclusive result thus we can not thank them enough), but always missed the awesome, all-night long sessions that we had with our closest friends when we were teenagers. As we were growing towards our 30s, we already knew clearly our likes and dislikes: the d20 system had improved the game a lot, as it offered a very detailed base of rules to solve most difficult situations that would appear in a gaming session, but also had expanded the role playing market significantly and this offered a huge variety of options regarding adventures, feats, spells etc. There were so many resources! On the other hand, we felt all these rulebooks had taken something away from the game. Before the d20 system, every adventure had a unique feeling. The feeling was not unique anymore. After long hours of talks among us, thoughts on the subject and participation in forum discussions, we concluded that it was the lack of improvisation that had taken away this feeling of uniqueness. At first, we considered creating a new rules system from scratch, which would leave a lot of room for improvisation. This plan was very quickly abandoned. We were so used to running through the rulebooks when we had a conflict as to how a matter should be resolved that we were practically addicted to it. This process had officially become part of the fun. And then we decided to direct the GM towards personalizing the written adventure we had bought to meet our characters’ goals and our needs as players! The results were better than expected. The feeling was back on! Every character had a goal that the others did not know about, or a secret mission he had to accomplish as a sub-plot. I am pretty sure several players have more or less attempted this and know what I am talking about. We were finishing campaigns in totally unpredictable for the adventure author ways. And then we faced another problem. The campaign setting we were used to playing, which we had grown to love deeply, was evolving by its creators and it seriously contradicted the stories we had played. We felt we had given so much energy and creativity into creating great characters and stories and then in one moment the campaign setting directors were taking it all away (well, obviously we could not really blame a setting creator that he did not consult us before evolving the story). Being in our early 30s some years later, we were still anticipating the day when a campaign setting creator would say: “My world is yours, players! Mess with it as you like.” This is how Erevos came into life. We decided that we have waited for too long. We wanted to have a campaign setting that has rich world lore (in fact, Erevos is the result of a decade of role playing action of our role playing group – many, many adventures brought together and as such it has great background depth which we plan on revealing gradually through adventures and major plotlines but which will still rely on the community’s approval), but also the highest possible degree of players’ involvement. We wanted to offer personalized adventures (‘Rhapsodies’), but better and richer than the ones we had played: designed directly by professional adventure authors. We wanted to keep the great structure d20 adventures have, but bring sandbox game elements to them (which is why we design your next rhapsody, after you provide us with feedback on the last one you played). We strongly believe Erevos is the next step towards a living, interactive world that offers creative players infinite options. It is what role playing games should be all about. Before we conclude, we would like to thank everyone that contributed to bringing our passion to life, but mainly: Tassos ‘Saras’ Kallianiotis, Panayotis ‘Billaras’ Karalis, Aristidis ‘Arukos’ Kiriakidis, Yannis ‘Kikias’ Kikiantonis and Stavros ‘Dallas’ Dalakas.USAlthough many people have contributed in distinctive ways to complete Erevos planning and Indiegogo campaign launch, there are two people who have put endless hours and disturbed consistently their wives by not being able to focus on anything else than Erevos the last few months: Yannis -johstas- Psychogiopoulos and Nikos -madnick- Mantasas.Yannis finished his studies in finance in 2004 and got a job at a consultancy. A few years later (2008), he completed his MSc in Management at London School of Economics and immediately got back to his previous employment. Ever since then though, he dreamed of the day when he would run a project he most passionately cared about. When the consultancy he worked for decided to let all employees go due to the Greek economic crisis a few months ago, Yannis saw an opportunity rather than a threat: He decided to develop Erevos. As a role-playing gamer, Yannis is very fond of complex characters and rich stories, ever since 1997 when he was first introduced to rpgs. He mostly likes role-playing situations that provide his characters with significant conflict of values. If you would like to talk to Yannis directly, visit his profile page in Facebook and send him a private message.Nikos studied engineering in Guildford (UK) and has changed a couple of jobs during the last ten years, that included a Store Manager position at the Greek multinational Germanos, an Account Manager position at a company distributing systems and services for geographical tracking and a Recycling Inspector for TuV Austria Hellas. He started playing rpgs consistently at high school (1995). He is a passionate collector of old-school rpg books, is a rules-lawyer and likes action-packed adventures (both in rpgs and movies). If you would like to talk to Nikos directly, visit his profile page in Facebook and send him a private message.RISKS & CHALLENGESOur main concern from day 1 was whether we would be able to provide with personalized service to every player that gets involved. We aim to have personal contact with every player, get to know his likes and dislikes. Given the relatively small size our company, we feel we do not have the resources to guarantee the top quality service we aim to offer to a very large amount of players. This is why we decided to offer growing characters (which is the core of our personalized service) to a limited number of players. The exact number has not been determined yet and will depend on several factors among which demand, the results of the b-playtest and generally how product development goes etc, but a good first estimation might be around 1,000. Apart from that, in order to give sandbox elements to the game, we decided to get feedback from the players after each rhapsody they complete and design their next rhapsody based on this feedback. We fear this might be very tough to handle without proper regulation. We therefore plan on setting up feedback template forms that will facilitate conclusions reaching but also allow space for personal comments.Another issue is the cost of writing an adventure (even a short one in a compact form - to view an example of play including a sample rhapsody click here) at a player by player level. To address this, we estimated the total adventure authors costs for a large volume of rhapsodies and decided it was not financially feasible to have them write for less than 4 people. This is why we decided that a minimum of 4 growing characters are required to form an adventuring party. Last but not least, to guarantee the highest product quality possible, we have already made preliminary agreements with several professionals well known at a global level within their area of expertise (adventure authors, fantasy writers, illustrators, map designer etc) and plan to contact many more!THE ARTISTSWe are in constant search to add highly skilled artists in our artistic team. The team so far includes:• Mr Herwin Wielink (:Theogonia city map - you can see a gallery of Herwin's previous works at his personal web site, some samples include Draconspire Tharstelding world map, Ankhor Deeps dungeon map etc), • Miss Anne Mohr (:Erevos world map - you can see a gallery of Anne's previous works at her deviantArt profile page, some samples include Alvarania map, Demera city map etc), • Mr Juan Carlos Barquet (:Sun's Tear illustration, but also Theogonia, Bonecrest and Nessima desert illustrations - you can see a gallery of Juan Carlos' previous works at his deviantArt profile page, some samples include the Winter Cottage illustration, the Sect etc) and• the Greeks George Melissaropoulos (Erevos art-director and cartoons expert), Kostas Foutsidis (:Lukom, Rolland and Zess sketches but also battles sketches) and Fotis Aradas.

story:
Arkabox is an arcade stick which integrates a mini-computer Raspberry Pi emulating most of the video game consoles which have marked the history of video games.

This innovative device enables you to play all your favorite retro games.


ALL YOUR  FAVORITE VIDEO GAME CONSOLES IN A BOX



No need to endlessly plug and unplug your favorite consoles or insert and remove your game cartridges. 



Arkabox is ready for use – you just have to load up your Raspberry Pi with whatever games you want to play either via a USB stick, an ethernet cable or a wireless USB adapter. 

We provide you with all possible legal contents as well as instructions for use. 

You do not have to be a specialist in computer programmes to have fun with Arkabox!


COMPATIBLE WITH ANY SCREEN/MONITOR



With Arkabox, you are not limited to a small-sized screen as is the case on traditional arcade cabinets.

Thanks to its HDMI output, the box is adaptable on any TV, PC monitor and even on videoprojectors!


PRECISE CONTROLS (with an arcade stick)



We conceived Arkabox control panel so that if offers the same gaming sensations as an arcade cabinet. The arcade stick is the control panel offering the maximum of precision. It is mostly used for fighting games.



A 8-way joystick and 9 control buttons allow you to enjoy a variety of available existing video games.



You would rather play with traditional game controllers ? Then use Arkabox as a traditional console! You can chose not to use the arcade stick and use game controllers instead. 



Thanks to its 4 USB ports, you can also connect a keyboard and a mouse to play more specific games like FPS games.


1, 2, 3 or 4 PLAYERS?



Make the Arkabox adventure even funnier by inviting your friends (or total strangers!) to play with you!

The box is equipped with 4 USB ports which give you the possibility to add up to 3 more controllers.

Chose to share the amazing Arkabox experience with 1, 2 or 3 players.

It is important to add that the game controllers provided in the ‘’Arkabox multi-controllers’’ pack (see below) are already configured.


SAVE YOUR PROGRESS!



Losing all your hard work in a game is sad! Arkabox includes a 8gb SD card which enables you to save your progress just like you do with classic consoles.


TRANSPORTABLE AND SMALL-SIZED



Thanks to its ’’all in one’’ concept, all components are integrated so that it does not require extra-equipment.

Arkabox is small-sized and easily transportable. You can bring it with you everywhere.


DESIGNED TO BE BOTH STYLISH AND ERGONOMIC



With its uncluttered contemporary style as well as its anodized aluminium-made panel, this retrogaming console will find a cosy place in your home!

We have also designed a tilted panel so that you can comfortably rest your hands while playing.

No more wrist pains and at last an ergonomic arcade box!

We really paid attention to the design of Arkabox, yet it can still evolve and be slightly different from this one in the picture.


THE WEB ALWAYS AT HAND !



Arkabox includes a mini computer Raspberry Pi B+ working with Linux so that you can go on the Internet and use the box just as a PC. To do so, you just have to connect a keyboard and a mouse.


SPECIFICATIONS


Ethernet input

4 USB ports

HDMI output

A 8-way joystick

9 buttons

Anodized aluminium-made panel

A raspberry Pi B+

8Gb Micro SD card


REWARDS



STRETCH GOALS






THE STORY BEHIND ARKABOX



Bcm corporation is a French company created by Romain Bruni and Bryan Cipolla.

We definitely have a passion for video games and more precisely for retrogaming. We were born in the 80s, when arcade cabinets became popular. Yet, these arcade machines are still bulky, their screen is small-sized and they are incredibly expensive.

From the beginning, our goal was to make arcade cabinets sensations affordable for everyone and to enjoy playing all our favorite games without the inconvenients of a classic arcade machine.

We already have several industrial prototypes which have been tested by a consumer pannel.

This pannel was composed of people from different age groups, some used to play games when they were young, others (youngers) were not familiar with this kind of games.

In both cases, they all really enjoyed the Arkabox adventure!

We need your help and support to start Arkabox mass production and to spread the concept worldwide.Besides, we keep on developing new products and concepts which always aim at improving gaming sensations and gamers lives!

Thank you! Please share our project via Facebook and Twitter!


EVOLUTION OF ARKABOX



RISK AND CHALLENGES


We have already produced 10 industrial prototypes. We are now ready for mass production. We are really confident as for the production step since we have already identified and eliminated all major risks and issues.

The main challenge concerns our suppliers. Indeed,  we are currently working with suppliers who provide us with small quantities. We strongly believe in their reliability and engagement. Yet, we hope they will be able to produce in great quantites while respecting delivery times.

Secondly, we have to rethink the place we work in. Since we have no big warehouse, we will have to reorganize our working place to have enough space to stock and build Arkabox. This will be necessary to deliver a high quality product and to meet delivery times.


PURCHASING AND SHIPPING


We want you to have your Arkabox as soon as possible, we plan to finalize shipping process in May 2015. 



SHARE ARKABOX AND WIN PERKS



We need you to share the campaign ! The top 2 referrers will be rewarded with two free gifts !

The first referrer will win an Arkabox Multi controllers and the second one a Classic Arkabox.

It’s easy :

- Log into your Indiegogo account

- Click on our sharing links section on our campaign page(below the video)

- Share the link with all your friends ! 


FAQ


Is Arkabox provided with games?

Games are protected by copyrights, this is why we cannot legally share them. In some countries, you can have copies of games you already possess. It's up to you to get informed about the copyright legislation of your own country.

How can I add games on Arkabox?

Adding games is very quick and as simple as a copy-paste. You just have to connect a USB stick or transfer games on Arkabox via Internet. Anyway, we provide you with full explanations.

How many games can be added on a 8Gb memory card?

Its depends on the size of your games. You can add from hundreds to thousands of games. You are likely to be quite busy until 2050!

How many people can play simultaneously?

Enjoy the Arkabox adventure alone or up to 4 gamers.

Is it possible to play alone or with other players without using the joystick?

With or whitout the joystick, it is up to you to chose the best configuration for your games.

Is it possible to modify Arkabox?

We created Arkabox to make it accessible for everyone, yet it remains evolutive and you can customize it. You can for example change a program, as well as the micro SD or the buttons.

Can I open beers with Arkabox?

We are conscious that today almost every new product can open beers. Even if Arkabox is highly resistant, we advise you to use a bottle opener.

You are a journalist or a very hot girl:

We are waiting for your questions…

everyone and to enjoy playing all our favorite games without the inconvenients
of a classic arcade machine.
We already
have several industrial prototypes which have been tested by a consumer pannel.
This pannel
was composed of people from different age groups, some used to play games when
they were young, others (youngers) were not familiar with this kind of games.
In both
cases, they all really enjoyed the Arkabox adventure!
We need your
help and support to start Arkabox mass production and to spread the concept
worldwide.Besides, we
keep on developing new products and concepts which always aim at improving gaming
sensations and gamers lives!
Thank
you! Please share our project via Facebook and Twitter!EVOLUTION OF ARKABOXRISK AND CHALLENGESWe have
already produced 10 industrial prototypes. We are now ready for mass
production. We are really confident as for the production step since we have
already identified and eliminated all major risks and issues.
The main
challenge concerns our suppliers. Indeed, 
we are currently working with suppliers who provide us with small
quantities. We strongly believe in their reliability and engagement. Yet, we
hope they will be able to produce in great quantites while respecting delivery
times. 
Secondly, we
have to rethink the place we work in. Since we have no big warehouse, we will
have to reorganize our working place to have enough space to stock and build
Arkabox. This will be necessary to deliver a high quality product and to meet
delivery times.PURCHASING AND SHIPPINGWe want you to have your
Arkabox as soon as possible, we plan to finalize shipping process in May 2015. SHARE
ARKABOX AND WIN PERKS
We need you to share the campaign ! The top 2
referrers will be rewarded with two free gifts !
The first referrer will win an Arkabox Multi
controllers and the second one a Classic Arkabox.

It’s easy : 
- Log into your Indiegogo account
- Click on our
sharing links section on our campaign page(below the video)
- Share the link with
all your friends ! FAQIs
Arkabox provided with games? 
Games are
protected by copyrights, this is why we cannot legally share them. In some countries, you can have copies of games you already possess. It's up to you to get informed about the copyright legislation of your own country.
How
can I add games on Arkabox?
Adding
games is very quick and as simple as a copy-paste. You just have to connect a
USB stick or transfer games on Arkabox via Internet. Anyway, we provide you with full
explanations.
How
many games can be added on a 8Gb memory card?
Its depends
on the size of your games. You can add from hundreds to thousands of games. You
are likely to be quite busy until 2050!
How
many people can play simultaneously?
Enjoy the
Arkabox adventure alone or up to 4 gamers.
Is it
possible to play alone or with other players without using the joystick?With or whitout the joystick, it is
up to you to chose the best configuration for your games.
Is it possible to modify Arkabox?
We
created Arkabox to make it accessible for everyone, yet it remains evolutive
and you can customize it. You can for example change a program, as well as the
micro SD or the buttons.
Can I open beers with Arkabox?
We are
conscious that today almost every new product can open beers. Even if Arkabox
is highly resistant, we advise you to use a bottle opener.
You
are a journalist or a very hot girl:
We are
waiting for your questions…

story:
Amazing to see ya all in this invention page.  Introducing NFC, Microsoft Tag, and QR Code based affordable business cards for everyone. This will help everyone to market their self-using this technological business card and eliminate the need if lost/missing business contact information. Just one tap and all the contact information will load on users smart phone/tablets/windows based devices.

This technological innovation help especially sales team of technological team to present their business contact in highly technological way to impress their clients since that company is all about technology.

If smart phone doesn’t have NFC, a printed QR code on the back of the card can offer to enter the essential contact information in users contact.

NFC, Microsoft Tags, QR Code equipped these long lasting pre-programmed business cards everywhere and keep your card with you all the time. Eliminate the need of printing cost of the business cards, missing cards during a meeting to make your first impact.

Keep minimum quantity of these business cards with you; even keep the card in your wallet.

Link to your personal webpage for more details about you and your portfolio that will be updated periodically by YOU to show your updated details, contact information.

story:
LAST HOUR !! Check what say the blog Ludoscopia about us !!

English / Castellano

And HOMO MEEPLE too !!... Click here

Hi, dear backers!!!

Imagine you have a few time and that are few players (less than ten) and you choose the way "There can be only one" ... In the end only rest three players: Charles, Sean and you. You shuffle the cards and deal one some each player. Charles receives a king who quickly discovers and laughs triumphantly !! Sean receives a dragon and uses his power to make you discard the queen you have and instead you rob another card, which is ... another king !! Take it out and see how the face of Sean when  losing his dragon against your two kings is a poem, as it is removed from the game!! Now, only Charles and you in the game, you have two lives and Charles have one. Charles deal and gives you ... a monk !! You kept that, because you know no mather what card have Charles, the power of the monk makes your card to the same level as his card, so you will have the same level and in case of tie lose all ... imagine the face of Charles when you take your card !!

This is the idea of Death Over The Kingdom: easy and fast game that at one point can play up to 20 people.  We are two fellows trying to get a game on the market that stands out for having a great art and that is just as much fun playing 20 playing four ...

The game is very fast and easy to learn, and so much fun to play. A card is dealt face-down to each player, beginning with the player on the right, and the deck of cards is placed to the right of the dealer. Once a card is dealt face-down to each player, the player on the right of the dealer starts playing. Each player during his/her turn may opt to take any of the following three actions:

1. Keep the dealt card and forego turn (known as stand).

2. Use the power of the card if it is allowed. Show the card and apply the power.

3. Exchange cards with the player on the right. If the player changing the card is the dealer, instead of exchanging it with the player on the right show the card, tell your intention to change it, cut the deck of cards and the card that comes up is your new card.

Once all players have gone through their turns all the cards are turn face-up. Following the playing order the card with powers meant to be use in the final round are played.

Once all the powers of the cards are enforced, the player or the players having the cards with the lowest value lose and take one token each. Death always loses if it is in play. The round ends once the tokens are hand out.

And this is only one of the three mode games we have in the game. In addition, we believe with that mechanism you will be able to create new forms of playing the game, so be our guest!!!

If you want, you can download a prototype with instructions here. Be fun !! and you could send your feedback if you want to sergio@dreamwithusstudio.com. Thanks in advance !!!

In Death Over The Kingdom there are two kind of cards: the cards you can use its power in your turn (the power is surrounded by a star in the card), and the cards with powers you can use at the end of a round (surrounded by an hexagon in the card)


1. Playing the Dragon in your turn allows you to destroy the card of the player on your right, and make him draw a new card.

2. The Knight must be played at the end of the round and forces all the Dragons in play to spin and show a level 6 instead of the 8 from the beginning.

If you like the illustrations you can see more in our web

We need 2.300 euros to be able to produce the game.


If we can reach this goal, the game have a two parts box made of cardboax, 26 cards, about 100 tokens and four "help cards" (two in english, two in spanish). We estimated four- five months until you have your game.

2.400 EUROS GOAL: All backers get the special card The archer totally free !!

2.500 EUROS GOAL: All backers get the special card The assasin totally free !!


If we reach the 2.600 euros goal, we include a black velvet bag to save the tokens and of course, the two specials cards !!

2.700 EUROS GOAL: All backers get the special card The Falconer totally free !!

2.800 EUROS GOAL:  All backers get the special card The Soldier totally free !!

At 3.000 euros we can offer a better quality box.

3.200 EUROS SPECIAL GOAL !! If we can reach to this goal we offer you 2 special cards that never be reprinted again !! ONLY EXCLUSIVE FOR YOU...

3.400 EUROS EXPANSION GOAL: All backers get all the above and the expansion game "DOTK: The Califato expansion" (we still working in the name lol), 13 new cards (twice each one) that you can integrate in the base game or play as a new game. Same rules, different effects, double fun !!!

Over 3.400 euros we got some ideas but we think first is first, baby steps. Help us to produce the game, reach the expansion goal and we can decide together new goals that we have in mind !!!

The level of pledges to reach all this are the next. All backer going to appear in our web with the name you say and your donation to thank your contribution.

- 1€ - Don´t want buy the game, but I support you... and we thanks you for that !!
- 5€ - Print and play version: You receive a pdf in high quality to print the game in your house and play with that... Thank you !!
- 18 € (only Spain) and 23€ (rest of the world) - Early bid: You are the first, you get a good discount... 28% !! Ship included to any country in both bids. You get the base game plus all the strechs goals we reach !!

- 25€ (Only Spain) and 30€ (rest of the world) - Ship included to any country in both bids. You get the base game plus all the strechs goals we reach !!

- 35€ - Base game, print and play version plus an pdf in high quality with all the art of the game... and all strech goals we reach !! Ship included.

- 75€ - Included 30-35€ bid plus a rug of 90x90 cm with an exclusive stampation (the color of the rug is not the definitive, we are talking with the printing for that), and the strech goals we reach. Ship included.


100€ - Poker face !! - Base game, all the strech goals, all the art in pdf, print and play version plus a card in the game... with your face !! yes !! All backers have a card with your face, you can choose wich one. You can replace the original card for your card !!

150€ Ultimate edition !! - The same as the poker face bid plus an limited and special edition of the box. We have a aged wood box with letters in gold stamped in the box. Inside the box have black velvet. All luxury, pal !!


220€ your way: the same as ultimate edition plusthe rug and a card designed totally by you: the illustration you want, the effect you want... even if you want to do a infinite sheldon you can !!!!

You can follow us in Facebook to be in touch with the new upgrades from Dead Over The Kingdom !!

Now, two things to finish!! First, forgive me for my poor English!! Sorry about that!! And second, lots of thanks for the effort of reading till here. You are priceless, buddy!!!
