story:
Thank you for stopping by and checking out Colonies End. Colonies End has been a project we have been working on for quite a while now, Initially a concept brought up 2 years ago, We have recently in the last couple of months brought the idea alive into a playable demo for you all to get a preview of what Colonies End will have to offer. Getting a playable demo out before the full game's release was very important to us here at Raw Orange Studios. We want to be able to form a community behind the game to allow people to give direct feedback and new ideas to add to Colonies End. We believe a game that is based around what fans and players want is a direction which is perfect for Colonies End. We hope you enjoy Colonies End and what it will become with your helpful support and look forward to hearing what you think.

Colonies End is an exciting indie game with a new take on the open-world sandbox genre exploring your way through dimensions in a sci-fi space setting! We are happy to announce our Indiegogo campaign and that with your support we can take this game from the demo/preview it is now into a truly exciting open world sandbox experience. We already have a playable demo to download but with a successful campaign Colonies End will offer:

  • Space-age combat with jetpacks, bounce pads, lasers and more!
  • Explore a strange world comprised of six-dimensional realms.
  • Build exciting spaceships and space colonies with 6 tech tiers.
  • Uncover the mysteries of the Desecrators and the lost expedition! 
  • Scavenge for resources to stay alive in the world’s unforgiving dimensions. 
  • Find creatures ranging from the common pig to the uncommon alien trader. With creatures also ranging from close ally to deadly foe. 
 

The building is primarily the core feature of Colonies End, it allows players to use gathered resources to craft a multitude of blocks which can later be used to create wacky spaceship or bases. To give Colonies End more progression, there are 6 distinct tech tiers, each making blocks more powerful and durable. For example, each tier of turret offers a more powerful projectile shot, causing more damage to enemy vessels or bases. 

One thing to note is that with higher-tech tiers, they require more power, meaning you need your structures to contain enough reactors to power your entire vessels.

 

Exploring is a crucial part of Colonies End, as you progress to higher-tech tiers, each tier of blocks requires unique resources only found in one type of dimension. In the later releases of the game, you will find that each dimension offers a unique set of NPCs and interactions for the player. For example, one planned dimension is "Aqua" this replaces the vacuum of space for liquid, causing all sorts of hassle for the player to move around. The "Aqua" dimension also offers alienated aquatic creatures such as huge oversized luminous jellyfish, whales and plant-based lifeforms.

 

We want Colonies End to be a true space game and that means both ship and ground battles! Already in the game's demo you will be able to see a preview of this such as how the ship combat has customization due to being linked with the building aspect of the game. We will be further expanding on this if we have a successful Indiegogo campaign. This will include the turret types and projectiles varying in both visuals and strength depending on which of the six tech tiers it is from, players will also be able to use a combination of tech tier blocks and so will NPC ships too! In battle ship turret types vary in there projectiles too between lasers and torpedoes, these are controlled both manually or automatic depending on the player's choice. Ground combat is exciting too with enemies being able to get close to attack a player or use a ranged attack depending on the enemy, we want to expand upon this with different player attacks as well as a melee attack option.

 

Please feel free to click the link to our Steam page below to download the game's demo.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1132540/Colonies_End/

 
 
 

Already we have made great progress with us at a point of releasing the first playable demo of Colonies End and launching this Indiegogo campaign ?! We have all of the core features of the game already and this can be seen in the playable demo, these features will be refined and expanded as well as additional features if successful, below are some images of other assets for the game which aren't in the demo but will in some form make their way into full release.

So you know where this project is up to, now we want to tell you our plan and how your support can help make this an awesome game! With a successful Indiegogo campaign we are going to be aiming to improve, enhance and bug fix the game in a large variety of ways, the key areas are:

  • Completion of five remaining dimensions and enhancing current.
  • A non-intrusive story set across the six dimensions!
  • More functionality to craftable blocks.
  • Side missions for players also adding in trading.
  • New sound system for the game featuring ambient soundtrack.
  • Overhaul of the NPC system such as a wider range of Desecrator enemies.
  • Modding support for custom blocks.
  • Overhaul of combat system such as traps, bounce pads, etc.
  • Full implementation of survival mechanics.
  • Flight or fight system (encouraging different play styles from players).

  • Expansion of player ship vs AI game mode!

 

Website: https://www.raworangestudios.org/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ColoniesEnd

Discord: https://discord.gg/CDsQuKc

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/raw_orange_studios/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaaFDru6mk-ZKKDXGYGj6ZA

The only risk to our project is time and it won't stop us from releasing our game!

Were enthusiastic and determined to see Colonies End at a stage our players and backers will enjoy push. Our current estimate for the project to be initially released is sometime late Q1 2020 with a final release sometime in Q2 and Q3 2020. Currently we are on track and we believe this timeline will give us enough time to gain valuable feedback from our games demo and to allow us to thoroughly bug test as well as to ensure all of the game features are completed!

If there were ever any major issues impacting the game we intend to always find the best possible way to overcome these issues and still release the game to the best of our standard. Any possible issues that could impact the project will always be made clear and backers would be informed as soon as possible.
